story:
Our Story

We're Asian Pop Addict. We're 3 female radio DJ's based out of Miami exposing the world to the awesomeness that is Asian music. We started our journey almost 3 years ago when we noticed that there weren't many fan made radio programs out there talking about not just the music that was being released but also giving the news, gossip, & breakdown of everything going on in the Asian scene. We pride ourselves on being real & straight forward with our thoughts and opinions. We are very much uncensored which we find a lot of people like us could relate to because we run the show the way we want and don't hold back on anything. Yes, we're only 3 years old but we have accomplished so much in just a few years. We have from fans in over 30 different countries around the world. We've held exclusive interviews with not only musical artist but with people who are close to your favorite celebrities such as choreographers, who give us all the behind the scenes details about your favorite artist.

Our Problem

One of the DJ's, Cyn works for a radio station but the studio they usual regularly has now become an issue because at the moment when APOPA needs it, it's either being used or it's out of order. This affects APOPA in pushing out a new show weekly which keeps the listeners unhappy. We love our listeners. They give us life in wanting to get better, in wanting to continue doing this show even though we don't get paid for it. We do this show because we LOVE IT! We would hate to see the day this show stops. There is no one out there like us. Don't let APOPA die. 

What We Need

Here's the breakdown of what we need. 

*Mixer

*Compressor

*Headphone amp

*3 or 4 Microphone Stands

*3 or 4 Microphones

*Wiring

*T drive

*PC Computer (For basic recording. Nothing fancy.) 

*Desk

If any money is left over it will go to paying APOPA bills. All the money will strictly go towards making Asian Pop Addict radio better. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!! If you love Asian pop just as much as we do and would like to have a high quality radio program break down each and every single news story going on, or if you want to hear the latest & greatest musical hits, than please help achieve our goal so we can continue.

 

EXTRA!

If you can use the credit card option more than the paypal option because I just realized paypal takes a percentage.  Soooooo no. lol Use credit card if you can.

story:
The Boys Need New Equipment!

Picture the worst drum kit you could imagine...that drum kit would laugh at our drum kit. Plain and simple, we are in dire need of new equipment. If we're going to reach our dreams and take the one in a million shot of making it big in the music industry, we're going to need some new gear to help us make it possible. Our drum kit falls apart and literally into pieces on stage, our guitarist still has a starter guitar and we don't even have room to transport our current equipment to gigs.

 

What We Need (Equipment):

  • Drum kit (including cymbals and hardware)
  • Guitar
  • Wireless headset microphone for the drummer
  • Drum cases 
  • Cymbal bags
  • Trailer (so we can travel and tour with our gear without sitting on a hi-hat stand the whole time)

What We Need to Do (Other Financial Barriers):

  • Record and master 4 songs for a new EP
  • Order hard copies of the new EP
  • Professional promitional photoshoot for
  • Copyright all of our songs
  • Collaborate with established musicians
  • Book venues
  • Tour with new EP

 

Thank you!


The Boys really appreciate anything you can do to help us out financially. Four university students don't make a lot of money and we don't want financial barriers to hinder us from reaching our potential as a band, so thank you from the bottom of all of our hearts.

Love,

Samantha, Sarah, Annette and Justine
The Boys

story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are Michael, Erik, and Ricky and together we make Eets Feats which is a surfy punk band based out of Austin, TX that has been together for over 3 years and has toured around the U.S.. Together all 3 of us have also started a music and art label/collective called Aye Aye Aye Tapes Escapes that we've used to release all of our music as well as other bands from America and France. We are currently raising money for our first 12" vinyl release for Eets Feats and as you may have guessed, it's super expensive so we need your help! By donating, you will make it possible for us to release a rad record for all of your turntable needles to groove on and it will also help us realize our dream of putting out an Eets Feats record on 12" wax. With this record release we are also hoping to use the money made from the record sales to continue to put out other projects in the future on Aye Aye Aye.


What We Need

We are co releasing this record with Threadpull Records which is a fellow local label in Austin so we only need to raise half of expenses for pressing and promotions. With all that donate you will be guaranteed a record and will also receive all kinds of good goods made by our hands and delivered to yours. Any contributions will help immensely and even if we don't reach the goal it is still money that will all go towards our goal of releasing this record this fall.

This campaign will fund:

$1500 for pressing the vinyl 

$600 for pressing the jackets

$150 for shipping of these materials.




What You Get

"Trash From Our Lips" Record cover art by Melanie Meehan



Limited edition T-shirt on your back! S/M/L available.

Image ready to be made into a poster for you!

Seafoam Chaffa cassette tape. Art work by Brian Duff.

27X38in Framed "Trash From Our Lips" artwork for limited edition tour cassette tape.


The Impact

By contributing even a small sum of money you will help individuals release music and art that they believe in and care deeply about. It will also aid in the survival of independent labels and distributors who simply release music as a labor of love because we don't make money by doing this. All we want to do is make enough to keep doing the only thing that makes sense to us and continue to do what we love. We feel that our band and the label we've created can make a positive impact on Texas' music and art scene as well as others. In other words by supporting our music as Eets Feats you will also be contributing to any other bands that we have releases for on our label Aye Aye Aye Tapes Escapes because the music we create was the initial monetary driving force that allowed us to continue putting out the music of others.


Other Ways You Can Help

Money contribution isn't everything, any help with spreading the word about what we or similar minded individuals are doing can go a long way so let the world know what we are doing. Even if you can't contribute to this project you should help by going out and supporting your local music scene and realizing that it's something special.

story:
Kirtana Americana


hello friends.  I am a world beat music artist who has been involved in spiritual music for almost 20 years. I perform at festivals, gatherings and yoga studios and am getting ready to put out a new cd  that mixes east and west in a funky new way.
     The recording, which I've named Kirtana Americana, is already complete. I recorded it in a famous studio called the Power Station and the music features really amazing musicians I've worked with over the years. Some of these musicians include Tony Levin ( Peter Gabriel , King Crimson ),  JT Thomas ( Bruce Hornsby band ) Visvambhar 'Vish' Sheth ( the Mayapuris ) and Ron Holloway ( Govt Mule/Allman bros).  Needless to say , making this CD was a labor of Love.  I'm really happy the way it turned out, and if you like Kirtan music, I'd describe it as a rocking and live sounding recording that features amazing musicians. I did not 'edit it to perfection' or cut and paste loops of a few measures, it is not guided by a click track. we recorded most of it Live, so it has a lot of soul.

this is the first time I have tried to use crowd funding for one of my recordings. I am not working with any corporations or trying to fit into a certain 'sound' that fits a style or genre.  It is a very original recording that was made for my friends, family and lovers of yoga music performed by great players.

Also, this CD really features Visvambhar 'Vish' Sheth, the bandleader of the Mayapuris.  He drums beautifully ( a master of the mridangam ), sings and plays harmonium. I believe in supporting younger musicians in their process and Vish is one of the greatest, most sincere, musicians/devotees in the modern Kirtan movement, it is  my great honor to be able to feature his playing and Bhav.

I am also very happy with the audio quality of this recording. The Power Station, where it was recorded, is a famous studio that is owned by legendary producer Tony Bongiovi. Spending a few moments in the studio with him was a dream come true. His engineers were first class and it was inspiring to record on the same equipment that was used in the past by some of the most famous recordings in Rock History.
Mics that Sinatra used, great from Motown, etc.  A Studio geek like me was in audio heaven.

Between the key players and engineers; the total experience represents hundreds of years of playing, performing and mixing. All this dedicated to celebrating the divine name with music and love. Even my Guruji, Dr Deepak Kapoor, phoned in a blessing, around which we created a cool track . I hope you choose to endorse this recording by contributing something to this effort.


I'm asking the universe ( and you ) to help me raise $3000 !


  • this will cover the duplication of the CD, create tour posters and help launch a small winter tour of yoga studios.
  • Since the recording is already finished, every donation will help get the music out. You will receive mp-3's of the recording immediately, as well as heartfelt thanks and prayers of gratitude

The Impact


  • as you can imagine, it is not easy producing, performing and touring with sacred music, but the community and friends that I have met over the last 20 years has made it all worthwhile.
  • This is my 4th CD, but my first that is exclusively a yoga/kirtan album. I have already sold around 10,000 CD's in the past, I'm hoping Kirtana Americana reaches even more.  It represents many of the best things about the yoga community - real friendship, deep practice and a few miracles all happened in the studio.  I hope that together we will be able to share that energy with the larger community. There are millions of American Yogis and Yogini's out there,this cd is for them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but you can still help.

please like my music page on facebook and help get the word out, and if you happen to be in a city where my tour hits, please facebook me and I'll be happy to put you on the guest list so you can enjoy a performance.

  • as Indiegogo says '  please help to  get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • if you can, please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

thank you !

please like my music page on facebook and help get the word out, and if you happen to be in a city where my tour hits, please facebook me and I'll be happy to put you on the guest list so you can enjoy a performance.

as Indiegogo says '  please help to  get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
if you can, please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

thank you !

story:
Never Too Late… for Time Travel

I believe music inspires us to higher heights and brighter futures.  And music can document and change how we interact with each other as creators and collaborators. 

I am J. Plunky Branch, saxophonist, producer, band leader and songwriter.  My career spans over 40 years, during which time I have performed countless gigs, toured the world, lectured, mentored, written over 400 songs and produced and released 25 albums.

My mission is to create music that is a bridge between past and future, music that creates new possibilities; and then to take that music to the people via touring and
exposure through various media.

I am seeking your support in a campaign to raise funds to manufacture and market my new CD album, NEVER TOO LATE.  (Look at the benefit levels over on the right)

My History

In 1967, while a student at Columbia University in New York City I formed my first band called the Soul Syndicate, a rhythm and blues group that was described as “14 pieces of driving soul.”  After leaving college I migrated to San Francisco where I performed with a South African Musician, Ndikho Xaba, for three years.  In 1972, I formed Juju, a band dedicated to performing acoustic avant garde jazz blended with
traditional African and Afro-Cuban rhythms. 

Over the years my group evolved through name changes (from Oneness of Juju to Plunky & Oneness) and several incarnations,while exploring various genres and combinationsof Black music, including: R&B, jazz, funk, neo-soul, Afro-beat, go-go, reggae, and hip-hop.  In recent years several of our recordings from the 1970’s and 80’s have been re-issued by European and Japanese labels, re-mixed by rare groove deejays and, sampled by US hip-hop producers and rappers looking for unique rhythms and sounds for their hip-hop beats.

     

The New Album

Never Too Late (to step up to the plate - click the button to make a pledge now)

NEVER TOO LATE is our latest multi-genre collection of songs.  It includes neo-soul, love songs, funky go-go, and jazzy instrumentals.  The 15 song album is a
diverse but cohesive blend of music for listening and dancing. 

The album contains tracks that were produced by using samples from some of our earlier Afro-jazz funk records, and adding overdubs to create nu-jazz and nu-funk.

Sampling our own early recordings and creating new cutting edge tracks is like musical time travel: revisiting the past to create music of the future.  My
son, Jamiah “Fire” Branch, has become my principal producer of tracks for my
latest albums and that makes the trans-generational, past-future aspect of the
music more manifest.  Obviously, it is never too late for anything if time travel is involved…

In producing this NEVER TOO LATE album Fire and I have spent countless hours recording, mixing, re-mixing the tracks and then tweaking the sounds to create a set of music that is listenable from beginning to end, an album of music to move people, and a compilation of songs that we truly believe people will embrace. 

Buy one of our benefit packages and help keep music and culture alive...

                                   

When I grow up I would like to be like Diana Nyad, the woman who recently swam from Cuba to Florida at 64 years old; or like Jack LaLanne; or George Clinton; or Nelson Mandela; or like so many others who demonstrate that “age ain’t nothing but a number” and it’s never too late: to live your dream, to be what you might have been, or to be right on time.

I hope what I have done over my 40 year career is worthy of your consideration.  I hope my continuation is worthy of your contribution.  I hope my mission is
worthy of your support.

The Budget

$2,500 – mastering, cover art, manufacturing 1,000 CD’s

$2,500 – for online and radio promotion & public relations

Additional funds raised will be used for additional promotion and touring

 

We need your support...

You can purchase some of the great benefits we have listed and you can also help by spreading the word about this campaign to all of your friends and contacts via email, social media and the indiegogo share tools.   Let's Make some noise!

Place your order for the new album, NEVER TOO LATE... but the sooner the better!

You can help us realize our dream of releasing some great new songs and having some soulful fun while gathering and inspiring fellow movers, shakers and progressive dreamers. 

Remember, it's never too late, but don't wait...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dwRfBghcJJw&feature=em-upload_owner

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! I'm super excited to be working on my very first EP! 

A little bit of background: I'm a singer-songwriter in Madison, WI. I started writing my own music about three years ago, and have played many live shows and collaborated with other local musicians since.

Here's where I need help; putting together a record is not a cheap project! I need to compensate everyone involved: from the production to the artwork to the guest musicians featured on the EP. I am extremely grateful to have access to so many talented people!

What I Need & What You Get

The details:

  • The EP: 6 heartfelt original songs (ok, one might be a little goofy!), recorded in Beth Kille's studio. Featuring me on guitar, piano, ukulele and vocals. Gabe Burdulis is playing lead guitar on two songs, and bass on one of those songs. Eric Geane is drumming for a song. Olivia Nordeng is singing backup vocals for a song. Danny Atwater is playing accordion on my piano song. It will be be quite the little mix! 
  • I set my goal for $1000 - this will cover recording fees, mastering, printing the CDs and their sleeves, compensating the guest musicians, getting a logo design and album artwork, and various other merch items (tshirts, stickers, buttons, etc)
  • I have set many perks - from low-cost basic items, to fun experiences such as a living room serenade and me cooking dinner for you!  If there is a perk that you'd like that I don't have available, please let me know, and I'll either add it or customize it to fit your needs!
  • If I don't hit the $1000, the funds I do raise will first go directly to the production of the album. If there have been merch perks claimed, I will get those specific merch items for contributors, but wait to make additional merch until after the EP is completely paid for.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you that can't contribute financially, but want to support this project:

Spread the word! Word of mouth is the most powerful tool!

I also always accept encouragement and high fives/hugs! :) 

Thank you for all your support thus far, and I can't wait to share my music with you!

Here's a taste of one of the songs that will be on the EP: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VOc26oZhTko&amp...

(campaign photo by Ferris.B Photography - more to come with the EP!)
story_txt:
Short Summary
 Hey everyone! I'm super excited to be working on my very first EP! 
A little bit of background: I'm a singer-songwriter in Madison, WI. I started writing my own music about three years ago, and have played many live shows and collaborated with other local musicians since.
Here's where I need help; putting together a record is not a cheap project! I need to compensate everyone involved: from the production to the artwork to the guest musicians featured on the EP. I am extremely grateful to have access to so many talented people!   What I Need & What You Get The details: 
The EP: 6 heartfelt original songs (ok, one might be a little goofy!), recorded in Beth Kille's studio. Featuring me on guitar, piano, ukulele and vocals. Gabe Burdulis is playing lead guitar on two songs, and bass on one of those songs. Eric Geane is drumming for a song. Olivia Nordeng is singing backup vocals for a song. Danny Atwater is playing accordion on my piano song. It will be be quite the little mix! 
I set my goal for $1000 - this will cover recording fees, mastering, printing the CDs and their sleeves, compensating the guest musicians, getting a logo design and album artwork, and various other merch items (tshirts, stickers, buttons, etc) I have set many perks - from low-cost basic items, to fun experiences such as a living room serenade and me cooking dinner for you!  If there is a perk that you'd like that I don't have available, please let me know, and I'll either add it or customize it to fit your needs! If I don't hit the $1000, the funds I do raise will first go directly to the production of the album. If there have been merch perks claimed, I will get those specific merch items for contributors, but wait to make additional merch until after the EP is completely paid for.


 
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 For those of you that can't contribute financially, but want to support this project:
Spread the word! Word of mouth is the most powerful tool!
I also always accept encouragement and high fives/hugs! :) 
 Thank you for all your support thus far, and I can't wait to share my music with you!Here's a taste of one of the songs that will be on the EP: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VOc26oZhTko&amp...(campaign photo by Ferris.B Photography - more to come with the EP!)

story:
About the Project

Hello, Supporters! I'm Kristin Grice, AKA Kam and I am a singer/songwriter currently performing in and around the Orlando, Florida area. This campaign is to help finish production on my EP, All Or Nothing, which is an amazing project because of the message the music stands for. All or Nothing is the chosen theme for this EP because I want to give back to the audience and share my music, which is about never giving up on your dreams, fighting for what you believe in, and learning to be yourself. By donating to this project, supporters will help get the message out there, join in with creating inspirational music, and continued the motivation artists have to do what we love.

What We Need & What You Get

Our main goal is $1500. This price covers CD printing, studio time, session time with the other musicians to come into the studio and lay down tracks for my songs. Our main focus is to finish making the EP so the funds we are asking for is dedicated to helping finish the project that we've already started on. 
Some of the perks we provide for donations ranges from exclusive email updates, digital downloads of the tracks, signed CDs, tickets to the EP release show, a web concert link, song lyrics, thank you letters, and even a signed guitar. If the goal is not made, the funds will still go towards finishing what we can of the CD and continuing to find a way to finish the EP because that is the promise that is made to the supporters and fans.

Challenges & Ways to Help

Some of the challenges that will be presented with this campaign is promotion. I have a loyal following, but I've been booking shows at different locations and that has been tricky, so the need to promote is our biggest challenge. We also have other campaigns running in the same area as we do and our goal is to plug our campaign as hard and as long as we can. 
The ways that you can assist us in this if you can't donate is promote, promote, promote. Pass on the information to other venues, copy the link and paste it on other sites, promote on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and anywhere else that will be beneficial. Getting the word out there is the greatest tool you have to help out! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share Tools on the website.

More than anything, this project is a stand still and it has been at a rest for almost a year now. I've done all I could to help out alone, but now I am asking for assistance. If you are unable to donate, please promote this project. The message behind this EP is important and it helps musicians like myself, all local musicians, continue doing what we love. We love this job and we want to keep creating music for everyone. Please help keep that dream alive whether it's here on this EP or anywhere else. 

Thank you!

story:
My Story

My name is Amanda Bentley. I sing. I play bass. I write songs. I am endorsed by Fender. I am writing a new album.


The Goal

I have an opportunity to make my first music video with director Karl Ritcher. Karl recently shot a video for the Foo Fighters new single "Dear Rosemary".  


What do I need? 

I am trying to raise $10,000. Wowsas! I know! I want to deliver the best quality product that I can. When you hear the single, you'll understand why. You are helping to make a dream come true.


What's in it for you?

Donations of $10 or more will get a free download of the new single.

Donations of $100 or more will get a free download of the new single, an autographed guitar pick and photo.

Donations of $500 or more will get a free download of the new single, an autographed guitar pick and photo PLUS I will personally bake you some of my famous homemade chocolate chip cookies and ship them to you.

**NEW PERK!** Donate $5000 and get a featured role in the music video!


Other Ways You Can Help

The best way anyone can help is to spread the word! Share my links, be a fan and tell the world!

story:
Our Story

My name is Ariana Proehl, and I created the online talk show Know This! because I was fed up with the lack of empowering images in our mainstream media. We are way more interesting and diverse than the tons of housewives shows we see, and all the debauchery on Jersey Shore. I wanted to create a platform to highlight all the next generation voices out there doing amazing work with real passion and purpose, and who make knowing yourself and knowing your world look cool and sexy.


I didn't create this show because I want to be on TV--I've actually been confronting a lot of self-esteem issues with being on camera and putting my voice out there to the public. I created it for the message to remind viewers that stories that educate and empower can be entertaining, too. So I thought, what better way to show and prove that than to take this show on the road! And because I'm ambitious (and sure, a little crazy :), I put together a 16-city U.S. tour to capture the essence of what amazing work is being done by youth, 20- and early 30-somethings around the country.


Here's where we're going:

New York City (done!) – Philadelphia (done!) – Pittsburgh – Detroit – Ann Arbor - Chicago – Milwaukee – San Francisco/Bay Area – Los Angeles – Austin - Houston – New Orleans – Atlanta – Raleigh-Durham – Richmond – Washington, D.C.


The Impact

I can say from the experience of our first two tour stops, that our tour is inspiring people to reflect on their true passions and find the confidence to go after their dreams. Every person we've reached out to about being on the show has been excited to be a part and let us in on the work their doing, as well as give personal insights as to how they made it to where they are today. We're also having great discussions about politics and social change, and showcasing younger voices that we don't typically see on CNN or other news shows.


Now more than ever, when our nation is lacking jobs, confidence and a lot of other things, we need a next generation that feels empowered, inspired and prepared to be their best selves and be actively engaged with their communities. Do we really want a next generation of leadership that has grown up on Snooki? And cat fights? Media is a reflection of our values and our aspirations--advertisers feed us what we're willing to buy and pay attention to. There's always room for some mindless fun and a good laugh at those reality shows, but it's also time for us to reflect not just the lowest denominator, but what the best of who we are and what we can be. Enough with the sex tapes and newsflashes of "nip-slips." I believe in you and believe that your Knowledge of Self is Sexy. The question is, do you?


What We Need & What You Get

All funds go toward our travel budget that includes rental car, airfare and food. We have some initial funding that has launched the tour, and we're looking for those who watch and believe in the mission of the show to help keep us on the road for all 16 cities in our tour plan!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you have any contacts to local media (radio, TV, print) in any of the cities we listed, please let us know! We'd love to share our message wherever we can! Please contact tour@knowthis.tv with that info.


Also, if you have any discounts on hotels, or an apartment you're not using in any of our stops that you wouldn't mind letting us know about, that is also greatly appreciated. Please contact tour@knowthis.tv as well.


Last but not least, if you know of colleges or organizations that would want to host a talk about what we're doing with the show, or one of the talks I give with my speaking services, please reach out to bookings@knowthis.tv

story:
"Start Up" Summary

My name is Bryton Udy and I am from Calgary AB Canada. Over the past year i have stepped away from my hockey career and pursue my life long passion, music. Being so close to making something out of hockey, it was tough to step away but in my gut I knew that there was something else in my life that would drive me. And this is why this project means so much to me.

To get the ball rolling on my music career I have decided to record a 6 track EP of original songs that I have written over the past 3 years. This EP will be recorded by a first class producer as well as some of the best studio musicians from North America and im very excited! Along with the EP I plan to promote it with a music video to by a top notch videographer.

Your contributions will be the first step on the long journey of my music and will be the reason I go where I will go! I am determined to make something of my music and am looking forward to having you on my team to join me on this ride!

 

Where the Funds Go

Break it down for folks in more detail:

$10,000 will make my vision a reality and every penny will go into the production of the music, the manufacturing of the hard copies, the uploading onto iTunes and the video.

Production/Mastering- $7100

Hard Copy's- $700

iTunes- $250

Music Video- $2000

if I'm not successful in achieving my funding goal the EP will still be produced and manufactured but it will take much longer and the quality of the sound of the tracks wont be as nearly as good.

Your Impact

The impact that all the pledgers make will be amazing! I have won awards in talent contests, performed in front of hundreds of people, and i have recorded 2 acoustic songs that is played on Calgary's UP! 97.7 radio station. Your donations will really kick things into gear!

Spread the Word!

Please tweet, share, retweet, yell anything to spread the word! tell your mom, dad, grandparents, kids, nanny, dentist, anyone you can! I REALLY apreciate it!!! :D

 

Also check out the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page to view a possible cover photo, as well as a scratch track of one of the songs to be on the EP!

story:
Campaign Summary

Hi!  I'm Riley Roth, a 14-year-old award-winning Singer/Songwriter from Pennsylvania.  I just returned from my 2nd anti-bully tour within 8 months, where I was a co-headliner. Both tours have included former Radio Disney Artists. I've visited many schools to share the message to "Stand and Defend and Be a Friend".  I take this very seriously and was proud to complete this mission! My family and I covered all of my touring expenses. This expense is a lot. However, my anti-bullying efforts are important.  

I was recently asked to write the theme-song for Girls Above Society, a non-profit organization helping young girls become positive role models.  I was also featured in their online magazine as “Girl of the Month” in April and had a feature interview with Pop Blitz Magazine.  My anti-bullying song, “I Got Your Back”, was a monthly winner in the Texaco Country Showdown National Songwriting Contest in 2012.  This song encourages others to be a friend.  I am determined to continue spreading the word to STAND and DEFEND against bullies!  This summer I hope to record some songs in Nashville with a new producer and will be donating a portion of proceeds to Centre County Special Olympics.  Having a sister with special needs, I know that this group is often the most bullied.

I'm working with an amazing vocal coach and recently won the "Progress Award", awarded by the Throga Company in NY.  I'm RILED up and ready to record some new songs!  The only thing holding me back is the expense.  I've shared some of my new music with several industry pros who feel that I'm ready - both as a singer AND a songwriter.  I am also collarborating with pro writers in Nashville to find the best music.  With your help, I know I can do this!  This campaign is so important to me. I want to continue to take an active role in stomping out bullying and being a friend.  I do this through sharing messages, my music, and serving as a positive role-model to others.  I cannot keep up with touring expenses AND recording new music on my own.  I hope you will consider helping me continue down this path.  Your contribution, no matter how great or small, will be so appreciated!

What I Need & What You Get

I am hoping to record at least 4 songs on an EP.  If I raise more, I will record more.  It is very expensive to go into the studio.  There are fees for licensing, musicians, production, tracking, mixing mastering, and of course travel to/from Nashville.  I cannot do this on my own!

I have established some great prizes for you, if you help me out!  Please check over the list on the side to see what you can get.  * In addition, if I receive funding beyond my goal, I will randomly give away a free pair of tickets to see Keith Urban in concert at the Bryce Jordan Center (University Park, PA) on November 22! These seats will be located within the first 17 rows in the floor, in front of the stage!  The recipient must meet me in person at a designated time on the day of the show, and enter the venue with me, to get your tickets.  These are paperless tickets so they must be picked up all together.  You are responsible for your own travel/lodging and other related expenses. This is not a raffle, as no tickets are being sold. These are not being awarded as a prize to any contest.  They are being offered as a "thank you gift" to one randomly selected donor.

The Impact

This project is so valuable to me becasue it will enable me to share music and my message.  My lyrics are appropriate and most all songs have a message to young people.  Sometimes the message is about being a friend.  Sometimes it's a message to show what can happen when you go down the wrong path. Sometimes is a message about how you feel when you've been hurt by a friend or boyfriend/girlfriend.  I want to share sonhgs which teens can relate to.

Please note that if this project doesn't fund enough to record at least 4 songs, all money will be saved aside until additional funds are secured, at which time the project will be completed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, please consider helping out by spreading the word about my campaign.  You can share on instagram, twitter, facebook, etc. and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Helping my campaign go viral will increase visibility and that in itself is a huge help!

Most importantly, I'd like to thank all of those who have helped to support me these last few years.  I couldn't do what I do, if you didn't do what you do.  You make my heart SMILE :)  Remember - Stand and Defend and BE a FRIEND!  Thank you!

story:
Who we are

Gran Turismo Veloce is an Italian progressive rock band. We have been playing across Europe and in Mexico for the past two years after the release of our acclaimed debut album "Di Carne, di Anima". For our second album we prepared something special, and we need your help for it to become a reality.

How the music business went wrong

The hard truth is that if you are not distributed by a Major it is virtually impossible to grow a solid fan base. And today, without a wide fan base, the record labels don't take you into consideration. Rather a vicious circle, isn't it? And yes, this is the truth, because it is exactly what the chairmen of the two most important progressive labels in the world told us when we spoke with them during our 2012 tour.

An offer they can't refuse

We and you are partner in this adventure.

On our part, we are ready to record a new album at Sphere Studio in London with TesseracT producer Francesco Cameli on the mix; orchestral parts will be played live, by real musicians, and we'll have stunning session men from all over the world as well.

On your part, by showing how much you care about our second album, you will convince the record labels there is still a strong interest in new music.

What we need...

As we said, we are partners: the budget for our next album is around 25.000 €. We gathered around 10.000 € by ourselves and we hope the rest will come with your help. Don't worry: we will make the album no matter what, so you don't waste your money in any case.

Here is the detailed budget breakthrough:

STUDIO EXPENSES

Travel expenses to London 1.000 €
Orchestra tracking 7.000 €
Drums tracking 2.000 €
Guitar tracking 2.000 €
Piano and keys tracking 2.000 €
Voice tracking 2.000 €
Editing 1.000 €
Mix & mastering 8.000 €
TOTAL 25.000 €

CAMPAIGN EXPENSES

Fundraising goal 20.000 €
Indiegogo fees (4%) -800 €
Credit card fees (3% rounded) -600 €
Cost of Perks (20% rounded) -4.000 €
TOTAL 14.400 €

RECAP

GTV fund 10.000 €
Indiegogo fund 14.400 €
TOTAL 24.400 €

...and what you get

Not in the mood for charity? Then be selfish and claim our amazing perks!

Other ways you can help

Money is everything, they say. It's false! If you can't afford any of the above, don't worry! You still have many opportunities to help us:

        • Tell your friends about this campaign;
        • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter… whatever you prefer;
        • Share our video and help it become viral.

Bottom line is: SHARE! Help us spreading this campaing. The many you are, the better we can make our album and the more we can succeed. We are in your hands (and fingers - click - and mouths - talk!)


FAQ's

When will the album come out?

We have not announced a release date as of yet but will communicate that to you as soon as we get the deal with the label. Early 2014 is our best guess.

What if you don't reach the 20.000€ goal?

We'll find some way to gather what's missing to at least make a quality album. If no record label would greenlight our product, we will auto-produce the album. So, in any case, you won't loose your money and you'll get the perks you picked.

When will my stuff ship?

Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital perks will be emailed to everyone at least 15 days prior to official release.

How do I pay for the shipping outside Italy?

After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package, you can increase the contribution amount by € 6, 7, or 10 (please see perk description).

I forgot to pay for the international shipping!

No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original.
story_txt:
Who we are
Gran Turismo Veloce is an Italian progressive rock band. We have been playing across Europe and in Mexico for the past two years after the release of our acclaimed debut album "Di Carne, di Anima". For our second album we prepared something special, and we need your help for it to become a reality.
How the music business went wrong
The hard truth is that if you are not distributed by a Major it is virtually impossible to grow a solid fan base. And today, without a wide fan base, the record labels don't take you into consideration. Rather a vicious circle, isn't it? And yes, this is the truth, because it is exactly what the chairmen of the two most important progressive labels in the world told us when we spoke with them during our 2012 tour.
An offer they can't refuse
We and you are partner in this adventure.
On our part, we are ready to record a new album at Sphere Studio in London with TesseracT producer Francesco Cameli on the mix; orchestral parts will be played live, by real musicians, and we'll have stunning session men from all over the world as well. 
On your part, by showing how much you care about our second album, you will convince the record labels there is still a strong interest in new music.
What we need...
As we said, we are partners: the budget for our next album is around 25.000 €. We gathered around 10.000 € by ourselves and we hope the rest will come with your help. Don't worry: we will make the album no matter what, so you don't waste your money in any case.
Here is the detailed budget breakthrough:

story:
What started as a dream as an adolescent, become an obsession about a year ago. Since then, every morning I wake up, the first thought on my mind is about being in the studio. But before I go any further, have a listen to the songs on my SoundCloud or YouTube page and be sure to check out my artist page as well!

My name is Tedy Fugel and I M.A.K.E. Music, which is also the name of my record label (Making Audibly Kool Electronic Music). The songs were all produced on my MacBook by creating, looping and arranging sounds using Garageband and a MIDI controller (keyboard). I have no prior knowledge of any music production or theory, nor do I know how to play any instruments. Yet I still succeeded in producing these songs. There was a lot of time, dedication and discipline that went behind making this album as well as strategic business moves to get it placed with certain digital retailers. Among them is Beatport.com, the world’s largest digital retailer of dance music and DJ equipment. Also, not coincidentally, the spot where David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Tiesto – really, anybody who’s anybody in the electronic dance music (EDM) game – first debut their music.

 

WHY YOU ARE READING THIS

The purpose of this campaign is to build my momentum an artist/producer and as business man while connecting with listeners through M.A.K.E. Music. I’ve already invested time and money in getting where I’m at today, however, I’m taking this obsession of mine to the next level by growing my record label which in turn would allow me to sign, network and collaborate with other artists and producers, as well as expand on my music production skills. This movement will be accomplished by being a part of the Collective at Icon!

 

WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR

To cover some of these costs, I’ve estimated I need to raise $15,000. Your contribution will not only help this movement of mine see the light of day, but it will also put me on the road that I need to be and stay on. To your right, you will see the breakdown of contribution options and their corresponding perks. For every set dollar amount you decide to contribute you will receive the perk associated with it. At the end of the day, I’m a strong believer in going after something that you are passionate about and turning it into a reality. Running a record label as well as producing EDM professionally is my passion, so lets do it together!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can't contribute? No problem! You can still help by spreading the word about this campaign by shearing the link below via Facebook, Twitter, Google +, Instagram etc. or anyway you know how.

http://igg.me/at/make-music/x/3453162

story:
The Gist

We are an indie rock band from Eau Claire, WI. We have recorded two EPs, two full-lengths, just released a new single, and are currently working on recording new music which will be released in early fall as either an EP or a new LP. We have done three southern US/east coast tours over the past three years, and are going to set off on another tour this August.

We need your help in order to fund part of our tour and music making (van repairs, gas, food, production and manufacturing of music). This is very important to us as we would love yet another opportunity to share our songs with great, enthusiastic people in multiple live settings over our three week tour. We are also planning on starting a PR campaign in order to promote the EP/LP online as well as a rerelease of our last full length, "Ordinary Fantasy." The cost for the campaign is $675, so this will help with a bit of that. 

Among several other venues, our tour is taking us to The Mile of Music Festival (Appleton, WI), The Empty Bottle (Chicago, IL), PIANOS (Manhattan, NY), Funk n' Waffles (Syracuse, NY), The Castle Theater (Bloomington, IL),  and The Rock County Folk Symposium (Janesville, WI). 

We have a Facebook event for each show on tour, which can be viewed here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/299008460280381...

What We Need & What You Get

As far as the funding goes, we are asking for a flat $1,000 for our upcoming August east coast tour, and to help us release our upcoming EP. Cost breakdowns:

$200 for van repairs (she's got 275,000 miles)

$300 for gas (about half the estimated cost)

$150 to help feed Addie, Leo, Jake and Dave healthy food on tour

$250 for EP manufacturing

$200 for PR Campaign (again, a small fraction of the cost)

$200 new order of Ordinary Fantasy CDs to sell on tour and beyond

In the column at the right, you can view our "Perks", where you get AWESOME STUFF for donating.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're strapped for cash, you can help us for free!

    • Share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter to help us spread the word.
    • Share our campaign with friends who might be interested in donating.

story:
Short Summary

I have been making music since I was 9 years old. It's the biggest passion in my life. It's lead me to make some interesting decisions in my life - Good and Bad. It's all I know. It's all I am.
This record is everything the last 16 years of my life has been preparing me for. I could not be more proud of it. Out of the countless bands, releases, and friends records, this is the one that I feel the most true about. I can't wait to get it into your hands, ears, and hearts.

What We Need & What You Get

That's where you come in! Though I'm very lucky to have covered the recording costs out of my own pocket, that is probably the least expensive part of making a record. Getting it out to all of you is the part that can ruin a man financially with no big label fronting the cash.
I'm asking for $2,000. This will go to mastering the record so it sounds pretty for all of you, as well as digital and physical distribution. This is a VERY small amount, but through the years of making records, I've been graced by the presence of some good people that are willing to "Bro-deal" me for all of the above. However, that doesn't make it very doable on my own. I've already poured a lot of money, sweat, tears, and gasoline into making this album. Without you, it may never see the light of day in the way it should! This record deserves to be heard the right way and you all deserve to hear it at the best of it's ability. Without you, this cannot happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Facebook charges artists to get their posts seen. It's so unfair and it kills me. I understand that we all have financial issues these days, so if you can't give monitarily, you can always spread the word! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter - whatever! You spreading the word about this means so much to me. Like the Facebook page, recommend it to your friends, talk about it in the real world away from a computer! Word of mouth is how every great band gets it's recognition. Let's start doing that again. Independent artists need you to talk about them so that they can stay independent and keep making the music you love and the music they love to make, without big labels or big producers getting in the way and changing it for the worse! The listeners are the most important part of the music community. Without you, we'd be playing for ourselves, which is a bit too self-absorbed if you ask me. So please, if you cannot give your money, give your time and attention. That sometimes means even more these days. Please start sharing. Not just Northern Youth! EVERY INDEPENDENT ARTIST NEEDS YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

In the modern era, many albums are put together through collective fan support.  Simply put, we are just asking you to buy your album up front.  The money we collect will be used to record, master, and distribute an all original album of worship tunes written by artists, Justin Belew and Sarah Barintine.  By donating what you would spend on a decent lunch, you can help us do what we can't do alone.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • This will be the third album produced by Justin Belew that will be funded by online grants.  Check out these other albums on ITunes that have been very successful over the last year in digital downloads and streams.  (https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/all-acoustic-80s/id911512316   or  https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/life-is-melody/id951967455
  • Every donation gets something.  The more you give, the better your perks!

The Impact

Musicians have always been dependent on the gratuity of others.  Whether you are lending an ear or monetary support, you are always appreciated for even stopping by.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with others that you think might be interested.  Thank you.

story:
WHO?

Pyro, Ohio is an independent post-hardcore band from Virginia. We've been around since 2011, and during that time we have released 2 EPs, 3 music videos, and toured most of the US East Coast and Midwest. We released our last EP, “Before the Sun Sets…”, through At Your Command Records in 2013, but we are now independent which allows us to make the most personal record to date for ourselves and YOU. We are already excited about the songs we have written, and we can't wait to share them with you!


Why are we recording a full-length album instead of an EP? We might be old-fashioned, but we believe there is nothing better than getting hooked on a full album and experiencing the range of emotions that a CD can provide. Or getting caught up in that one song on the album that just speaks to you but isn't a single.



WHAT?

When we're not on the road, we just scrape by working part-time jobs to accommodate our show schedule. Any of the money we make goes towards rent, bills, food, and the band; and we still come up short. After a year of playing shows all over the US promoting our latest album “Before the Sun Sets…”, funding everything has become more difficult. All this time away from home means a lot of time away from our main sources of income.  


We've been so grateful for the support we've received. Without that support, none of this would be possible. However, the next step forward is just out of our reach at the moment. We just need a little help to get back into the studio and record a new full-length album. The plan is to record this album at Planet Red Studios in Richmond, VA with producer Andreas Magnusson (Haste The Day, Fit For A King, Oh, Sleeper). We're extremely excited to be working with Andreas, and we look forward to seeing how working with him will enhance our sound.



WHEN?

January 2015; we're set to start recording in mid-January, and we plan to release the album by May. Without help, the release of the album will be delayed while we continue to save money. We are currently in the pre-production process where we fine-tune the songs before hitting the studio. We will update you at every point in the process! Keep an eye on our Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, etc.


HOW?

Support from our friends, families, other bands, and even strangers at shows are what keeps this band going. Without all of you coming to shows, buying our music and merch, letting us crash on your floors, giving us care packages at shows, and sharing our music; we would not exist. Now we need your support more than ever to help us reach our next goal! Here are the costs we're looking at for this project:


Costs:

  • Studio Time: $5,000

  • Music Video: $1,000

  • Promotions (Magazine ads, online ads, etc.): $2,000

  • Pressing: $2,000

  • Artwork (album and tees): $1,000


Total = $11,000


Why are we only asking for $2,000 instead of $11,000? We don't expect an easy ride, we'll take care of the rest, we just need a little help. We also have some stretch goals, such as an acoustic EP, that we would love to be able to put out for you. With your help we will be able to release the album, music video, new merch, and get back on the road sooner than if we had to front the whole cost. Also by crowdfunding this album, we would have a chance to interact and involve you in the whole process in a way we couldn't otherwise.


WHY?

Crowdfunding is a fun and unique way for you to work with us to make the best album possible. Being in a band, it's already a gamble to keep your job, pay your bills, and keep your family happy, so we're alright with taking another chance. We've never tried this before, but we've heard the success stories of crowdfunding, and we hope this project will become one as well.

GOALS:

Initial goal: $2,000

Stretch goal 1 ($3,000): Fan’s choice by vote of a cover song (acoustic) for us to record - everyone who contributed gets a digital download.

Stretch goal 2 ($4,000): We will eat a Carolina Reaper pepper, record the experience, and will each thank every contributor while suffering. 

Stretch goal 3 ($5,000): We will record a 5-song acoustic EP to be released before the album - everyone who contributed gets a free digital download of the EP.

ULTIMATE STRETCH GOAL ($1,000,000): We'll throw a giant free entry show hosted by Coolio and Lil Romeo. All-you-can-eat pizza buffet, taco truck, and BBQ grill. Special guest appearances by Sonic the Hedgehog, Godzilla, and Chuck Norris. Hourly motorcycle raffles. Fireworks. Bull fighting. Alligator petting zoo. Face painting.

WHY?Crowdfunding is a fun and unique way for you to work with us to make the best album possible. Being in a band, it's already a gamble to keep your job, pay your bills, and keep your family happy, so we're alright with taking another chance. We've never tried this before, but we've heard the success stories of crowdfunding, and we hope this project will become one as well.GOALS:Initial goal: $2,000Stretch goal 1 ($3,000): Fan’s choice by vote of a cover song (acoustic) for us to record - everyone who contributed gets a digital download.Stretch goal 2 ($4,000): We will eat a Carolina Reaper pepper, record the experience, and will each thank every contributor while suffering. Stretch goal 3 ($5,000): We will record a 5-song acoustic EP to be released before the album - everyone who contributed gets a free digital download of the EP.ULTIMATE STRETCH GOAL ($1,000,000): We'll throw a giant free entry show hosted by Coolio and Lil Romeo. All-you-can-eat pizza buffet, taco truck, and BBQ grill. Special guest appearances by Sonic the Hedgehog, Godzilla, and Chuck Norris. Hourly motorcycle raffles. Fireworks. Bull fighting. Alligator petting zoo. Face painting.

story:
Short Summary

We are Rachel & Ilya, a music duo based out of the North-East.  We've spent a little less than a year playing music together.  We've played shows in both Philadelphia and New Jersey, recorded many covers, written many originals but have yet to release any.  We want your help to share this music that we are so passionate about with you!  Not only will this help us share our music, it will also open many doors in pushing our opportunities forward.  We have already started working on recording this EP and we are so excited with how it is turning out.  We have collaborated with some great musicians and song writers on this project.  We're going to bring you 4 original songs and really show you who we are as musicians!  We are so excited to release what we're working so hard on!

What We Need & What You Get

Pre and Post production costs have already been covered by us.  What we need your help with is distribution.  Distribution covers the physical copies of the CD's that will be made and the digital distribution costs (such as licenses and UPC codes).  In order to cover the basics of what we feel will do this project justice we are looking to raise $500.  The more money we get, the better product we can release!  By donating you get to be a part of this creative process with us.  Not only do you get to be a part of this process, but we have a long list of awesome perks that you will get as well!  Some of these perks include early delivery digital and physical copies of the EP.  What this means is that you will either get a digital or physical copy of the EP before it is for sale!  We are also giving out more exclusive perks like a flash drive with unique photos and videos of the recording process, hand-written lyrics sheets, the opportunity to choose the EP cover, the opportunity to have your name in the liner notes, and many many more exclusive items.  Be sure to check out the full list of perks!  If we do not reach our entire goal, we still plan to release the EP.  Expect the release date to be pushed back, but this EP will still be in your hands.  We will use whatever we get to fund this specific project.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Maybe you can't afford to donate money but you still want to help us out.  There are other ways to help us out!  Share this project with all of your friends! Post it on your Facebook wall, send out a mass email or pick up the phone!  Sharing this project and supporting our music itself are things we are so grateful for.  Don't think money is the only way to support because at the end of the day it is all about the music anyways!

story:
Hi, my name is Charles Johnson. I am from Oakland, CA. Over the last four months, I cut my first record in Nashville, TN. I am so proud of the work we've done and hope you all enjoy. 'Everything I Know' is now streaming on my website, Spotify and Bandcamp. 

The time has come to take 'Everything I Know' out on the road and I need your help. My team and I have planned a month and a half long North American tour that will take us everywhere from SXSW in Austin, TX, Vancouver, BC, and Boston, MA. Our goal is to raise 10,000 dollars or more to cover the expenses of today’s modern tour. The estimate for our van rental alone is $6,000. We have also projected $1,500 in gas and $1,300 in accommodation costs. The remaining funds will be used for misc. expenses such as promotion, food, and emergencies.
The tour will take place from March 11th - April 30th. 

The tour will also be taking us through Glacier National Park and into the Blackfeet Indian Reservation. My grandfather grew up there, and I am descendant of the tribe. We will be donating 10% of the money we make on this tour to the reservation’s educational system in my grandfather’s name.

We have put together some great packages and incentives for anyone who helps make this dream come true. Depending on how much you donate, you could receive a download code for the album, you might get a gift and postcard from the road, or free entry to a show of your choice. We might even divert the tour to your city!

If you're unable to contribute financially, we are also in need of places to stay and we'd greatly appreciate any help! We need all the support we can get and we'd love to see you out at the shows; all of this will help propel this tour and we couldn't do it with you! 

Full tour schedule can be found here

https://charlesjohnsonmusic.bandcamp.com/releases

https://soundcloud.com/charlesjohnsonmusic/sets...

story:
I'd like to go where the fools gather
and share their laughter and song!
WHERE FOOLS GATHER : A new 14 track studio album by Richard Garvey.

Hello. 

Pre-order my new album! Listen to the first single!
 http://music.cbc.ca/#!/artists/Richard-Garvey

My name is Richard Garvey. I'm a grassroots folk musician from Kitchener, ON. I travel around performing my songs and promote the series Folk Roots Brew (The Boathouse) and Folk Roots Stew (Cafe Pyrus). I do this because I believe music is a great tool for building community. 

My new album "Where Fools Gather" is my best album to date! I really am proud of the songs, arrangements and recordings. I've been working on this album for 3 years! Its all coming together. Its the most warm and genuine performance I've been able to capture to date with the amazing support of the Duke of Erb Recording studio.
I am so lucky to have traveled so much and met so many amazing people by sharing my music. Supporting this campaign will allow me to keep working as a musician full time and help me share my music with more audiences. 
I was able to obtain funding from the Region of Waterloo Arts fund to support the recording of the album. This allowed me to pay the musicians, studio and artists for their hard work. What I need your help with is getting some funds together for creating the physical copies of the album. 

the exchange; a two way road you turn around on.

COST! 
It will cost me about $2000 to make ~1000 copies of the album. 
I have 35 copies of "To Create" left and I made 1000 of that album.  
So I know I can sell them albums! 

Pre-order/Advance tickets/!
I am asking you to pre-order the album!
I am asking you to buy advance tickets to the release shows!
Support with the other perks too!
Ukulele lessons / Songwriting sessions
Share your ideas. What would you like to exchange?

Lets start a fire and sit around it!
Strike a chord! Sing like a choir!

These are all the people who helped with making the album so far!

Richard Garvey – Voice, guitar, ukulele, banjo
Julia Narveson – Bass, Fiddle, Cello
Tyler Stoddart – percussion, organ
Dan Henshall – Mandolin
Dave Soehner – Guitar track 13
Laura Dyck – Violin
Rachel Bruch – Violin, Voice
Eric Johnson-Scherger – Viola
Kate Romain – Accordion
Richard Driedger – Clarinet
Dan Belgue – Banjo  (The Harvest)
Josef Bell – Bass (The Harvest)
Jess Spencer – Trumpet
Celidh Barker – Voice
Laura Ashfield – Voice
Marina Marina - Voice
Shaela Creshion – Artwork

All songs by Richard Garvey*
*Track 13 is a collaborative composition with Dave Soehner
*Julia Narveson arranged strings for Abigail & All My Life

Mixing/Engineering by Buck Thompson & Bill Howard 
@ Duke of Erb Recording Studios.

Thanks to Luke Michielsen and www.stonebridgeguitars.com
Thanks to Tim Dresser for developing my website.

Our song will spread!
from our hearts into our heads! 
and through our friends!
like wildfire!
Please share the campaign and video and the songs.

story:
Breve reseña/ Brief Summary

¡Hola a todos! Soy Maria Bestar. Algunos me conocéis, por mi canción Pensado en Tí, y mi disco Sonámbula. Para los que no me conocen: soy una cantautora española, con muchas ganas de volver a los escenarios y compartir con vosotros todas mis vivencias a través de mi música.  Después de un "brake", porque me convertí en mama ¡vuelvo con más fuerza que nunca a los escenarios! Necesito vuestra ayuda para lograrlo y así evitar el firmar con una multinacional, para poder hacer un poco lo que yo quiera ¡y queramos todos! . ¡Estoy segura de que lo vamos a conseguir! !Gracias!.

Hi guys! I am Maria Bestar, some of you know me from the past, because of my song Pensando en Ti, and my second album "Sonambula". For others I am probably  totally new yo your ears. I am singer songwriter from Spain, that is eager to go back into the music business and share with all of you everything that I have achieved and learned this years .  After a  "brake" in my career,  because I became a mommy, I am back! 

 I need your help to be able to make it again, and to avoid signing with a big record label, we all know what happens with that!  Being independent , I can trully do what I love, the way I want and WE ALL want.  I am sure that we can make it! Thank you!!

Lo que necesito  y lo que obtienes/ What I need and what you get.

Necesito la financiación para poder terminar de grabar el disco, y promocionarlo con todo lo que ello implica, video, fotos, prensa, gira, etc. 

I need the funds to be able to finish recording the album, and promoting it. That means, recording a musical video, photoshoot, tour, press kits....etc. 

Habrá muchas recompensas, desde discos autografiados,  canciones dedicadas, entradas a conciertos, camisetas firmadas,  poder estar en la grabación del video, incluso ser parte del video, componer conmigo para futuros albunes, conciertos privados, etc.  ¡Todo depende del entusiasmo que le pongamos!

There will be many rewards, from signed albums, to dedicated songs, to vip tickets to my concerts,  signed t-shirts, to be able to be present while recording the music video, to be part of the music video, to compose a song with me, even to have a private concert!!! it all depends on you!

El impacto/ The impact

Gracias a vuestra contribución, podré lanzar este tercer disco y con él no solo beneficiarme yo, sino poder demostrarle a la industria que cuando uno quiere, se puede. Además como sabéis en el pasado, utilicé mi música como herramienta para ayudar a los más desfavorecidos y quiero seguir haciéndolo. Ahora que soy madre, y que encima los niños son mi pasión, quiero utilizar el vehículo de la música y el ser un personaje público para colaborar más en ayudar a los niños huerfanos o en condiciones precarias. 

Cuando lancé mi primer disco, que salió simultaneamente en Latinoamérica, México y España, contribuí con varias ONG de Colombia, Chile, Argentina y Mexico entre otras  y nada me haría más feliz que seguir haciendolo ahora.  Y algún día, cumplir mi sueño de financiar un orfanato.

Thanks to your financing I will be able to released this third album, and you will not only be helping me, but also, will be showing the music business industry that the audience still has a saying on what they like and dont like.  Also as you know , in the past I used my music and popularity to give back to society. Now that I am a mom, and children are my passion, I want to be able to use my music again to  help the children in need. 

When I released my first album in Latin America, Mexico and Spain, I collaborated with various NGO's in Colombia, Chile, Argentina and Mexico amongst others. And nothing will make me happier that to do it again. And eventually one day, be able to finance and build an orphanage.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar/ Other ways you can help.

Si no podeis ayudarme económicamente, por favor os pido que, difundáis esta campaña, y que me sigáis en Facebook, Instagram, y Twitter. Cuantas más visitas y a más gente llegue, ¡mejor!. ¡Mil gracias por vuestro apoyo! ¡Espero verles muy pronto!

If you guys cant help  finantially you can help in many other ways! please, help me   promote this campaign, and follow me in instagram, facebook, twitter...etc. the more visits, the better and the more people see it the best! Than you so much for your support! I hope to see you all soon!

story:
Fantasy Panther is going on our first tour in October and we need a little help getting us on our way. 

Currently none of us own a van and we need to rent one which can get costly.  Unfortunately all of us are financially stretched at the moment and we're having trouble raising money for the tour. 

One of the harsh realities of being in a grindcore band is that no matter how hard you work you're probably never going to make enough money on a tour to break even. 

Any small donation will help us greatly offset our costs and you get free cool stuff!

Thanks!

story:
Dans la nuit du 16 au 17 janvier 2015, le local abritant LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE a été la proie des flammes, détruisant près de 4 ans de travail passionné de son équipe de bénévoles.

Plus que jamais, LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE est décidée à poursuivre sa mission et à promouvoir la culture indépendante à Sherbrooke.

Pour ce faire, LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE compte sur le support de la population de Sherbrooke et des environs et sollicite son appui financier pour assurer le maintien de ses activités.

En effet, bien que couvert par des assurances, il appert que le produit des assurances est insuffisant pour voir au redémarrage de l'organisme.

Votre contribution est donc essentielle à la relance de cette pierre angulaire de la culture émergente à Sherbrooke que représente LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE.

LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE, C'EST :

-un organisme sans but lucratif (OSBL);

-une salle de spectacle et de diffusion artistique où se produisent gratuitement les artistes de la région et les artistes de passage;

-un lieu de rassemblement pour les passionnés de musique et ceux qui désirent découvrir de nouveaux talents;

-un tremplin pour les artiste émergents;

-une équipe de bénévoles passionnés et dévoués;


Partagez la bonne nouvelle: #LPBN

story:
Εορταστική Επανέκδοση "Η Πόλις Εάλω"

Κάποιοι δίσκοι δεν πρέπει να λείπουν απο καμία δισκοθήκη. Ένας τέτοιος δίσκος είναι και η "Πόλις Εάλω" των Terror X Crew, σημαντικός δίσκος, τόσο για την χιπ χοπ σκηνή όσο και για την εναλλακτική μουσική σκηνή της χώρας μας.
Δύο δεκαετίες ο δίσκος βινυλίου "Η Πόλις Εάλω" στόλισε τις δισκοθήκες όχι μόνο ανθρώπων που ήταν εκεί όταν κυκλοφόρησε αλλά και αυτών που ξόδεψαν πολλαπλάσια της αξίας του προκειμένου να τον αποκτήσουν.

Το 1997 η απειρία παραγωγής δίσκων και η παντελής έλλειψη των audio mastering studio τότε στην Ελλάδα δεν κατέστησε δυνατό το mastering του δίσκου για το CD και πόσο μάλλον για το βινύλιο. Με αφορμή λοιπόν την εορταστική επανέκδοση θα εξασφαλίσουμε την διαδικασία του audio mastering. Αυτό λοιπόν από μόνο του, στο ηχητικό κομμάτι, τοποθετεί την επανέκδοση πολύ πιο ψηλά απο την πρώτη εκδοση, δίνοντας στο ηχογράφημα τον ήχο που του αξίζει.

Πέρα όμως απο την ηχητική αναβάθμηση του υλικού, δεν θα ήταν εορταστική επανέκδοση χωρίς κάτι παραπάνω. Γι αυτό η "Πόλις Εάλω" πέρα απο το κλασσικό μαύρο βινύλιο θα μπορεί να διατεθεί και σε συλλεκτικό κουτί (box set) το οποίο θα περιλαμβάνει ένα έγχρωμο βινύλιο "Η Πόλις Εάλω" και ένα βινύλιο με όλα τα ορχηστρικά (instrumentals) του δίσκου, φυσικά με την ηχητική επεξεργασία του mastering.

Είμαι ο DJ ALX, ο μουσικός παραγωγός της "Πόλις Εάλω" και σας προσκαλώ να συμμετάσχετε στην εορταστική αυτή επανέκδοση αναβιώνοντας μαζί μου μια εποχή, όχι πολυ μακρυνή αφού ακόμα και σήμερα ο απόηχος είναι δυνατός.

Για οποιαδήποτε απορία σχετικά με την επανέκδοση είστε ευπρόσδεκτοι στο facebook group https://www.facebook.com/groups/369305956752437/

Τί απαιτεί η επανέκδοση και τί παίρνετε εσείς

Το χρηματικό ποσό που ευελπιστώ να συγκεντρώσω θα διατεθεί ως εξής:

  • Άδεια χρήσης των ηχογραφημάτων και πληρωμή στην FM Records
  • Πληρωμή των πνευματικών δικαιωμάτων στην ΑΕΠΙ
  • Μεταφορά των DAT master tapes στο σημερινό format αρχείων wav
  • Mastering για βινύλιο στο Sweetspot από τον Γιάννη Χριστοδουλάτο
  • Μετατροπή των γραφιστικών για εκτύπωση offset
  • Χάραξη, κατασκευή μήτρας και στάμπας των "Η Πόλις Εάλω" και "Η Πόλις Εάλω Instrumentals"
  • 5 Test Pressings από την κάθε μήτρα
  • Εκτύπωση περιορισμένου αριθμού μαύρων και έγχρωμων βινυλίων
  • Εκτύπωση offset εσωφύλλων και εξωφύλλων
  • Κατασκευή και εκτύπωση της συλλεκτικής συσκευασίας
  • Έξοδα Μεταφοράς από το εργοστάσιο κοπής στην Ελλάδα
  • Το 5% του ποσού παρακρατείται απο το Indiegogo ενώ το 4% του ίδιου ποσού απο το Paypal.

Προπαραγγέλνοντας την εορταστική επανέκδοση του "Η Πόλις Εάλω" έχετε την δυνατότητα για τα εξής:

  • Να αποκτήσετε την επανέκδοση του κλασσικού μαύρου βινυλίου (Βασικό Πακέτο)
  • Να αποκτήσετε ένα από τα αριθμημένα συλλεκτικά κουτιά με το έγχρωμο και το instrumental βινύλιο (Εορταστικό Πακέτο)
  • Να συνδιάσετε το Βασικό και Εορταστικό Πακέτο (Συλλεκτικό Πακέτο)
  • Να παρευρεθείς στο/στα restoration και mastering sessions και να παρακολουθήσεις πώς γίνεται το κάθε κομμάτι απο την αρχή μέχρι το τέλος, να αποκτήσεις πρόσβαση στη διαδικασία βιομηχανικής παραγωγής της επανέκδοσης και να λάβεις το συλλεκτικό κουτί με το περιεχόμενό του, δύο μαύρα βινύλια  και τα test pressings (Πακέτο Session)
  • Να είσαι χορηγός με λογότυπό σου στο οπισθόφυλλο, κατόπιν συννενόησης (Πακέτο Χορηγός)

Η σημασία μιας τέτοιας κίνησης

Κατα καιρούς λαμβάνω mail για το εάν υπάρχουν αντίτυπα του "Η Πόλις Εάλω" προς πώληση. Οι περισσότεροι με ρωτάνε εαν θα ξανακυκλοφορήσει κάποια επανέκδοση ενω αρκετοί είναι αυτοί που με παροτρύνουν να ασχοληθώ εγώ με την επανέκδοση αφού καμία εταιρία δεν ασχολείται πλέον. Μια τέτοια κίνηση λοιπόν είναι σημαντική όχι μόνο για μένα αλλά και για σας διότι: 

  • Μπορούμε όλοι (εγώ κι εσείς) να δούμε εκ των πραγμάτων πόσοι είμαστε, τί δύναμη έχουμε και κατά πόσο μπορούμε να ασχοληθούμε συλλογικά και να πραγματοποιήσουμε ένα τέτοιο project.
  • Θα μπορεί ο καθένας από σας που θέλει να έχει τον δίσκο "Η Πόλις Εάλω" στην συλλογή του να τον αποκτήσει χωρίς να πληρώσει πολλαπλάσια την αξία του
  • Θα μπορεί ο συλλέκτης, που ήδη έχει την πρώτη έκδοση, να αποκτήσει και αυτήν την ποιοτικά ανώτερη επανέκδοση 

Οι προκλήσεις και το ρίσκο

Η πλειοψηφία δεν γνωρίζει τον συγκεκριμένο μηχανισμό και αρκετοί θα βιαστούν να το κατακρίνουν. Θελω λοιπόν να διευκρινήσω πως επέλεξα τη μέθοδο αυτή για την επανέκδοση του δίσκου κυρίως για να διαπιστώσω πόσοι πραγματικά ενδιαφέρονται δηλαδή εαν υπάρχει αρκετός κόσμος για να στηρίξει ένα τέτοιο εγχείρημα εμπράκτως πέρα απο προφορικά και γραπτά μηνύματα.
Είμαστε αρκετοί για να πετύχουμε την επανέκδοση του δισκου; Είναι αυτός ο δίσκος "αρκετός" για εσάς ωστε μετα απο 20 χρόνια να αποκτήσει τον ήχο που του αξίζει και να επανατοποθετηθεί στις δισκοθήκες μας; Θα γίνει και πάλι προσβάσιμος σε όλους αυτούς που δεν τον πρόλαβαν τότε; Αυτή είναι η πρόκληση και το ρίσκο. Εάν μετά από 20 χρόνια δεν πραγματοποιηθεί η εορταστική επανέκδοση, θα μείνουν τα λιγοστά φθαρμένα βινύλια σε δισκοθήκες φίλων να μας θυμίζουν μια εποχή που έφυγε ανεπιστρεπτί.

Άλλοι τρόποι για να βοηθήσεις

Επειδή δεν διαθέτουν όλοι λογαριασμό paypal αυτό δεν σημαίνει πως δεν μπορουν να βοηθήσουν:

  • Ρωτήστε καποιον φίλο σας που έχει paypal εαν μπορεί να σας βοηθήσει να συμμετάσχετε με τον δικό τους λογαριασμό paypal
  • Μοιραστείτε αυτή τη σελίδα με τους φίλους σας και το κοινωνικό σας δίκτυο στο Facebook, twitter, tumblr κλπ. Γράψτε για την κίνηση αυτή στο blog σας, στην σελίδα σας κτλπ. 
  • Να θυμίζετε στους φίλους σας να κάνουν το ίδιο σε όλη τη διάρκεια της καμπάνιας.

Τέλος, για εναλλακτικούς τρόπους συμμετοχής επισκευθείτε το facebook group "Η Πόλις Εάλω" για ερωτήσεις περι εναλλακτικών τρόπων συμμετοχής, updates και λοιπές απορίες.

Ευχαριστώ!

story: Music is more than a melody to me, music is my peace, music gave me a place to smile when everything around me was corrupt! Believing in the gifts God gave me will see me through, to save souls through music will give me abundance in my purpose! To leave a positive indelible mark in this short time of earth living is what I will do! Help me in my journey by supporting my efforts! Thank you! Please visit my website to download my latest single RED LIPSTICK! www.DeJuanTurrentine.com

story:
Playing on tradition

I love the popular music of the 1930s and 40s, the swing era. This is jazz for dancing, full of driving rhythms and riffs. The tunes are hummable and the solos are hot. "Swings Left" pays homage to the great small bands of Duke Ellington, Count Basie, & Benny Goodman.

Over the past year I have been inspired to compose an album's worth of new tunes in this style. The instrumentation is traditional: clarinet, trumpet, piano, guitar, bass and drums. But my take on this music is very personal and quirky: I'm trying to push against the edges, while still maintaining the core. The musicians in the band all approach it with our contemporary voices. We're not trying to imitate the old recordings, but we are greatly inspired by the spirit of them.

This album will feature some of my favorite collaborators:

  • Ben Goldberg - clarinet
  • Andrew Stephens - trumpet 
  • Craig Ventresco - guitar
  • Daniel Fabricant - bass
  • Elizabeth Goodfellow - drums
  • (and I'll be on piano)

    An evolving voice

    At this point in my life I feel more inspired than ever. The creative process feels better as I get older and become more at ease with myself. This album will contain what I consider to be the best work of my career.

    This is my third time raising funds for album production. My first, for the "Circus Bella All Star Band" resulted in a raucous circus album, full of extravagance and silliness. Then came "Shadowbox", a collection of moody originals. Both of these albums were made possible by the support of my fans, friends, and family.

    Your support is essential

    I am only able to have a career in music because of people who support my work. All the money raised here will go towards making this album.

    I'm asking for $10,000 total, which will cover the album's basic expenses. If I raise more than that, I'll put it into more marketing resources. Here's the basic breakdown of the budget:

    • $3000 = musician payment
    • $1000 = studio & engineer
    • $1500 = mixing & mastering
    • $1000 = artwork & design
    • $1000 = manufacturing CDs
    • $2000 = distribution & marketing
    • $500 = website update

    Thank you

    I am so grateful to have the opportunity to share my creative work with you. Hopefully this music will communicate the joy I feel while creating it.

    Please share with your friends!
