story:
Funded! :)

-----  www.edwardwhardy.com/TheBlackViolin  -----

The Project

Welcome to My Indiegogo Campaign!

My name is Eddie, Edward W. Hardy, and I am a composer and violinist living in New York City. I finally have an opportunity to own an incredible instrument that matches my personality perfectly; The Black Violin. I’ve been performing on this instrument for a year now, recorded and premiered my new music in concert halls, performed around the country, including Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, and even earned great reviews and press coverage. As I grew with this instrument, The Black Violin has become an extension of myself. www.edwardwhardy.com

The Long Story (Like the one Mom tells you)

Guy Rabut gave me the opportunity of a lifetime by loaning me The Black Violin and allowing me to grow and flourish with this unique instrument. We have reached an agreement for purchase and he is allowing me time to raise money which is great because it’s my first time ever doing this.

How did this all happen? Well, this violin and I have a history

When I was ten years old living in Harlem, I attended The Juilliard School Music Advancement Program, Bloomingdale School of Music and Manhattan School of Music Pre-College consecutively. I was proud to have been awarded a violin from MSM, based on my merit, to use during my studies. I finally had a violin to use throughout my high school education. The violin would have to be returned upon completion of the program.

My new mission was to find a violin to own, so my parents researched violin-makers in NYC and came across Guy Rabut. I tried two of his violins and a viola, all quite lovely and all out of my price range. He handed me The Black Violin and said, “try this one”, it was love at first sight. He began to tell me the history of the The Black Violin and why he created it. The sound of it was so beautiful I knew this was the one. I asked Guy “How much is this Violin?” He smiled and responded “Too much”. So for years I never knew how much it cost or if I would ever see it or play it again. Over the years I dreamed about The Black Violin. 

After my high school graduation, I received a promise of a scholarship to attend SUNY Purchase Conservatory of Music but only if I majored in viola, so I temporarily put down the violin in my classical studies and purchased a student viola from SHAR Music. During my first week I received the news; no scholarship.  I was heartbroken, too late to change direction. I was committed to my studies at Purchase College. I worked several jobs while in college in order to pay my tuition. I would later go on to earn a Master of Music Degree in Violin Performance.

Since then, I’ve been building relationships with luthiers learning about violins and borrowing beautiful and sometimes expensive violins for concert appearances.

Flash forward to 2017, I created my first one-man show called “Six Violins”. Some were inexpensive violins that I purchased and restored, others were on loan. I even acquired The Black Violin, But How?? Although several years had passed, I never stopped thinking about it. I could only hope that by some chance Mr. Rabut still had it. To my surprise, he did still have it and he did remember that young boy so full of wonder and enthusiasm. Who would have guessed he would have loaned it to me for a show, and then for a whole year? The time would come when I would have to commit to purchase or return it. I fell in love with The Black Violin and now it’s a part of me. He is allowing me time to raise money; somehow we both knew it was always meant to be.

The goal of this campaign is to crowdfund the purchase of Guy Rabut’s Black Violin. Every little bit helps.

Any and all of your contributions will help me purchase this unique, one of a kind modern looking instrument that will continue to grow with me throughout my career. The fundraiser will, more importantly, help connect me to all of you: family, friends, mentors, colleagues and even future friends that may choose to be a part of my musical journey.

What Can You Get Out of This

Different perks are offered for each contribution; from a digital single to live performance to an original composition dedicated to you! Check out the right side and figure out what level best suits you!

The Impact

I hope other artists find inspiration from this campaign to tap into their resources and fund other creative projects and instruments purchases as I am. No matter what type of music, musicians are always looking for the perfect instrument that compliments them and advances their careers. Music as a universal language and through the sound of music one can describe an action or a response. Music can evoke an emotion; it can tell a story. This is something I believe in and the Black Violin is apart of my story.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word and share this link, any of my posts anywhere because that will create an opportunity for others to see and listen to my work; hopefully encouraging involvement in this campaign.

Funded! :)
-----  www.edwardwhardy.com/TheBlackViolin  -----
The Project
Welcome to My Indiegogo Campaign!
My name is Eddie, Edward W. Hardy, and I am a composer and violinist living in New York City. I finally have an opportunity to own an incredible instrument that matches my personality perfectly; The Black Violin. I’ve been performing on this instrument for a year now, recorded and premiered my new music in concert halls, performed around the country, including Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, and even earned great reviews and press coverage. As I grew with this instrument, The Black Violin has become an extension of myself. www.edwardwhardy.com

The Long Story (Like the one Mom tells you)

What Can You Get Out of This
Different perks are offered for each contribution; from a digital single to live performance to an original composition dedicated to you! Check out the right side and figure out what level best suits you!

The Impact
I hope other artists find inspiration from this campaign to tap into their resources and fund other creative projects and instruments purchases as I am. No matter what type of music, musicians are always looking for the perfect instrument that compliments them and advances their careers. Music as a universal language and through the sound of music one can describe an action or a response. Music can evoke an emotion; it can tell a story. This is something I believe in and the Black Violin is apart of my story.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help spread the word and share this link, any of my posts anywhere because that will create an opportunity for others to see and listen to my work; hopefully encouraging involvement in this campaign.

story:
How frequently do we hear the same genre of music, song or artist play repetitively on all various forms of media such as radio stations, television, and/or websites? Where do you go to discover new music that is not mainstream and is not playing on the major forms of media? Where can a new and upcoming artist share their music with the world? Welcome to Nuhypes.com: an original social media network that focuses on discovering and sharing new music on one main website. Nuhypes is a space where the quality of music is determined by the listeners and where music can instantly be shared between users. This website is for music lovers and for artists who need a platform to showcase their talent and promote their music.

Nuhypes.com Account Page

Similar to other existing social media, Nuhypes.com users will have create a personal profile where they can post, share or listen to music. This website will operate around daily leaderboards which recognizes high rated and most listened to music. Monthly rewards are given to the top accounts on the leaderboards. Unlike current media mediums that promote the same artists, this website will give listeners a chance to be exposed to other artists and hear much more than we are currently limited to now.

Help us create a website where music is an art form that can be expressed and listened to freely by anyone.  With your support, we can complete our vision of creating a format suited for the music and artists of our generation.



Music today is almost pre-selected for us. Websites, television and radio stations push the most known artists and songs because it is a simple way to ensure frequent listeners or viewers. We believe that the listener should have complete control over what music they listen to and whether the music is considered good or bad.

Our site is for those who want to inspire or be inspired, who want to create, and for those who just want to browse, learn or listen. Leaderboards separate genres of music hourly, allowing users to experience brand new sounds. Nuhypes.com makes an effort to separate commonly known artists from the unknown artists, which allows good artists who don’t have much exposure, not to be overshadowed by those who do.

Nuhypes.com Leaderboard Page

Today many talented and successful artists and producers come from a strong online background such as XX, Black Keys, and Lana Del Ray, these are all great artists who became popular through the Internet. Even more famous personalities such as Mumford and Sons, A$AP Rocky and The Weekend built their career through internet marketing and a lot of talent. We at Nuhypes.com believe that there are more talents and music that need the right outlet to be heard at all. We just want to hear more good music, don’t you?


Being a social network based media site means that the users decide what good music is and what is not. Here’s your first chance to change what is considered the music of this generation and not just complain about it.

The world needs a project like this one, stop arguing on today’s networks over who deserves to be praised and help do something about it!

Right now we are in the developmental stage of our project. We need enthusiasts to continue our dream that one-day music will be created and heard based on its overall production, content and meaning, rather than just its popularity.

WHAT WE NEED!

A media website of this magnitude needs a lot of storage space and costs a lot of money to run smoothly, without any obstruction to its users. Our site needs approximately the following in order to complete successfully.

  • 20,000 in order to be completed

  • 30,000 means a completely smooth, completely professional website and staff to go along with it in a shorter amount of time
  • 40,000 All the above plus we can start working on the development for the phone application.

Any and all funds given will go straight to the development of the website regardless of if our goals are reached or not. Goals that aren’t completed will prolong our project, but we are a determined team and will do all we can to complete this dream.

Help us how you can, If you don’t have a credit card or just don’t have any money to give its ok, help our campaign by getting the word out. Share our link and help the Internet become a better place for better music.

More long term funding goals are:

NuRadio - A free booked streaming space for Dj's.  which plays on Nuhypes.com main leaderboard Page

More Frequent/Bigger Prizes for Leaderboard chart toppers

story:
The saxophone began as a cutting-edge instrument, always looking into the future...

but what if it could step deeply back in time without sacrificing any of its virtuosity?


What's going on here?

We seek to answer fundamental questions about the relevance of modern performing practices to the compositions and ideologies of the distant musical past, realizing that a perfectly "authentic" performance is impossible. Instead, we're making this recording to deliver the compositional genius of Johannes Ockeghem in a format that speaks to contemporary audiences without detracting from the inherent grace and complexity of the music itself.

Why the Missa Prolationum?

Saxophonists are accustomed in the chamber music arena to performing compositions involving breakneck virtuoso techniques, demanding the highest degree of precision and facility on the instrument as possible. Turning back the clock, the idea of what constituted a virtuoso is very different than it is now. Polyphonic vocal music of the Renaissance called upon performers to read manuscripts that are now almost alien to us, and to engage in rehearsal and performance techniques that are all but lost to us. The virtuosity of performing this work by Ockeghem, then, lies in how far away from the present we must place our minds and approaches in order to idiomatically render this Mass.

So what and who cares?

The governing principle behind why we are recording this disc is to demonstrate yet another aspect of the saxophone's flexibility, but we're raising the stakes by imposing a great deal of historically-informed research upon our preparation of this Mass. There is a stunning degree of variety that is present when searching for a recording of any work of "early music." Rare is the occasion, however, when a "modernized" rendition of that work exists that calls upon both a keen academic eye and an adventurous performance attitude. We hope to expand upon that catalog. To quote Randolph Coleman, why we are doing this is for the sake of "experimentation, idiosyncrasy, interaction, individuation, and especially...open-ended creative play." This is a challenge for us as much as it is a challenge to the wider saxophone community to embrace a new performing agenda that includes early music.

Who is Quartet Exordium?

We are a specialized performing ensemble based in Lubbock, Texas that has an ace up its sleeve: the four of us are saxophonists, but we perform the music of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance.

Recently in concert we have performed the turbulent, subtle, and rhythmically profound music of the late 14th century, a period of musical practices that was dubbed the "ars subtilior" or "more subtle art." Our focus on this music upholds the contemporary paradigm of the saxophone as a catalyst for compositional technique and as a channel for individual talent. We have been featured guests of the Texas Tech University Early Music Ensemble. Additionally, we will be the demonstrative ensemble in the presentation of Benjamin Robinette's doctoral document pertaining to a process for performing polyphonic vocal music of the Renaissance on saxophones.

story:
Conjuring the Feathered Serpent

For the past 20 years I have been preparing for this Dec 21st Winter Solstice, the final day of the Maya's prophetic calendar.  I've been chanting the days in various ways for many years.  Now I want to share it with everyone, to help us all center ourselves.  This Dec. 21st through the 23rd a pulse from the core of the Milky Way will lift the spirits of humanity.  But it will fade after that unless we're centered enough to hold the higher energy.  This CD I want to make will help folks perpare for that.  The chants are relaxing and deep.

I just need the funds to pay a sound engineer and a CD duplicator.  I can record ASAP.  I'll use the funds as they come in and take it as far as it can go to become a unique meditative listening experience. I'll do all the art myself and include all the lyrics and such.  I'll send them out as the funds come in.

story:
SpAzCaNdY is 21st Century Psychedelic Tin Pan Alley Pop PunkNFunk experienced in full 12th dimensional technicolor voodoo and 2.0 sonic acupuncture. 

Hi!

We are Becca Ayers and Bradley Dean Whyte, musically kindred spirits.  Many moons ago, we made sweet, sweet music together in New York.  We'd hike, drink tea, write music, text band name ideas back and forth and play with llamas.  When Bradley moved to Thailand, it seemed our collaboration was finished,  but because of the new-fangled technology that the kids are calling "the internets", we were able to continue making music (#YOLO!  ... right, kids?!).  Bradley co-wrote and produced "Lovesick" with Becca from the jungles of northern Thailand just before releasing his first home-made studio record, "The Emperor's New Tea".

Today, Bradley resides in Houston, Texas, and when Becca came to visit from NYC this past winter, we rekindled our musical shenanigans and were all, "this sh*t's for real, yo.  Time to make some... SpAzCaNdY."  

We have that certain complex, volatile relationship that the fans just love:  Bradley annoys Becca, but Becca annoys Bradley even more.  #SWAG!

For most of our lives, we have been lucky enough to earn our living in the performing arts -- creating theatre, music, recordings, and teaching.   Becca continues to perform in NYC and has spent the last 9 years working on and off-Broadway, performing improv with the Upright Citizen's Brigade, and continuing to write.   Her Web-Series (co-created with the hilarious Brooke Jacob of "Sitting On Babies") titled, "Snuggle Buddies" will feature  Bradley and Becca's "Lovesick" as it's theme song, as well as a handful of other SPAZCANDY songs for the soundtrack!

Bradley began his career as an actor, performing with regional theaters and Shakespeare festivals.  Over the last 9 years, he has written and produced music and has educated thousands, yes thousands of children.  Young ones; the kind that cough directly into your mouth and talk to you too close. 

To date, we have self-funded our own projects:  

Bradley Dean Whyte and the Perfectly Violent Dream "Emperor's New Tea"

Becca Ayers "Lovesick", "Live at the Laurie Beechman Theatre" and "Simple Wish" (Christmas Single), *Special Thanks to Jack Sharkey

Baby Goes Bang ! "Brainy Pants" and "Baresongs/F**ksongs",*Special Thanks to Jack Sharkey

Mister Bradley "Mister Bradley's Musical Jam!" (for kids)

and, in December 2012, Bradley produced the world's first DIY public performance of Beck Hansen's "Song Reader" in Austin, Texas at the Mohawk.

While we've had help along the way from super-special friends and fans for Compact Disc production, SpAzCaNdY is our first campaign to seek outside help with professional mixing, production and promotion.  Bradley has been recording and arranging new songs from his home studio, while Becca sends lyrics, music, and vocal tracks  through the magical portals of the web.  They'll need funds to get it properly mixed, mastered, printed and promoted!  We are REALLY proud of and EXCITED about this album!  We think it's gonna make a huge splash and make everyone want to put down their weapons and DANCE with THEIR pants!  Thank you!  We hope you enjoy listening to this as much as we enjoy making it!!!

What We Need

We need to raise $15,000 to accomplish our goal.

  • Mixing and Mastering will cost $4000 
  • CD and Record production will cost $3500
  • Honorariums for musicians $1000
  • Promotion, Video production, and Touring we will need $6500 just to get started! 
If we don't reach our full goal, we will prioritize completing the mixing and mastering and distribution of the album digitally with whatever funds we do raise, so that the SpAzCaNdY will get heard by those that know about it!    But we aim to raise the full amount and more so that we can have a proper budget for promotion, publicity and some touring. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you would like to help but cannot afford to do so monetarily, your value is priceless!  Please stay tuned to the progress and share the news with your friends.  Post us on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media!  Thank you!!!  Come spaz with us!!

Honorariums for musicians $1000

If we don't reach our full goal, we will prioritize completing the mixing and mastering and distribution of the album digitally with whatever funds we do raise, so that the SpAzCaNdY will get heard by those that know about it!    But we aim to raise the full amount and more so that we can have a proper budget for promotion, publicity and some touring. 




Other Ways You Can Help
If you would like to help but cannot afford to do so monetarily, your value is priceless!  Please stay tuned to the progress and share the news with your friends.  Post us on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media!  Thank you!!!  Come spaz with us!!

story:
My Campaign

I'm Annie Yoder and I love to write music and sing my little heart out! Since I graduated college in 2008 I have been running away from being a singer songwriter. I have performed out more and more but have always been too afraid to leave a steady job or a school structure and step out to create a path of my own. This has left very little time to write and record. When I do sit down to record something, I love to layer my voice and create choirs of myself. I like the challenge of using very basic and minimal recording equipment; I usually use GarageBand and a USB mic. I feel like I can get a lot accomplished with a little amount of time, but finding that time has been hard.  This January as I was preparing for a concert, I recorded a new song in an afternoon in my living room. I felt so happy and fulfilled, but also frustrated that  I couldn't take time like that more often. I decided I couldn't run any longer away from what I love for the sake of familiarity and stability. So now, for the first time ever, I'm taking a leap of faith. I'm cutting down my work hours drastically this summer and taking set time every week to write and record an album. I'm scared to take this step, but more than the fear I feel intense excitement to get to finally try out doing what I love!

What I Need & What You Get

I'm setting my goal for $2500 and giving myself until my birthday on June 22nd to raise the funds. This will cover the time I'll take off work and some small equipment updates. If I get significantly more than the goal I will be investing in better computer equipment.

A donation of any amount will get you the album! Just give me an email address or a mailing address where I can send it to you! My album completion date is set for September 1st of this year.

The Impact

This will be my first album ever! Once it is finished, I'll be sending it everywhere I can, to record companies, friends, and who knows, maybe even the Ellen show!  This is only the beginning of what I hope to be more albums, and much much more music!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Breve reseña

Mi nombre es Daniel, tengo 26 años, y durante el transcurso del 2014 he tenido la oportunidad de conocer a una persona de mi familia, a mi tío-abuelo Manolo con 72 veranos encima.

This is Daniel, I'm 26 years old and this year  I meet Manolo, my grand-pa uncle, with 72 summers over!


Fué al poco rato de estar hablando con Manolo, cuando descubrí de donde había heredado mi pasión por la horticultura y por el cultivo sostenible y ecológico. Su huerto es la envidia del barrio!

Some days speaking with Manolo, I discovered from where I heredate my passion on ecologic growth and sustaintable development of plants. His orchland is the best one on the zone!

Durante los siguientes días conseguí unas semillas de una calabaza gigante (400kg) ganadora de un concurso de la zona. Sembré las pipas de calabaza a principios de Junio, y hasta ahora, día tras día, las plantas se han extendindo por toda la huerta con una fuerza y una vigorosidad asombrosas.

During the following days I got some seeds from a winning contest area giant pumpkin (400kg). I planted the pumpkin seeds in June, and until now, day after day, the plants have extended throughout the garden with amazing strength and vigor.

Hace cosa de unos días atrás, mi tío descubrió una única calabaza escondida entre la frondosidad de las matas:

Makes thing a few days ago, my uncle discovered this!:


Y jústamente le pregunté: 

And I asked him:

¿Quieres que la calabaza crezca por internet?

Do you want the pumpkin to grow online?
Su reacción:
 Inter-what? HOW?



Lo que necesitamos -What we need

Desde un punto de vista sencillo, a nivel vital, nuestro proyecto tan solo necesita:
From a simple, vital level to view our project only needs:


Agua, sol y nutrientes, y nada más?
Water, sun and nutrients, and what else?

Efectivamente, la calabaza precisa de cuidados diarios por parte de profesionales en la materia!

Indeed, the daily pumpkin care need professionals in this field!


y lo que obtienes tu? - and what do you obtain?


  • Ser partícipe de un proyecto original, sencillo, y respetuoso con el medio ambiente.
  • Vincular tu acto con la calabaza.
  • Puedes ayudar a difundir las semillas del fruto final de este proyecto.
  • Puedes llegar a disfrutar de un trozo de la calabaza!
  • Puedes aprender como cuidar tu planta de calabazas.
  • Be part of an original, simple, and environmentally friendly project. 
  • Link your act with the pumpkin.
  • You can help spreading the seeds of this project. 
  • You could enjoy a piece of pumpkin!
  • You can learn how to care your pumpkin plants.



El impacto - The impact

La expresión "ganar peso en verano" esta diréctamente conectada con un sentimiento negativo dado que, en condiciones normales, a la mayoría de las personas no les gusta ganar peso y menos durante el verano.

The term "gain weight in summer" is directly connected to a negative feeling because, under normal conditions, most people do not like to gain weight during the summer.

Esta campaña pretende hacer crítica dando una pequeña vuelta de tuerca a la expresión y trata de llevar al límite el modo explotación de una "calabaza" a través de Internet.

This campaign intends to review giving a small twist to the expression and tries to push to the limit on "how to sell" a pumpkin on Internet.


"Ganar peso en verano" - Nos ayudas?

 "Get Fat this summer" - Do you help us?



  Qué se consigue con tu aportación :  

  • Ayudarás a engordar nuestra calabaza.
  • Podremos dedicar más cuidados a la planta.
  • Pasarás a formar parte de un proyecto novedoso, sencillo y humilde.
  • Aprenderás técnicas de agricultura.

What we obtain with your help:

  • You will help to get fat our pumpkin. 
  • We can devote more attention to the plant.
  • You will become part of a novel, simple and humble project. 
  • You will learn farming techniques.
     


    Riesgos y desafíos - Risks and challenges


    Los principales riesgos o problemas son los siguientes:

    • Que la calabaza se rompa y deje de crecer antes de tiempo.
    • Plagas y enfermedades.
    • Que nos roben la calabaza.

    The main risks or problems are:

    • That pumpkin breaks and stop growing prematurely. 
    • Pests and diseases. 
    • The thieves.

    Todos éstos riesgos son naturales, reales y pueden provocar que la campaña no pueda cumplir con todos sus objetivos.

    Como medidas de precaución:

    • Hemos puesto una valla por el huerto.
    • Cuanto más engorde la calabaza, más difícil es moverla (imaginad  ladrones sudando con nuestra calabaza en los hombros!)


    All these risks are natural, real and can cause the campaign can not meet all its objectives. As precautionary measures:

    • We have put a fence around the garden. 
    • More weight more thieves!


    El riesgo aumenta a medida que se acerca el fin de la cosecha así como también el nivel de éxito de la campaña y de kilos de la calabaza. 

    The risk increases as we approach the end of the harvest as well as the level of success of the campaign and Pumpkin lbs!

    :D

    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

    Other methods of helping us!

    Si crees que esta campaña te ha gustado, que puede despertar ideas para otros, no dudes en difundirla:

    • Usa redes sociales para repartir esta idea por la red
    • Usa Indiegogo para compartir esta campaña.

    If you like this campaing, that can spark ideas for others, do not hesitate to spread it:

    • Use social networks to spread this idea for the web.
    • Use Indiegogo to share this campaign. 


      Esto es todo amigos!

      That's all folks!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hi Everyone!!

I am pleased to announce that my son Jamil a student from Washington Heights in New York City has been selected to perform along with the Young People's Chorus of New York City (www.ypc.org) at the Pollyfolia Music Confernce (www.pollyfolia.org)  in Normandy, France and has received a partial scholarship to participate.  We appreciate your support in helping him with this amazing opportunity!  The only catch is we have just 3 days to raise the remaining required funds to send him.  I can't do it alone but I know we can do this together! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The cumulative tax deductible contribution of $1000 (of which we are asking each of you a small portion - or a large, whichever you choose) will go towards:

paying for his passport fees ($207), airfare and lodging (based on group discount and subsidized by YPC), uniforms, ground transportation, and meals.

For your contribution in return we will keep you updated about how his trip is going while he is there and forward the digital links of photos and videos as they become available and invite you to celebrate with him at a location to be determined when he returns!

The Impact

Jamil is a successful academic student and has simultaneously worked diligently in the performing arts arena as well.  He has been trained in singing, guitar, harp and even acting and dance and has participated in programs with the Harlem School of the Arts, Heights On Broadway, Revolucion Latina and now Young People's Chorus of New York City.  We ask that you help us support him in this amazing opportunity to take his persuit to the next level in this opporutunity to be a part of the first group from the United States to have the opportunity to perform in this reknown festival overseas.

 

More about YPC:

For more than two decades, the Young People’s Chorus of New York City™ has provided children of all ethnic, religious, and economic backgrounds with a unique program of music education and choral performance, while maintaining a model of artistic excellence and humanity that enriches the community. 

Through the leadership of Francisco Nunez (a Washington Heights native) YPC has become one of the most celebrated and influential youth choruses in the world, performing around the globe, releasing acclaimed recordings from across the musical spectrum, and collaborating with many of the most highly regarded composers, performers, and organizations of our time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can help but we ask that you do us a small favor:

Spread the word to anyone that you know that can contribute or send us suggestion how we can raise these funds on time!

 

That's it!! Look forward to celebrating with each and every one of you.

 

Ayisha

story:
We are Brought Up - a hardcore band that formed in East Lansing, MI in September 2012. We started playing live shows in December 2012 and we released our debut EP on January 1, 2013.

We have played a few live shows in our home state of Michigan and one show in Ohio so far. This summer, we want to head out on a small tour in the Midwest and East coast. We already have shows booked in Ft. Wayne, Columbus, Pittsburgh, Philadelphia, Trenton, Richmond, and Detroit.

We are a young up and coming band and we need your help to finance the costs of our tour. We have been saving money and our families have been helping too, but we still need more funds to pay for the tour, which has been a dream for all of us in Brought Up.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to help pay for gas, lodging, and food while on tour. Because we are a new band, it will be tough for us to make a lot of money on our first tour, so we will need to make sure we have our own funds to help connect with our scene while on the road.

If you can contribute funds for our tour, we have some cool stuff to give you in return. First off, a big thank you from the band, Brought Up buttons, Brought Up stickers, autographed photo of Brought Up taken by award winning photographer - John McGraw, limited edition cassette release of our debut EP "Before My Eyes," and a t-shirt. We have different packages for all budgets.

The Impact

If we reach our funding goal here on Indiegogo, it will help us achieve a dream for all of us by going out on tour. We have been busy writing new songs, performing our current songs, and playing live shows as we continue to build our audience. This tour will help us get an even bigger audience around the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you might not be able to donate funds, but you can help us spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign by posting on any social network you use. Hey, you can even hit us up with some dry goods to use while we go on tour!

Thanks for checking out our campaign and supporting our band any way you can.

story:
In a Vermont newspaper called The Message, Rusty Belle was once described as "a band that can hand you your ass or make you miss your mom.” If you haven’t yet been introduced to Rusty Belle, that description seems like a good place to start. It speaks to the wild diversity of their performances and their writing, their humor and whimsicality, and their Harpo Marx like ability to sneak up on your emotions.  Rusty Belle is a trio of passionate musicians from Amherst Massachusetts who have been living together and creating new music for the past 6 years.  They come from the back woods and stonewall junk piles of rural New England.  They were raised on Johnny Cash, Bruce Springsteen, and Miles Davis. They dated Tom Waits in College and still call him when they're lonely.  They have a penchant for finding compelling and unusual sounds in strange and unlikely places.  Rusty Belle is Matt Lorenz, Kate Lorenz, and Zak Trojano.  They are a family of three that has taken their unique music to festivals, concert halls, and clubs across the country.  Right now, they are working on a new record called "Common Courtesy."  

  "Common Courtesy" was recorded over 6 days at Sonelab in Eashampton, MA.  It was engineered by Justin Pizzoferrato (Dinosaur Jr.) and produced by David Goodrich (Chris Smither, Jeffrey Foucault, Peter Mulvey).   It is Rusty Belle's third studio record and they completed tracking for thirteen original songs.  The session was magic in many ways.   The entire second day of recording was done in the midst of a hurricane.  At night the skies cleared and the moon was full.  Everyone involved agrees that "Common Courtesy" is a record that sounds like a time and a place.  The performances are unusual and dynamic and only happened once.

  In order to complete the production and promotion of this record, Rusty Belle needs ten thousand dollars.  The money will go towards paying the recording engineer, mixing engineer, producer, and publicist.  The money will also go towards making physical copies of the record in the form of CD's and vinyl.  Rusty Belle is an extremely hardworking band.  Last year they played over 150 shows in addition to an almost constant schedule of writing and recording.  They need your help to bring this exciting music into the world!
story_txt:
In a Vermont newspaper called The Message, Rusty Belle was once described as "a band that can hand you your ass or make you miss your mom.” If you haven’t yet been introduced to Rusty Belle, that description seems like a good place to start. It speaks to the wild diversity of their performances and their writing, their humor and whimsicality, and their Harpo Marx like ability to sneak up on your emotions.  Rusty Belle is a trio of passionate musicians from Amherst Massachusetts who have been living together and creating new music for the past 6 years.  They come from the back woods and stonewall junk piles of rural New England.  They were raised on Johnny Cash, Bruce Springsteen, and Miles Davis. They dated Tom Waits in College and still call him when they're lonely.  They have a penchant for finding compelling and unusual sounds in strange and unlikely places.  Rusty Belle is Matt Lorenz, Kate Lorenz, and Zak Trojano.  They are a family of three that has taken their unique music to festivals, concert halls, and clubs across the country.  Right now, they are working on a new record called "Common Courtesy."  

  "Common Courtesy" was recorded over 6 days at Sonelab in Eashampton, MA.  It was engineered by Justin Pizzoferrato (Dinosaur Jr.) and produced by David Goodrich (Chris Smither, Jeffrey Foucault, Peter Mulvey).   It is Rusty Belle's third studio record and they completed tracking for thirteen original songs.  The session was magic in many ways.   The entire second day of recording was done in the midst of a hurricane.  At night the skies cleared and the moon was full.  Everyone involved agrees that "Common Courtesy" is a record that sounds like a time and a place.  The performances are unusual and dynamic and only happened once.
  In order to complete the production and promotion of this record, Rusty Belle needs ten thousand dollars.  The money will go towards paying the recording engineer, mixing engineer, producer, and publicist.  The money will also go towards making physical copies of the record in the form of CD's and vinyl.  Rusty Belle is an extremely hardworking band.  Last year they played over 150 shows in addition to an almost constant schedule of writing and recording.  They need your help to bring this exciting music into the world!

story:
Check It Out!


Hi there! I'm singer/songwriter/rec. artist Haley Reinhart & I am trying to raise funds to release a stellar music video for a brand new song called, "Show Me Your Moves!" I'm at a stage in my career where I'm making lots of big transitions; which means changes and wonderful additions to my team. It also means I have artistic freedom like never before. I believe when an opportunity comes a knockin' ...and it feels right, you gotta open that door! My creative wheels are constantly turning and it's about time I let you guys in on one of my projects. The coolest part about this campaign is the fact that it's coming straight from the artists direction... No label interference, no nothin! It will be pure raw talent coming together from all angles.

I will join forces with director Scott Rea and creative producer and good friend, Danni G. to bring it all together!

With your kind donations - you will not only help me achieve the great goal of making my own music video, but furthermore; you will allow my inner visions to come to life as I've always dreamt they could!



What We Need & What You Get


We are looking to raise a total of $30,000 or more!

The director, producer, and myself are in this for the love of the game! We're all very passionate and believe in this video, which means were not in it for the money. The people that will be getting paid for their services are the film crew that make shooting this video possible, as well as equipment fee's for the set. 

We want all of you to be involved in the process and receive perks for your kind hearted generosities! You will be able to receive autographed photos, to twitter shout outs, to personalized thank you videos. Heck, you can even have your name in the credits or be in the video itself! So take a gander... the world is your oyster! ;)

If for some reason we do not reach our goal and depending on the amount made, we will  still move forward and shoot the video. It's important that you know, this video is worth 150k and will look that good too! At the same time, we will be pulling many favors to make it happen for 30k.



The Impact


I've always felt deeply connected with my fans ever since I was on American Idol. They've all been here since day one and are still going strong! With this campaign, I hope to get everybody excited and attract new followers in the making.



Other Ways You Can Help


Let me thank you all in advance for donating! And folks, I understand times are tough for many of us. If you can't donate, you can still help make it happen. Please spread the word! Tell your friends, co- workers, teachers, & grandma's all about the video! Show me some love on Twitter, FB, and Instagram! And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 


I'm so excited... & I just cant hide it.

Kiss kiss - ciao ciao,

-Haley

story:
"Sooo Whattt Is This?"

 New music video production "H.O.R.U.S"  by hip-hop artists Wise Beyond Knowing,
("The Genesis Project") Is solely about us being able to fully exhibit what we can do and to show that with passion and the right mindset no matter who you are of where you came from , you can express your creativity to the fullest extent if you eliminate all borders from your life and become who you feel you are made to be. We hope to show that art is culture and that Wise Beyond Knowing can be seen as a representation of our creative generation. We have gotten together our crew of friends right out of college who devote their lives to doing what they love and we're coming together for this production free of charge because this is our collective message. Like we said before we want to show that with passion your creations and goals can be achieved no matter what position you are in within your life. Since this video brings together topics such as: social "issues" , unity, artistic expression, and positive energy, it would be a pleasure for our team to count on your support and contribution to this project.

   What We Need & What You Get 


Funding for The Genesis Project will go to: 

  • Food & Drinks (remember this is a project of all volunteers) 

  • Art Supplies, Artwork & Materials 

  • Cameras & Lighting 

  • Wardrobe 


If you contribute to our goal we have some things in return for your kindness:


  • Early Video Release 

  • Shout Out in "Weekly Freestyles"  

  • WBK Signed "H.O.R.U.S" Poster (Song Artwork)
    Design By: HorusTheeSun & Kaila Leigh Photography 
  • Official Song Download (2 Versions)

    The Impact

We hope to not only show that what we came to bring to this industry but also to inspire those who haven't gotten up to go after there dreams to do so because we all believe that once you find your passion the world finds a way to support you. As a natural born humanitarian I am excited we decided to allow the public to be the origin (Genesis) of  Wise Beyond Knowing's mission, being brought on by the people is the dream all artist hope to live and every contribution gets this reality closer to existence.

    Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute just know that being conscious of us is all we can ask for and we thank you for that and you are apart of the movement.

story:
My name is Holden Mandell and I am raising money for my school's band as part of my CIVICS ACTIVISM project. I am doing this project with my friend and classmate Joshua Velazquez who plays clarinet in the band. The band includes great musicians and they only have a limited supply of working instruments. The instruments will still be at the school after we graduate so this will be a long lasting change. We chose this cause because the band has very old instruments that are always breaking. Lots of cases have lost their hinges and lots of the mallets are chipping.

Josh is in the band so he had the idea to fix the problem. Josh is lucky enough to have a working clarinet and a good case but others students don’t. We hope to raise about $8000 and buy instruments such as clarinets, flutes, drums, new cases, and mallets for marimba. The new instruments should last for ten to thirty years.

We hope for the students to be able to perform their best and know that they will be able to play an instrument without it breaking. Somebody who is learning a new instrument should be able to use a new one that makes the right sound. Even though the instruments aren’t cheap we will try our hardest to raise the most money we can.

story:
We're The Few Who May from Phoenix, AZ.

We're a relatively new metal band who have been playing for about 2 years now.  Given the natural progression of a band, we're looking to finally record our music to release to the public so you can hear what we've been working so hard on.

We now have the opportunity to record and produce our very first commercial-quality single titled "The Placebo Effect", but due to the nature of the music business, we don't quite have the financial base that we need to completely pull it off alone.  This is where you, our friends and fans come in.

Being able to have a fully produced song/EP is something we've always wanted to achieve since the beginning.  Again, as you know, the nature of the music business is difficult and having the foothold of a strong first impression for people to hear is a key to success.  You could help be the major part in building the foundation for our future.


What is the money going towards?

Recording a quality song/EP is an investment for the bands future, so we absolutely will not do this half way.  To ensure that we will get the best sounding production, we need to make sure we don't cut any corners financially.  We've set our minimum goal to $1,500.  Being completely transparent with all of you, here's the breakdown of what will go into this project and what we can get for that amount:
  • $800 would get us a full day in "Studio A".  That would be enough time to pick apart the song and truly build it to its full potential.  This would be the cost for tracking (recording)
  • $200 would get the song mixed and would give us a little breathing room for experimentation.
  • $500 would go to tying up all the loose ends of the project (mastering, CD duplication, etc) as well as help go to the cost of the perk packages.
The best part about Indiegogo is this is not a donation.  This is an opportunity for you to be a part of the process of making our first song/EP and in return, you get rare merchandise that we wouldn't be able to press otherwise.  Shirts, Hoodies, Stickers, etc.  Be sure to check them out on the right hand side of the page!
Now, we know that $1,500 is a fairly large budget to shoot for being a fairly new band, but as we said before, we want to do this the right way, not the "cheapest way".  We've set this to be a flexible campaign so that we can still put the money raised towards making this happen.  If we pull in more than $1,500, we will look into doing an EP (2-3 songs).  That'd be the ultimate goal, but one song will still be a major boost to our career.

Other Ways You Can Help

On top of picking out one or more of the rare perk packages, you can also help by spreading the word.  Email the short link to friends, post the short link on your social media pages (facebook, twitter, myspace, etc), and put word-of-mouth into full swing by sharing it with your friends in social situations.

We can't thank you enough for helping us make this long-term goal of producing "The Placebo Effect" finally become a reality.  We can't wait to show you what we've got!


-The Few Who May

story:
Stories through Songs

As a media student I am passionate about telling stories. As a musician, I do that through songwriting. I invite you to support my songwriting and story telling of what God has done in my life.

  • A little more about me. I am a military USAF Disabilty Civil Service former brat and Filipino born human in Florida. I enjoy playing music and singing, bible studies, church, spiritual conversations, the beach, reading, and television and movies. I just turned 30, graduated from FSU and Towson University, and currently reside in Fort Walton Beach, FL.
  • I was disabled in my right eye (the picture in the beginning of the video) by a bottle rocket on July 4th at the age of 5. That lit image from my optometrist is what remains of my eyeball with very limited sight with the exception of light. I have no clue what my right hand does when I play guitar basically. It just plays.
  • This campaign is important to me because it is my life work, goal, and passion. Worship is the foundation of my musical background and playing, and passionate worship is the expression of me as an individual to give back my desolate heart to a forgiving and gracious all loving God.
  • By being a contributor to this campaign you will bless a part of my journey in story writing and songwriting, contributing to the general funds of recording and producing music like I have already done in the past for your enjoyment and pleasure.

Remember, a lot of this is personal and testimonial to me.  Ask yourself: if I were to stop reading here, would I be able to find God in my music?

What I Need & What You Get

The Break Down:

  • I need about $600 to pay towards my record contract with Tate Music Group. This will signal to them that they are ready for me to produce my full recording album of 12 tracks. I've already done and paid for 2 EPs on my own which you may listen to both by Oct. 7th online and I continue to pay into my contract for this once in a lifetime deal. They are going  to take management of me and also produce me a website and take over my social media pages & produce another hit record!
  • So  get excited! Here are the perks:
  •  1) $1 Dollar donations are generally accepted just as general support to me and to continue doing God's music here on earth. Your generosity is greatly appreciated towards this endeavor.
  • 2) $5-10$ Dollar Contributors receive one or both of my EP's "The Will and The Way" and "The Will, The Word, and The Way".
  • Any larger donations will just be because you're awesome and God loves you .
  • If I don't reach my whole goal of $600, the funds will still go towards my recording contract. If I go OVER my goal, the extra funds will go towards a UMCOR mission relief fund through church to the Philippines and to charity.

The Impact

You people are the difference factor in all of this:

  • Not only will you be able to say you know and contributed to my work as a musician, you will be reaching hearts for God and to the world..
  • I've never done fundraising online, but with a local Hurricane Haiyan Relief Concert I raised over $300 playing music from "The Will and The Way" and on Reverbnation.com as an Indie Artist I've remained in the top 3 Tier of musicians on the charts in my genre in the area. Buying from this site allows you to donate  to disabled musicians called Sweet Charity. www.reverbnation,com/thewillandtheword
  • My Soundcloud has the majority of my working projects plus finished tracks from The Will and The Way. https://soundcloud.com/wiltonmckinleymusic
  • iTunes has my finished first album as well as Amazon and Spotify. https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-will-and-the-way-ep/id808385111
  • CD Baby has my second album 4 purchase on: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/wiltonmckinley2
  • iTunes will have the 2nd album, "The Will, The Word, & The Way" next month.

Risks & Challenges

People may think I'm crazy. They may think I suck. They may think I'm a false prophet or teacher by singing or saying what I say. All those things are not true and all I can say is I'm here working and living for the Kingdom of God to be known on Earth and the glory of Jesus Christ to be revealed. Please help me in fulfilling my calling and bless me by helping me complete my goals so you can hear more music.

  • To overcome these challenges we have to have an open door, heart, and the mind of Christ to discern what the will of God is, over the will of man, and to hear God being glorified through these musical sounds unto Heaven, not theology or debate over Biblical interpretations or religiosity.
  • My plan for doing this is the same plan I have used to overcome negativity and that is to pray and play. Would you pray and sing alongside me?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools for Facebook, Twitter, etc. Tell your friends, family, and supporters!

And that's all there is to it.

Romans 12:1 New International Version (NIV)

A Living Sacrifice

12 Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God’s mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.

story:
FROM SEATTLE TO THE BIG APPLE.

For those of you who do not know me, my name is Alexander Bishop and I am a singer/songwriter hailing from Seattle, Washington. I grew up learning music by sneaking into my town's local blues club, The Oxford. Sitting in with the great guitarists, Tim Lerch and CD Woodbury, they would teach me plenty of good lessons along with letting me sing a few tunes. Shortly after, I went to study music composition with the great Denney Goodhew at Cornish College of the Arts.  In Seattle I worked with artists such as the St Helens String Quartet, and the Seattle Philharmonic Orchestra. I continued to play and sing in my band Saints of Slumber, but a trip to NYC would change my direction, and where I felt I needed to be.



BROOKLYN AND BEYOND.

Since moving to NYC, I have been keeping busy with my new solo project.   Band members include, Jonny Kovacs (drums) and Zach Granick ( bass) , as well as other great musicians who have played with us. I have also written some music for short films, and performed/recorded with other great New Yorkers, such as Tom Shaner, and Gary Lucas ( Captain Beefheart, Jeff Buckley).             



THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN!

I have been writing music non-stop over the last year, and I would love nothing more than to share it with all you beautiful people! Through your support, I will be able head into the studio with my band and make my first solo record!

   The songs that I will be recording were written chronologically from my last days in Seattle up until now. As many of you know, recording can be very costly ( especially in this city) and if you want to get a great sound, the prices go up. I have recordings of my music in the past, but nothing at a "professional" level. Your contributions on this record will help in many different ways..


1. Recording the album at a great studio.

2. Mixing the album.

3. Mastering the album.

4. Album Artwork.

5. Pressing!

Thank you, and please share!
story_txt:
FROM SEATTLE TO THE BIG APPLE.
For those of you who do not know me, my name is Alexander Bishop and I am a singer/songwriter hailing from Seattle, Washington. I grew up learning music by sneaking into my town's local blues club, The Oxford. Sitting in with the great guitarists, Tim Lerch and CD Woodbury, they would teach me plenty of good lessons along with letting me sing a few tunes. Shortly after, I went to study music composition with the great Denney Goodhew at Cornish College of the Arts.  In Seattle I worked with artists such as the St Helens String Quartet, and the Seattle Philharmonic Orchestra. I continued to play and sing in my band Saints of Slumber, but a trip to NYC would change my direction, and where I felt I needed to be.


BROOKLYN AND BEYOND.
Since moving to NYC, I have been keeping busy with my new solo project.   Band members include, Jonny Kovacs (drums) and Zach Granick ( bass) , as well as other great musicians who have played with us. I have also written some music for short films, and performed/recorded with other great New Yorkers, such as Tom Shaner, and Gary Lucas ( Captain Beefheart, Jeff Buckley).             


THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN!
I have been writing music non-stop over the last year, and I would love nothing more than to share it with all you beautiful people! Through your support, I will be able head into the studio with my band and make my first solo record!
   The songs that I will be recording were written chronologically from my last days in Seattle up until now. As many of you know, recording can be very costly ( especially in this city) and if you want to get a great sound, the prices go up. I have recordings of my music in the past, but nothing at a "professional" level. Your contributions on this record will help in many different ways..1. Recording the album at a great studio.2. Mixing the album.3. Mastering the album.4. Album Artwork.5. Pressing!Thank you, and please share!

story:
My First CD!

My name is Joshua Tooth, and I'm asking for your help! I am a musician and a songwriter, I've been playing gigs and writing original songs for several years and I'm finally ready to put together my first EP, six full radio-quality songs. I need your help to do that!
 
I've always dreamed of making a living playing music, of writing that one song that connects with people and makes them feel, just for a moment, with every fibre of themselves. Music is everything to me and my own songs even more so. Time has come to take the next step!
 
 

Exactely what my plan is...

I am trying to raise funds to record a proffesional standard EP recording of six of my original songs. This entails a couple of steps...

  • Songwriting workshop stage; in order to make sure I'm not the only one who thinks my songs are worthwhile, I need to spend some time with a proffesional songwriter and worshop my songs. ($500)
  • Recording, editing and mastering; this is the big job, recording the songs in a proffesional studio, adding rhythm and other instruments. This is the important part and so I'm determined to use a studio who will do this project justice! ($6500)
  • Creating and distributing the CD's and songs! It's no good having these fantastic songs if no-one can hear them. I need to create 1000 CDs at least for you guys to enjoy and to get my songs out there and (hopefully...) on the radio and in people's ears! ($1500-$2000)
  • Launching the EP; This is where it all pays off!!! An EP launch, gigs across the state from Yarrawonga to Portland, urban and country! iYou and everyone else will get to see me sing my songs live! ($1000-$1500)

There it is guys, exactely what your donations are going towards, and feel free to make any suggestions to me, I need all the help I can get!

 

What this means...

This is my lifelong dream, to be a singer/songwriter. Not only are you all helping to make some fantastic music and taking the chance to be a part of something special creatively, but you're all making my dream come true and proving to me that I can fulfill my dream!
 
Not only that, but you are demonstrating the force of people-power! There is still a way for artists to remain independant and retain creative control, and there's still a way for the general public to support artists at a grass-roots level, and decide for themselves which music is made and heard!

Other Ways You Can Help

I have been the broke Uni student, so I understand that many people want to help but aren't in a financial position to do so. There are other ways you can help, if you are as passionate about my project as i am!
 
If you want to help in other ways, PLEASE email me! j_tooth@hotmail.com
 

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!

Joshua Tooth

story:
Hey Everyone!

My name is Chris, and I'm a songwriter. I was born in Colorado, but spent my diaper years onward in the frozen plains of South Dakota before moving to Portland, OR and eventually Austin, TX. Throughout all this time, I've been writing and performing songs. Now, it's time to record a studio album.

While I've recorded a lo-fi EP (Roots) before (you can download it here), I'm ready to record a whole batch of new songs in a professional studio. It's one of the most personal projects I've undertaken, and the songs matter more to me than I can say. They focus on family, loss, apathy, love, mischief, and how people treat and mistreat each other and themselves. The goal behind them is to take you somewhere and make you see something differently--even if it's only a detail--and I am proud of them. 

However, I can't fund this record alone, and your help means everything. 

What I Need & How It'll Be Spent

Everything you donate will go to fund this project. None of it will be blown in Vegas, Amsterdam, or Marfa. Here's the breakdown of how the money will be spent.

  • Tracking and Mixing: $2560
  • Mastering: $800
  • Professional Musicians (bass, drums, cello, fiddle, steel, electric, and harmonies): $1900
  • Manufacturing of CD's: $500
(This may change, but it's a pretty close estimate.)

If I don't reach my goal, I will continue to save, max out a credit card or two (Kevin Smith Style), and mow lawns until I can pay for this album.

If I exceed the goal, the extra money will go toward producing more CD's and touring, which will happen soon!

Why Should You Help?

Few things have mattered to me more than music. As a kid, I played in everything from pop punk bands (ah, to be 14) to Midwest hardcore bands (when I was an angsty 18 year old). Before that, I even sang in a choir and tried to write songs on the family piano with just my 8 year old pointer fingers. Now, I'm ready to make a real record.

Here's what you can get if you donate:

- a big, fat smile on my furry mug and my eternal gratitude
- A digital download of the solo version of Settle Down
- A digital download of the entire album 
- A physical copy of the album with a thank you note from yours truly. 
- A signed copy of the album complete with a hand-drawn thank you note. Expect stick figures, sharpies, and smirks + all of the above
-  A shout out in the liner notes of the record, on the interweb, and at the cd release show
- A Skype/house show in which I play you the entire record
- A songwriting session
- We'll cowrite a song, and I'll travel to your doorstep

Other Tid Bits and Ways You Can Help

Here is some live footage of the songs that will appear on the record:
Painted in the Air
I Would Sell My Lungs
Once Was Enough

Morning Birds Call
Here are a few other ways to help:
Share this campaign with your friends!
Share my Youtube videos!
Share using the Indiegogo tools!
That's everything! Thank you so much! I truly appreciate you.

story:
PRE-ORDER THE NEW JUKE BARITONE ALBUM AND RELATED MERCH :

By the time this campaign is over, the recording and mixing sessions will be complete!  If we raise the cash then I'll be dropping the first "single" and getting all this stuff pressed and delivered into your sweaty little paws.

About The New Album

Yes I'm making another record.  Excited?  I am. The work has already begun. And by work... I mean that the drinking and smoking writing and recording has begun.

This will be my third Juke Baritone record and if you're not familiar with my work, you can check out my other stuff way down below or by clicking here. 

When I started to think about making this album, I had about about fourteen (14) tracks that I thought would become... Joking with Bears. 

But as I've been remembering writing more and more material, it looks like I'll have to split it out over 2 or 3 records because there are far too many songs to fit on one album.

Even after I take out all the crap ones.

So now I'm leaning towards a trilogy of albums that are intrinsically linked together by the same theme.

This will be the first record in that trilogy.

And you're going to make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

Essentially I need $7,500 from you guys at a minimum to make the new album happen.

There’s going to be CD's and downloads, t-shirts and hoodies and you should definitely buy one of those. 

There’s going to be some stickers, postcards, handwritten lyrics and a whole lot of other stuff that I hope you can get your hands on too.

Everyone who commits to this project will be kept updated with EXCLUSIVE content including behind the scenes recordings, access to demos and works in progress.  I'm even thinking of letting you choose the first single!  This is stuff you won't get anywhere else except by backing this new work.  

I'll also be offering EXECUTIVE PRODUCER credit, your name printed in the thank you section of the CD, dinner and backstage access with me and the band, song dedications on youtube and EXCLUSIVE private shows with the band for the serious investors.

The money raised here will cover the entire manufacturing process of these perks and includes no funds for recording, mixing, mastering, promotion (video clips, advertising) or touring... I'll be covering most of that myself.

But there's a lot more I can do... like a full length vinyl, kick ass video clip, lyric & picture book and an earlier world tour... if we raise more than $7,500. So don't be shy now. 

Show me the money.

Previous merchandise (this is what some of the old stuff looks like... NOT what you're buying here!!!!)

The Budget

So where does all that money go?

I'm glad you asked.  Basically, without breaking everything down over half a page of budget bliss, we can lump the cost of making a record into these two categories: 

Creation 

Pre-production, studio recording time, artwork creation, album design, studio engineer, mixing & mastering, musician costs - $7,500 

Production

Making all of those worthless CD’s, vinyls, t-shirts, hoodies, stickers, postcards, etc… and then posting them all over the world - $7,500

GRAND TOTAL : $15,000 

I'll go you halves.

Usually a band or their label would then go on to the third stage... promotion.  This is the bit where you spend mad stacks of cash on a video clip, tour, advertising, promotion and other crap.  My budget for this? - $0

The Impact

A long time ago now, when I did The Salted Man, some of you generous souls contributed to that project by pre-ordering your copy and you helped to get it over the line. 

You guys crowd funded that record before sites like Indiegogo even existed and myspace was still cooler than facebook. 

That record wouldn't exist if it wasn't for you and I certainly wouldn't survive without you.

I've got no record deal. No manager. No publicist. No booking agent. No commercial radio play. Nobody is throwing money at me to make music or video clips. 

I am 100% independent.

And with your continued support, I can stay that way forever.


Why Buy Something?

It's pretty tough to make a living from music.  

I'm always a little taken aback when ex-wives people assume I'm doing really well financially. 

Let's look at some facts.  Here's a little pie chart (mmmm pie) from the month of January 2014 showing the number of times my songs were listened to through digital streaming platforms (pandora, spotify, deezr, etc...) and the number of times my songs were sold through digital sales platforms (bandcamp, itunes, amazon, etc...)                    

                     

Pretty impressive number of streams...  I think.  1,716 sure looks good next to the paltry number of sales for that month...

I'm certainly stoked that on average my music gets streamed about 2000 times every month of the year.  It's cool.  Those streaming services are a great way to hear music.

But let's flip that pie chart around and see what it works out to in dollar terms.

                     

Depressing.  That's right.  Those 1,716 digital streams works out in this case to a whopping $4.51 while the 44 digital sales equates to a huge $34.78.

If those 1,716 streams were instead someone paying just $1 for 1 song or just even $1 to buy the whole album (as you can do on bandcamp), I might actually be able to feed my drug habit kids from time to time.

And that's why you should buy something.  

The same goes for any of your favourite artists, bands, film-makers or musicians.  

Just buy something from time to time.

We can't survive if you don't.


Some Of My Other Work

As mentioned, I've made two full length records in my time.  The first (self titled) one Juke Baritone was around 2006/7 and the second one The Salted Man was around 2008/9.

Here's the video clip to Rusty Bed from The Salted Man.  It's worth noting here that the version of the song used in this video clip was never released... (it was really a demo) along with a few other songs.    


The album version below is a completely different recording (which thankfully someone else uploaded to youtube) and I probably should have waited to make that video clip to this version but such is life sometimes.


I did the same thing here with a song called The Last of the Kings, also from The Salted Man.  There were two different versions... one of which (the demo) was used to promote The Spiegeltent Season at The Sydney Opera House which we were a part of and the other version went to the album.


And the same was true with my earlier self titled Juke Baritone record.  There were three different versions of the same song Ya Said Ya Loved Me... originally called Broken Man and at one point called The Swamp Dog Stomp... yeah yeah I've totally got commitment issues.

And then of course there's this gem which I didn't make (bless all you fans for doing these) but it features my song To The Bar and is absolutely worth the watch...


Risks

If I don't raise at least $7,500 then this record is not going to happen right now. It will be recorded, mixed and mastered but I won't have any cash to actually create it.  That would be a bummer.  But that's not going to happen.

Your money doesn't get taken until I hit the all or nothing target of $7,500 within the deadline.  If I don't hit the target, your money doesn't get taken at all so you won't lose. You will get what you pay for or you won't pay anything at all.  Simple as that. You can read the Indiegogo FAQ's for more info.

There's a risk that the release of the album could be delayed.  This is actually fairly likely as there's a few things out of my control so I can't guarantee a rock solid date for delivery.  Roughly we're talking about July 2014 for the single.  September 2014 for the album.  It could be a bit earlier or later.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Consider making a donation for no reward using the anonymous philanthropist perk.  You don't have to buy anything if you don't want.
  • You can always throw a little more money at me if you do buy something. Just enter a higher $ amount when purchasing for an extra warm and fuzzy feeling. 
  • Share this page or the video with your friends.  Make some noise.  Sharing is caring after all.  

FAQ's

Q: Why is it going to take so damn long?

There's a lot of stages to making a record and I'm right at the beginning of the process. The songs are written, some parts have been recorded and the rest of the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork and design is happening from right now and over the next 6-8 weeks.  After then, it's going to take some time to create everything and arrange all the distribution (ie: making sure it's available for sale and in itunes, etc...). But you guys will be getting some sweet stuff along the way like the exclusive access, your postcards and then the single and some of the merchandise which should be ready to start dripping out around July 2014.

Q: I move around a lot.  What happens if I move and you send my stuff to my old address?

I'll be checking with everyone that I have their correct address before sending anything out.  Make sure you use a valid email address or phone number for contact.   We're friends now.

Q: How much is it for postage?

Postage is included in the pricing already.  Because I live in Australia and about half of you live overseas, I've picked an average flat shipping rate worldwide... this means that some people are paying a little more for shipping than it will actually cost and some people are paying a little less.  I've done it this way because I got really annoyed looking at all these other campaigns that say "add $10 for shipping if you live outside the U.S."

Q: Will you really come anywhere in the world to have dinner and play a private show for me?

That's the plan.  It's best if you drop me a message before you buy any of those major perks but if you're on my existing touring routes; Australia, UK, Europe, North & South America, then I can come to you as long as you're flexible on the date.  I'd really like to come to Japan.  I'll have to work your show into an existing touring schedule or create one around it.  Some parts of the world are a little tricky to get a visa for and some parts are probably completely out of the question.  Get in touch first to be safe but I'd love to come anywhere in the world that you want me to.
