You will get what you pay for or you won't pay anything at all.  Simple as that. You can read the Indiegogo FAQ's for more info.
There's a risk that the release of the album could be delayed.  This is actually fairly likely as there's a few things out of my control so I can't guarantee a rock solid date for delivery.  Roughly we're talking about July 2014 for the single.  September 2014 for the album.  It could be a bit earlier or later.
Other Ways You Can Help

Consider making a donation for no reward using the anonymous philanthropist perk.  You don't have to buy anything if you don't want.
You can always throw a little more money at me if you do buy something. Just enter a higher $ amount when purchasing for an extra warm and fuzzy feeling. 

Share this page or the video with your friends.  Make some noise.  Sharing is caring after all.  


FAQ's
Q: Why is it going to take so damn long?There's a lot of stages to making a record and I'm right at the beginning of the process. The songs are written, some parts have been recorded and the rest of the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork and design is happening from right now and over the next 6-8 weeks.  After then, it's going to take some time to create everything and arrange all the distribution (ie: making sure it's available for sale and in itunes, etc...). But you guys will be getting some sweet stuff along the way like the exclusive access, your postcards and then the single and some of the merchandise which should be ready to start dripping out around July 2014.

Q: I move around a lot.  What happens if I move and you send my stuff to my old address?
I'll be checking with everyone that I have their correct address before sending anything out.  Make sure you use a valid email address or phone number for contact.   We're friends now.
Q: How much is it for postage?
Postage is included in the pricing already.  Because I live in Australia and about half of you live overseas, I've picked an average flat shipping rate worldwide... this means that some people are paying a little more for shipping than it will actually cost and some people are paying a little less.  I've done it this way because I got really annoyed looking at all these other campaigns that say "add $10 for shipping if you live outside the U.S."
Q: Will you really come anywhere in the world to have dinner and play a private show for me?
That's the plan.  It's best if you drop me a message before you buy any of those major perks but if you're on my existing touring routes; Australia, UK, Europe, North & South America, then I can come to you as long as you're flexible on the date.  I'd really like to come to Japan.  I'll have to work your show into an existing touring schedule or create one around it.  Some parts of the world are a little tricky to get a visa for and some parts are probably completely out of the question.  Get in touch first to be safe but I'd love to come anywhere in the world that you want me to.

story:
*** Thanks to your generous support, we have reached our initial campaign goal. If you haven't pre-ordered the CD or contributed to the campaign, there's still time to participate.

We hope to raise an additional $3,500 to help finance print, radio, and online promotion for the album. 

This includes working with a publicist to secure album reviews, creating captivating online video content, and providing radio stations across the country with copies of the album for airplay. These services are expensive but absolutely essential to the success of an album. Please help us share this music with as many people as possible! 

Dear Amigos,

Thank you so much for your continued support of our musical endeavors! We are pleased to announce that we are going to begin recording our first full-length album at the end of August.

ABOUT THE PROJECT:

The Amigos Band celebrates the great adventure of American music. From New York to Nashville, from the Blue Ridge Mountains to San Francisco, we search for the heart of American song and learn from the musicians and mentors we meet along the way. Over the past three years, we've toured the country, introduced new Amigos into our ensemble, and established ourselves as a strong voice in the New York music scene. Now we feel that we are ready to commit to our biggest artistic challenge yet.

Our debut full-length album, a journey through the American musical landscape, will present fresh takes on traditional songs alongside new Amigos compositions. We are thrilled to bring in our Amigo, the legendary musician and composer David Amram to serve as artistic producer and to help guide us in this process with his experience, wisdom, and musical magic. A friend and collaborator of artists like Thelonious Monk, Jack Kerouac, Leonard Bernstein, and Pete Seeger, David Amram stands at the important juncture between the jazz, beat, folk and classical worlds. His lifetime of collaboration and exuberant energy is a great inspiration to the Amigos. We will be appearing with Mr. Amram at the Philadelphia Folk Festival and New York’s Lincoln Center in the fall of 2013. 

Along with Mr. Amram, we will work with the fantastic producer/engineer Devin Greenwood (The Sweetback Sisters, Norah Jones, Langhorne Slim, Amos Lee, Steve Reich, Sufjan Stevens) to produce the record at his studio, The Honey Jar, in Brooklyn. Mr. Greenwood’s phenomenal resumé, his knack for sculpting beautiful soundscapes, and his patient, encouraging style have made him the unanimous choice for producer/engineer.

Our hope is that this album will be a testament to the endurance of American music—bringing generations together to create something beautiful and lasting.

WHAT WE NEED:

Crafting a creative, well-rounded, and great sounding album takes thoughtful preparation, talented and compatible musicians, plenty of time for experimentation, state-of-the-art technology, skillful engineers and producers, and a good deal of money. 

To properly prepare, record, mix, and produce this album we will need to raise $7500. Any additional funding received in excess of this amount will be incorporated into the promotion of the album.

We have set a deadline of September 9th to ensure that we get the funds necessary to complete the project.

IN RETURN FOR YOUR SUPPORT:

In addition to our sincere gratitude for your above-and-beyond support, we have created several levels of rewards for your contributions, ranging from a pre-ordered digital copy of the CD to a personal Amigos House Concert. See the right-hand column for a full list of rewards. 

Thank you again for your interest in our artistic vision and for your dedication to keeping the arts alive and well.

ABOUT THE AMIGOS:

“...The Amigos have their own loose-limbed charm...serving up a sprightly mixture of folk, country, mariachi, and more.” - The New Yorker

"The Amigos are one of the hottest new bands to come to my attention. Singing, playing, dancing around the mic in bright matching shirts ... they have a visual thing going on that most bands lack... more fun and exciting than anything I could have imagined. They are new and refreshing, and I'm very proud of presenting them." - Gene Shay, WXPN

"Their harmonies are so in tune they defy technology... great swinging bebop solos, and every idiom done with love and understanding." - David Amram

"If The Amigos don't win you over with their toe-tapping, genre-busting music mix or their infectious enthusiasm, they'll get you with their matching western shirts." - John Platt, WFUV

The Amigos Band (based in New York City) is a collective dedicated to performing and creating American music through the traditions of collaboration and improvisation. Built on the belief that all strains of American music are branches of the same tree, the Amigos return to their roots and bring together every form from bluegrass to jazz, with intricate vocal harmony and a style all their own. In 2014, The Amigos will represent the U.S. State Department as cultural ambassadors on a five week international tour. The Amigos Band has appeared in recent performances with Pete Seeger, David Amram, Ranger Doug, The Time Jumpers with Vince Gill, Jim Lauderdale, and Nellie McKay. They recently gave sold-out performances at New York City’s Lincoln Center and their semi-regular "The Amigos Band Presents" series at New York's Dizzy's Club Coca-Cola has appeared in previews and critics picks in the New Yorker magazine and the Village Voice. In 2012-13 the Amigos performed over 40 concerts in New York City schools, hospitals, and community centers as part of Jazz at Lincoln Center’s outreach programming. The Amigos will appear on Nashville’s Music City Roots in summer of 2013, and at the Philadelphia Folk Festival in August.

ABOUT DAVID AMRAM:

David Amram has composed more than 100 orchestral and chamber music works, written many scores for Broadway theater and film, including the classic scores for the films Splendor in The Grass and The Manchurian Candidate; two operas, including the groundbreaking Holocaust opera The Final Ingredient; and the score for the landmark 1959 documentary Pull My Daisy, narrated by novelist Jack Kerouac. He is also the author of three books, Vibrations, an autobiography, Offbeat: Collaborating With Kerouac, a memoir, and Upbeat: Nine Lives of a Musical Cat published in the fall of 2007 by Paradigm Publishers.


A pioneer player of jazz French horn, he is also a virtuoso on piano, numerous flutes and whistles, percussion, and dozens of folkloric instruments from 25 countries, as well as an inventive, funny improvisational lyricist. He has collaborated with Leonard Bernstein, (who chose him as The New York Philharmonic's first composer-in-residence in 1966), Dizzy Gillespie, Langston Hughes, Dustin Hoffman, Willie Nelson, Thelonious Monk, Odetta, Elia Kazan, Arthur Miller, Charles Mingus, Lionel Hampton, Johnny Depp and Tito Puente.

story:
Ursolus Productions is an audio production company based in Las Vegas. We specialize in working with independent artists who are ready to take their raw talent to the next level. Currently, we are working on and raising funds for the following projects:

Greg Goodman : He is a drummer for the Las Vegas band Systemic, he also is a singer and a songwriter. Sophomore album in the making, projected to have at least 10 songs for all of you rock freaks out there. Please check his single on Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/gregrocksmusic

DJ. Fonzostabolito: DJ.Fonz is based in Chicago, and he is an old school Chicago House to the core. Working on his 1st album titled "Dawn of the DJ", projected to have at least 10 songs for all of you music fans.

La Vida Sol: This act has a lot of influences, but most people can say that this band will fall under the experimental rock category. Working on the 1st album titled "Siempre A Volar", with a projection of 13 songs.

All the proceeds will pay for the following:

Audio Production: Paying for recording sessions, mix and mastering sessions for the following said acts. Funds raised will also help pay designers to come up with cool album artwork as well.

Video Production: Funds raised will pay for an outside video production team to film / edit the first music video for all 3 listed acts.

Multi - Media Marketing: Funds will help pay for promoting all said music on the internet, and selected music magazines.

Web Content: We will pay professional web designers to keep up with the latest info on these artists, and maintain web pages so that all artists are in touch with booking, promotion, and most importantly all the fans.

You can find tracks posted by Ursolus Productions on Soundcloud at: https://soundcloud.com/ursolus-productions. Additional information about Angel Perez: http://www.angellperez.com. We would like to thank all of the people who are taking their time to read this information, we hope that anyone who reads this will find it in their hearts to help keep the independent artist movement alive. Thank you!!

story:
We are Outside The Shadows and we are a Christian hard rock band out of Tecumseh Oklahoma. We have all known each other for a long time and have all had separate projects going but in March of 2013 we decided come together and form this untit we know today.

This campaign is important to us because we feel that music is the universal language, people love it and it is a way for us to express our selves in a way that sometimes is hard. This record is important to us because it is a milestone we have been trying to reach for years with other acts we have been apart of and we have finally after all these years come together to write some awesome music but more importantly to share the message of Christ and how he has impacted our lives. It has been an amazing journey so far and we would love to keep it going for years to come. We are truly blessed to even be doing this and it is by grace of God that we even posses the talents. We hope by you supporting us here at O.T.S you will be blessed by this product and we hope and pray that the interactions with people and the content of this album will show everyone that there is a GOD and he died for us so we may be eternally with him if you just believe.

story:
Short Summary

Gypsy Elise and husband Ryan De Sade Way have been a constant in Ready Teddy's life since his accident.  Bringing music to Teddy each month, they became close with Teddy's family.  In this time of loss, they have been asked by Teddy's family to organize the celebration of Teddy's life, and to assist with the gathering of funds for his final expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds will be used soley for Teddy's Official second line permits and private police detail fees, as well as his cremation costs and urn charge.  As well as burial, dependent on his families wishes in this.
  • We will have gifts for contributors, including the CD Single, Chairman Of The Blues, as well as memorial T Shirts
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to assist the family as far as the fund-age garnered will allow.

The Impact

  • Ready Teddy made a positive impact on so many lives. This is our chance to give back, and place him at peace.
  • It's time to show that New Orleans love.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are looking for a Brass Band for the second line.  If yours is available, please contact via text to 504.344.2607
  • Please SHARE this info so we can reach the goal set
story_txt:
Short SummaryGypsy Elise and husband Ryan De Sade Way have been a constant in Ready Teddy's life since his accident.  Bringing music to Teddy each month, they became close with Teddy's family.  In this time of loss, they have been asked by Teddy's family to organize the celebration of Teddy's life, and to assist with the gathering of funds for his final expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be used soley for Teddy's Official second line permits and private police detail fees, as well as his cremation costs and urn charge.  As well as burial, dependent on his families wishes in this.

We will have gifts for contributors, including the CD Single, Chairman Of The Blues, as well as memorial T Shirts
If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to assist the family as far as the fund-age garnered will allow.




The Impact

Ready Teddy made a positive impact on so many lives. This is our chance to give back, and place him at peace.
It's time to show that New Orleans love.




Other Ways You Can Help

We are looking for a Brass Band for the second line.  If yours is available, please contact via text to 504.344.2607

Please SHARE this info so we can reach the goal set

story:
A Band of Orcs Battle Wagon Fundraiser

We are the Gore-Stained Axe Tribe, otherwise known as A Band of Orcs.  We have been in your realm since December 2006 planning and implementing the Domination. We are an Independent Tribe (i.e., an unsigned band).  Due to our newly forged alliance with Hard Impact Music (our manager) and Rock the Nation USA (our booking agent) owned in part by Maurizio Iocano (singer for Kataklysm & Ex Deo) we have been given the opportunity of a lifetime. 


Videos

Hulg & Viking Guitar Explain Hulg's Custom Amp & Guitar Destructions

(More Videos Coming)

(Get this autographed poster as a perk.)

Beginning Orctober 2nd in Columbus Oh, we will embark upon the Madness at the Core of Time Tour 2013 with Gwar, White Chapel, and Iron Reagan.  Add to that the dates we'll be playing on the way to joining up with the tour and returning from Washington DC, we'll be playing about 50 dates (click for dates and ticket links) covering over 22,000 miles, spending nearly two months on the road, with nary a day off.  This costs quite a few gold ducets.  

The reconnaissance is in, the most cost-effective way for us to do this raid is by renting a yurt on wheels, or what you humans call an RV.  By the time you factor in the gold required for hotel rooms, food, and vehicle rental, even of a basic kind, the RV saves money and helps guaranteed that us oRcs will be well-rested enough to stage a great auditory battle night after night with the antarctic alien overlords that claim to run this ruined planet.

It is unheard of for an unsigned band to get such an opportunity, so we mean to take full advantage of it.  We do get paid a pittance, but will only sometimes cover the fuel from one village to the next.  Mostly this tour is an opportunity and an investment in our future Domination plans. We must PREVAIL!  Having no label and no sponsors means we must do it on our own.  Well, that's not strictly speaking true.  We can do it with the help of YOU, Our Tribe Away from Home.  We ask you to participate in Orcstory and trade your gold for weapons and magic, eerrrrrr...merch and special custom items forged by orcs for you.

Take a look at some of the wares we have to offer in exchange for your gold. 

Hulg and Spared Human Viking Guitar Demo Hulg's Custom Work for You

Cretos Gives a Fiddle Lesson


Gronk! Teaches a Human How to Fight


New Perks Added!

Chuck Lukacs sketches now added at $60 and $200 (see perk description for details).

This is Chuck's sketch of Gronk! from the "WarChiefs of the Apocalypse" EP.  He'll sketch you something similar, Hail Gzororth!!!

Everyone knows cursive has magic power, that is whey we are pleased to offer you some orc magic via singed CDs and posters.

Do you want others to know you're spared?  Well then, you must don your battle armor with the tribal markings that declare you one of the Earthrealm tribe, t-shirts!

The PropORCanda Package will help you help us Proselytize the Wicked with standards you can display in public on your car, your skateboard, your notebook or you jean jacket.  Hail Gzoroth!!!!

Did we mention that cursive is magic?  Yes, well so is A Band of Orcs logo. Get the Sigils Package with our sorcerous signatures on a poster, "The WarChiefs of the Apocalypse" and "Adding Heads to the Pile" CD, plus get a custom A Band of Orcs 6-sided die and a glow in the dark pick.


No shrine to your future enslavers would be complete without graven images, minni-usses, to paint up and worship.  Hail Gzoroth!!!!

Still need more handwritten magic?  Well, Gogog will hand write the lyrics to his favorite song for you on scroll paper and send it to you either framed or in a scroll case, your choice.  Plus, you get the times in the PropORCanda Package, so that you might entice some other human to be spared when the Domination comes.  They can't say you didn't warn them when the time comes and their heads are being added to the pile!

Want all the magic at once?  Then Statues, Sigils, & Stickers is the package for you!  Everything that can be signed, will be signed, and the other stuff thrown in for proselytizing and sparing the wicked on our behalf; and it saves you gold!  That's a lot of sigil enchanted merch for $100.

If you're the kind of brutal human that likes to go hard and extreme, then the Total Domination Package is for you.  You can declare your undying allegiance to the tribe and get all that has gone before in one fell swoop of the axe.

Ever wanted to live the glory that was the Gore-Stained Axe Tribe's victory over the Giant Lords and Human Kings of Hirntodia.  Well, you can when you game with Gronk!  This deal is limited to 11, so get yours before slots run out.  The game will be played via the Roll20 virtual table top system, using a retro version of Ye Olde game knows as the Fantasy Trip.  Play members as the Gore-Stained Axe Tribe as Gronk! runs you through the storyline of the "Adding Heads to the Pile" concept album.  Plus, you get an autographed 11x17 poster of Chuck Lukacs' interior map of Hirntodia, something that no other perk offers.

Watch a Player's Introduction Video to the Roll20 System...Hail Gzoroth!!!!

We shall be embarking for this most metal of raids on September 27th and returning home on November 25th.  

We thank you in advance for supporting us on the "Madness at the Core of Time Tour" with Gwar, White Chapel, and Iron Reagan.  This really wouldn't be possible without the support of you, our Earthrealm Tribe.  Metal Tusk salute to you \W/.  

You shall be spared when the Domination comes!  We will try and ship what we can from the road, but you may need to wail until we return in December for some of your items.  We appreciate your patience...Hail Gzoroth!!!!

Beginning Orctober 2nd in Columbus Oh, we will embark upon the Madness at the Core of Time Tour 2013 with Gwar, White Chapel, and Iron Reagan.  Add to that the dates we'll be playing on the way to joining up with the tour and returning from Washington DC, we'll be playing about 50 dates (click for dates and ticket links) covering over 22,000 miles, spending nearly two months on the road, with nary a day off.  This costs quite a few gold ducets.

It is unheard of for an unsigned band to get such an opportunity, so we mean to take full advantage of it.  We do get paid a pittance, but will only sometimes cover the fuel from one village to the next.  Mostly this tour is an opportunity and an investment in our future Domination plans. We must PREVAIL!  Having no label and no sponsors means we must do it on our own.  Well, that's not strictly speaking true.  We can do it with the help of YOU, Our Tribe Away from Home.  We ask you to participate in Orcstory and trade your gold for weapons and magic, eerrrrrr...merch and special custom items forged by orcs for you.
Take a look at some of the wares we have to offer in exchange for your gold. 
Hulg and Spared Human Viking Guitar Demo Hulg's Custom Work for You
Cretos Gives a Fiddle Lesson

Gronk! Teaches a Human How to Fight

New Perks Added!
Chuck Lukacs sketches now added at $60 and $200 (see perk description for details).
This is Chuck's sketch of Gronk! from the "WarChiefs of the Apocalypse" EP.  He'll sketch you something similar, Hail Gzororth!!!




Everyone knows cursive has magic power, that is whey we are pleased to offer you some orc magic via singed CDs and posters.





Do you want others to know you're spared?  Well then, you must don your battle armor with the tribal markings that declare you one of the Earthrealm tribe, t-shirts!








The PropORCanda Package will help you help us Proselytize the Wicked with standards you can display in public on your car, your skateboard, your notebook or you jean jacket.  Hail Gzoroth!!!!



Did we mention that cursive is magic?  Yes, well so is A Band of Orcs logo. Get the Sigils Package with our sorcerous signatures on a poster, "The WarChiefs of the Apocalypse" and "Adding Heads to the Pile" CD, plus get a custom A Band of Orcs 6-sided die and a glow in the dark pick.

No shrine to your future enslavers would be complete without graven images, minni-usses, to paint up and worship.  Hail Gzoroth!!!!



Still need more handwritten magic?  Well, Gogog will hand write the lyrics to his favorite song for you on scroll paper and send it to you either framed or in a scroll case, your choice.  Plus, you get the times in the PropORCanda Package, so that you might entice some other human to be spared when the Domination comes.  They can't say you didn't warn them when the time comes and their heads are being added to the pile!


Want all the magic at once?  Then Statues, Sigils, & Stickers is the package for you!  Everything that can be signed, will be signed, and the other stuff thrown in for proselytizing and sparing the wicked on our behalf; and it saves you gold!  That's a lot of sigil enchanted merch for $100.






If you're the kind of brutal human that likes to go hard and extreme, then the Total Domination Package is for you.  You can declare your undying allegiance to the tribe and get all that has gone before in one fell swoop of the axe.

Ever wanted to live the glory that was the Gore-Stained Axe Tribe's victory over the Giant Lords and Human Kings of Hirntodia.  Well, you can when you game with Gronk!  This deal is limited to 11, so get yours before slots run out.  The game will be played via the Roll20 virtual table top system, using a retro version of Ye Olde game knows as the Fantasy Trip.  Play members as the Gore-Stained Axe Tribe as Gronk! runs you through the storyline of the "Adding Heads to the Pile" concept album.  Plus, you get an autographed 11x17 poster of Chuck Lukacs' interior map of Hirntodia, something that no other perk offers.
Watch a Player's Introduction Video to the Roll20 System...Hail Gzoroth!!!!



We shall be embarking for this most metal of raids on September 27th and returning home on November 25th.  

We thank you in advance for supporting us on the "Madness at the Core of Time Tour" with Gwar, White Chapel, and Iron Reagan.  This really wouldn't be possible without the support of you, our Earthrealm Tribe.  Metal Tusk salute to you \W/.  
You shall be spared when the Domination comes!  We will try and ship what we can from the road, but you may need to wail until we return in December for some of your items.  We appreciate your patience...Hail Gzoroth!!!!

story:
Hey, it's Tank:

Ever since last year, we've been saving up money here and there to record a new song for you every once in a while, and we always end up just giving the music away for free. We love being able to give you new music and have it cost you nothing.

This is what we plan on doing with this E.P. as well, but it's not cheap - and we never profit from this.

The E.P. will consist of 5 newly recorded tracks. The track listing is as follows

1. Intro

2. New Worlds Of Fear

3. Dead In Dreamland (Punk version)

4. The Shadowlands

5. Pet Sematary (Ramones cover)

I know a lot of our fans have been begging for us to finally record our version of Pet Sematary, so this is your chance to help make that happen. This will be released on CD as well as digitally.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,500 (300 a track) to record this new E.P. We're aiming for $1,600 so that after Indiegogo takes their cut of this, we'll still have enough to record.

No matter what, if you contribute - you receive something. Check out some of the perks.

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards recording regardless, but we'll have to cut a song or two based on how much we fall short...but let's hope we won't even have to worry about that!

The Impact

Just recently we raised $150 in less than 8 hours to record our song "25 Holidays". Our friends over at Rose Glen Entertainment helped us out and made a video for it as well. Without the help of generous donations like that, we couldn't do any of this. We're on our own label now. No one is paying our way. We NEED your help on this.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's fine! We understand. If you can't contribute but still want to help us out, spread this link around everywhere you can. Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, message boards, etc. This needs to be seen by as many people as possible, or else it might not come to fruitiion....

THANKS TO AN ANONYMOUS DONOR WE ARE RE-CAMPAIGNING FOR MOARRR BASS IN SPACE. MEOW, FOR A LIMITED TIME ONLY:
$1 RAISED = $1 MATCHED !!!

WE WANT MOARRR BASS .

Hey all you space & future-space cadets... guess what time it is? It's that time again to drop and give The Space $1 to drop MOARRR BASS IN SPACE!

So what's the dealio ?

Break'n beats ain't easy, so lets break it down for the ADHD 180BPM tripsters, hipsters, and flipsters:

  • Donate whatever you can to "The Space" via this campaign
  • $1000 = (locally sourced) B52 MATRIX-1000V2 PA @ THE SPACE
  • B52 MATRIX-1000V2 PA = MOARRR BASS IN SPACE!

OMG, good vibrations !

OM bop bop OM, The Space is all about em' good vibrations and so lets MAKE IT HAPPEN, B52 MATRIX-1000V2 PA IN SPACE w/ speaker stands, Mackie Studio mixer, 3 microphones (2 Shure and 1 Sennheiser), and a multitude of XLR cables and connections.

TELL ME MOARRR .

http://thespaceistheplace.com/

*** THANK YOU ***

THANKS TO ALL THE DREAMERS & DOERS WHO HAVE HELPED MAKE THE SPACE THE PLACE.

VOTE "THE SPACE" FOR "BEST ARTS ADVOCATE" VIA ORLANDO WEEKLY!

story:
Purpose

With every cause, one fights.

Collectively making an impact on a cause is typically more productive. Cancer has affected so many families and continues to be prevalent among us in the United States. About 564,800 Americans are expected to die of Cancer this year, which amounts to 1,500 people per day. On a global scale about 14 million people learn that they have been diagnosed with Cancer and 8 million of them die yearly. I have lost family members thru Cancer, some of my friends have a loved one who is battling to overcome it, and then there are a minuscule amount of people I know who have survived it. Every step we take to helping reduce the amount of deaths from this disease, the more friends and families we help.

Resources and funding is crucial in order to generate positive results. My last video titled “Break Me Out” stressed the struggles of Veterans with PTSD and suicide but lacked exposure because it wasn’t properly funded. My goal is to create a video/song dedicated to those who have perished, those who are fighting, and those who have survived from Cancer. The funding will go towards actors, locations, director, equipment, and promotions.

As an individual you can accomplish a great amount, collectively working with others, positive results are endless. Thank you for your time and contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this campaign to your friends and family. Spreading the word is the core of any funding for any cause, please help me reach my goal through your voice.

story:
Hey there, I am Woody. I've been making melodic drum and bass and other music for around 4 years now. I'm from the UK and live in the midland city of Nottingham. I love to make music that 'hits the spot'.

So, I make music all the time, sitting in my studio days on end, working long hours putting my music out there for you guys.  I'm always being asked the question " when are you going to play live?" Unfortunately, because I release a lot of my music for free, I don't actually get the funds to build a platform to perform. 

THE PLAN!

I want to make a win/win situation. I've created an album with all new tunes that not many people have heard,  put them together and released them under the name MOONLIGHT !


What I Need & What You Get

Apart from the singles already released, money has never really crossed my mind. I make music because I love it. Recently I have decided to take this more seriously, and I need some equipment to do so. I want to try and build £2000 to make this possible. If I can push it to £2500 then I'd be able to buy the upgrades but that's after we've hit 2000!  With this I will invest it into some brand new pioneer equipment. I really want to start playing out to you guys around Europe and beyond, but without this equipment, I'm not moving forward.

Obviously its not me making money off you for no reason, the money goes towards the future of my act. All that have contributed will get  a download of Moonlight and more in mp3 format. The Album consists of some of my favourite music that  means a lot to me. I've put my heart into all of the tracks to create an exciting journey for you.

THE IMPACT

The outcome of what has been achieved so far is beyond belief.  I am honoured that people take time to listen to my music, and that they enjoy it! Its hard to believe that I have fans from far and near. The impact of achieving this goal would be life changing for me. If I can get this money, together with you and me, the possibility's are endless.  


Just to confirm, that the album will be available to download after the 30 days are up, so hold tight!


Other Ways You Can Help

If there is no way of helping out, don't worry, its not a problem at all! Even you taking the time to read this campaign is a positive for me. If you enjoy one of my songs, that's enough joy for me. If you could maybe spread the word of this campaign, that would be absolutely magic!

I will be posting updates of the campaign to let you know how the project is going!

Keep your eye on my soundcloud for teasers of the album

Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/woody1993

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/woodydnbofficial?fref=ts

story:
"MUSICAS DE ASIA" - Bilingual Internet Radio

ABOUT THE PROJECT / SOBRE EL PROYECTO

With the rapid and outstanding development of communications technology, it is surprising that the rich musical traditions of the Asian continent, that has played a pivotal role in world history and that is currently having great economic and commercial impact across the globe, are relatively unknown of in the West.



This project will create a 24/7 bilingual (English/Spanish) Internet radio station devoted to showcasing traditional Asian music and its influence in modern and contemporary music. We will feature the most prominent Asian performers, instruments and genres - including the ones considered world heritage by the UNESCO.

The founder of this project, Mauricio Martinez, has been studying and researching the Asian performing arts for 28 years. He has been awarded study and research fellowships by organizations in India, China, Japan and South Korea. In total, he has lived in Asia for over 10 years and has developed his projects in very prestigious institutions like the International Research Center for Japanese Studies in Kyoto, the National Center for Korean Traditional Performing Arts (National Gugak Center) in Seoul, the Shanghai Conservatory of Music, among others.

For the last 28 years he has been producing events and creating projects for the promotion of Asian performing arts in Spanish. Since 1996, he has produced a body of radio programs on Asian traditional music at different radio stations in Colombia. From 2005, he has been developing the Web Encyclopedias of Asian Performing Arts in Spanish (Japan, Korea, China and India - www.rutadeseda.org) and he plans to start the bilingual -English/Spanish- version of the Web Encyclopedias in the near future.

Besides, Prof. Martínez has created a Facebook site on Asian performing arts and a Youtube video channel on the same subjects (“Asian Performing Arts”). As a university professor and lecturer, he has tought about Asian music, Asian theater and Asian cultural history (Japan, China, India and Korea).



The MUSICAS DE ASIA bilingual Internet radio project is the first of its kind in any Western language. This will be a 24/7 station that will feature not only traditional music, but also modern and contemporary music that has been influenced or based on traditional styles and/or traditional instruments. Each music recording will include an introduction in English and Spanish about the genre, performers and instruments. 

For this project we already have a huge collection of recordings by outstanding Asian artists with the respective broadcasting permissions.

This is a not-for-profit project. In addition, the station will be commercial-free. The main goal is to be able to present the music of most of the nearly 50 Asian countries.



OUR CROWD-FUNDING GOALS

This fundraising campaign is set up to launch the MUSICAS DE ASIA 24/7 Spanish/English Internet radio station. The funds collected here will be necesary for keeping the station running for at least a year. Apart from paying for the internet radio hosting, which requires of high standards for the transmition of music, it is also necessary to adquire professional recording equipment, otherwise it will be necessary to periodically rent a recording studio. 

The internet radio project goal is to try to cover most of the musical traditions of Asia. This makes necessary a continuos work by our team, in order to contact traditional artists and organizations from different geographical areas like Central, East, South East, Northern and Western Asia. Many of the most famous traditional performers do not use any kind of internet platform (Facebook, website or even email) so it is necessary to contact them through another ways.

Our plan is to launch the MUSICAS DE ASIA internet radio station this coming April, using the collection of recordings we already have, which are centered around the musical traditions from South Korea, Japan, China and India and later on to add recordings from another parts of Asia. This radio station will also cover modern and contemporary works inspired by the different musical traditions from Asia.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




SOBRE EL PROYECTO

Con el rápido y asombroso desarrollo de las tecnologías de comunicación, es sorprendente que las ricas tradiciones musicales del continente asiático, el cual ha jugado un papel muy importante en la historia mundial y que está teniendo un gran impacto económico y comercial a lo largo y ancho del globo, son relativamente desconocidas en occidente.

El proyecto que aquí presentamos consiste en la creación de una estación de radio bilingüe en internet (español/inglés), con transmisiones las 24 horas del día, dedicada exclusivamente a la presentación de las músicas tradicionales de Asia y su influencia en las músicas modernas y contemporáneas. La programación incluirá a los más prominentes intérpretes, instrumentos y géneros musicales -incluyendo a aquellos considerados por la UNESCO como Patrimonio Intangible Mundial.

El creador de este proyecto, Mauricio Martínez, ha estado estudiando e investigando las artes escénicas de Asia durante 28 años. Él ha sido acreedor de becas de estudios e investigación otorgadas por organizaciones gubernamentales y semi-gubernamentales de India, China, Japón y Corea del Sur. En total él ha vivido más de 10 años en Asia y ha desarrollado sus proyectos en instituciones tan prestigiosas como el Centro Internacional de Investigaciones en Estudios Japoneses (International Research Center for Japanese Studies) en Kyoto, el Centro Nacional de Artes Escénicas Tradicionales de Corea (National Gugak Center) en Seúl, el Conservatorio de Música de Shanghai, entre otras.

Durante los últimos 28 años ha organizado eventos y creado proyectos para la divulgación de las artes escénicas y el patrimonio intangible de Asia en el mundo de habla hispana. Desde 1996 ha producido una gran cantidad de programas de radio sobre las músicas tradicionales de Asia en estaciones de radio en Colombia. Desde 2005 ha estado desarrollando las Enciclopedias Web de Artes Escénicas de Asia en español (Japón, Corea, China e India - www.rutadeseda.org) y tiene planes de iniciar la versión bilingue (español/inglés) de dichas enciclopedias en un futuro cercano.

Además, el Prof. Martínez ha creado una página muy activa en Facebook titulada “Artes Escénicas de Asia” y un canal de videos en Youtube con el título “Artes Escénicas de Asia/Asian performing Arts”. Como profesor universitario ha dictado clases sobre las músicas de Asia, el teatro asiático e historias culturales de Japón, India, China y Corea.



El proyecto “MUSICAS DE ASIA Internet radio” es el primero de este tipo en occidente. Esta será una estación con programación las 24 horas del día, la cual presentará no solo la música tradicional, sino también la música moderna y contemporánea que ha sido influenciada o basada en estilos tradicionales o que emplee instrumentos tradicionales asiáticos. La presentación de cada grabación musical incluirá una introducción en español e inglés sobre el género musical, los intérpretes y los instrumentos.

Para este proyecto contamos ya con una gran colección de grabaciones de destacados artistas asiáticos con los debidos permisos de radio-difusión.

Este es un proyecto sin ánimo de lucro y la programación estará libre de comerciales. La meta principal en este proyecto es la divulgación de las músicas tradicionales de la mayoría de los cerca de 50 países que comprenden el continente asiático.


PROPÓSITOS DE NUESTRA CAMPAÑA

La campaña de donación que aquí presentamos tiene como propósito el establecimiento de MÚSICAS DE ASIA, una estación de radio bilingue (español/inglés) en internet con transmisión continua. Los fondos recogidos se emplearán para mantener la estación por al menos un año. Para establecer una estación de radio en internet se requiere de un hosting, que es un servicio que ofrecen compañías, el cual consiste en la transmisión radial a través de internet. Los servicios hosting comprenden paquetes con diferentes características y precios. Las características requeridas para la transmisión de música, a diferencia de la radio de noticias, son más exigentes y por tanto los paquetes son más costosos. Un gasto adicional y necesario es la adquisición de equipos profesionales de grabación. Sin estos sería necesario el alquiler periódico de un estudio de grabación.

La meta de esta estación de radio es cubrir la mayoría de tradiciones musicales de Asia. Esto hace necesario el trabajo continuo de un equipo de personas para tratar de establecer contactos con artistas tradicionales y organizaciones de las diferentes áreas geográficas de Asia -Asia Central, el Sudeste, Norte y Occidente de Asia. Muchos de los artistas tradicionales más famosos de Asia no emplean ningún tipo de medio de comunicación o divulgación tecnológica (Facebook, página web o incluso ni siquiera email), así que es necesario establecer el contacto a través de otros medios. 

Nuestro plan es lanzar la estación de radio MÚSICAS DE ASIA por internet en el mes de abril, contando ya con una colección de grabaciones de las músicas tradicionales de Corea del Sur, Japón, China e India, para luego adicionar paulatinamente grabaciones de otras regiones de Asia. Esta estación también cubrirá géneros e intérpretes modernos y contemporáneos cuya inspiración provenga de los lenguajes tradicionales.

The MUSICAS DE ASIA bilingual Internet radio project is the first of its kind in any Western language. This will be a 24/7 station that will feature not only traditional music, but also modern and contemporary music that has been influenced or based on traditional styles and/or traditional instruments. Each music recording will include an introduction in English and Spanish about the genre, performers and instruments. 
For this project we already have a huge collection of recordings by outstanding Asian artists with the respective broadcasting permissions.
This is a not-for-profit project. In addition, the station will be commercial-free. The main goal is to be able to present the music of most of the nearly 50 Asian countries.OUR CROWD-FUNDING GOALSThis fundraising campaign is set up to launch the MUSICAS DE ASIA 24/7 Spanish/English Internet radio station. The funds collected here will be necesary for keeping the station running for at least a year. Apart from paying for the internet radio hosting, which requires of high standards for the transmition of music, it is also necessary to adquire professional recording equipment, otherwise it will be necessary to periodically rent a recording studio. The internet radio project goal is to try to cover most of the musical traditions of Asia. This makes necessary a continuos work by our team, in order to contact traditional artists and organizations from different geographical areas like Central, East, South East, Northern and Western Asia. Many of the most famous traditional performers do not use any kind of internet platform (Facebook, website or even email) so it is necessary to contact them through another ways.Our plan is to launch the MUSICAS DE ASIA internet radio station this coming April, using the collection of recordings we already have, which are centered around the musical traditions from South Korea, Japan, China and India and later on to add recordings from another parts of Asia. This radio station will also cover modern and contemporary works inspired by the different musical traditions from Asia.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------SOBRE EL PROYECTO


Con el rápido y asombroso desarrollo de las tecnologías de comunicación, es sorprendente que las ricas tradiciones musicales del continente asiático, el cual ha jugado un papel muy importante en la historia mundial y que está teniendo un gran impacto económico y comercial a lo largo y ancho del globo, son relativamente desconocidas en occidente.

El proyecto que aquí presentamos consiste en la creación de una estación de radio bilingüe en internet (español/inglés), con transmisiones las 24 horas del día, dedicada exclusivamente a la presentación de las músicas tradicionales de Asia y su influencia en las músicas modernas y contemporáneas. La programación incluirá a los más prominentes intérpretes, instrumentos y géneros musicales -incluyendo a aquellos considerados por la UNESCO como Patrimonio Intangible Mundial.

El creador de este proyecto, Mauricio Martínez, ha estado estudiando e investigando las artes escénicas de Asia durante 28 años. Él ha sido acreedor de becas de estudios e investigación otorgadas por organizaciones gubernamentales y semi-gubernamentales de India, China, Japón y Corea del Sur. En total él ha vivido más de 10 años en Asia y ha desarrollado sus proyectos en instituciones tan prestigiosas como el Centro Internacional de Investigaciones en Estudios Japoneses (International Research Center for Japanese Studies) en Kyoto, el Centro Nacional de Artes Escénicas Tradicionales de Corea (National Gugak Center) en Seúl, el Conservatorio de Música de Shanghai, entre otras.

Durante los últimos 28 años ha organizado eventos y creado proyectos para la divulgación de las artes escénicas y el patrimonio intangible de Asia en el mundo de habla hispana. Desde 1996 ha producido una gran cantidad de programas de radio sobre las músicas tradicionales de Asia en estaciones de radio en Colombia. Desde 2005 ha estado desarrollando las Enciclopedias Web de Artes Escénicas de Asia en español (Japón, Corea, China e India - www.rutadeseda.org) y tiene planes de iniciar la versión bilingue (español/inglés) de dichas enciclopedias en un futuro cercano.

Además, el Prof. Martínez ha creado una página muy activa en Facebook titulada “Artes Escénicas de Asia” y un canal de videos en Youtube con el título “Artes Escénicas de Asia/Asian performing Arts”. Como profesor universitario ha dictado clases sobre las músicas de Asia, el teatro asiático e historias culturales de Japón, India, China y Corea.El proyecto “MUSICAS DE ASIA Internet radio” es el primero de este tipo en occidente. Esta será una estación con programación las 24 horas del día, la cual presentará no solo la música tradicional, sino también la música moderna y contemporánea que ha sido influenciada o basada en estilos tradicionales o que emplee instrumentos tradicionales asiáticos. La presentación de cada grabación musical incluirá una introducción en español e inglés sobre el género musical, los intérpretes y los instrumentos.

Para este proyecto contamos ya con una gran colección de grabaciones de destacados artistas asiáticos con los debidos permisos de radio-difusión.

Este es un proyecto sin ánimo de lucro y la programación estará libre de comerciales. La meta principal en este proyecto es la divulgación de las músicas tradicionales de la mayoría de los cerca de 50 países que comprenden el continente asiático.PROPÓSITOS DE NUESTRA CAMPAÑALa campaña de donación que aquí presentamos tiene como propósito el establecimiento de MÚSICAS DE ASIA, una estación de radio bilingue (español/inglés) en internet con transmisión continua. Los fondos recogidos se emplearán para mantener la estación por al menos un año. Para establecer una estación de radio en internet se requiere de un hosting, que es un servicio que ofrecen compañías, el cual consiste en la transmisión radial a través de internet. Los servicios hosting comprenden paquetes con diferentes características y precios. Las características requeridas para la transmisión de música, a diferencia de la radio de noticias, son más exigentes y por tanto los paquetes son más costosos. Un gasto adicional y necesario es la adquisición de equipos profesionales de grabación. Sin estos sería necesario el alquiler periódico de un estudio de grabación.

La meta de esta estación de radio es cubrir la mayoría de tradiciones musicales de Asia. Esto hace necesario el trabajo continuo de un equipo de personas para tratar de establecer contactos con artistas tradicionales y organizaciones de las diferentes áreas geográficas de Asia -Asia Central, el Sudeste, Norte y Occidente de Asia. Muchos de los artistas tradicionales más famosos de Asia no emplean ningún tipo de medio de comunicación o divulgación tecnológica (Facebook, página web o incluso ni siquiera email), así que es necesario establecer el contacto a través de otros medios. 

Nuestro plan es lanzar la estación de radio MÚSICAS DE ASIA por internet en el mes de abril, contando ya con una colección de grabaciones de las músicas tradicionales de Corea del Sur, Japón, China e India, para luego adicionar paulatinamente grabaciones de otras regiones de Asia. Esta estación también cubrirá géneros e intérpretes modernos y contemporáneos cuya inspiración provenga de los lenguajes tradicionales.

story:
Short Summary

With YOUR help I will press my FIRST EP and produce my FIRST animated music video! This EP has been a long time coming, thanks to Maxwell Drummey of Chester French for producing my songs into a magical realization! I have ALSO teamed up with animator Caleb Wood to animate my next music video! (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1xDBM6PTibQ) 

So, i am asking for a small sum to assist in the pressing of my first EP as well as to assist in the production of my FIRST animated music video. 

Here's a little bit about me! I am an American singer-songwriter and musician.  My father is the late David Williams, best known for his 30 year collaboration with Michael Jackson. Because I grew up in a musical home, music is my main passion. Recently, I have been playing shows local to the LA area at venues such as, the House of Blues, Room 5, Hotel Cafe and the Lyric Theatre. I recently finished the Leighton Meester Check in the Dark Spring Tour of 2012 as the Opening Act and also recently collaborated with rapper Freddie Gibbs on his song "The Hard".

We Need About $1,400

Where will the funds go?

Well, $1,000 will go to the animator Caleb for his services and the remainder will go toward pressing hard copies of the EP!

Impact! 

My ultimate goal in life is to touch people with my music. This campaign will enable me to connect with people in a totally new way. I will be granted the opportunity to employ an artist, Caleb Wood, and to also collaborate artistically while also engaging my audience with NEW content :) 

Remember* if you are unable to help financially, you can always SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN with others who are willing and able! Don't forget to share! 

Sharing is caring. 

Checkout My Sites! 

www.danawilliamsofficial.com

www.youtube.com/danawilliamsofficial 

And Caleb Wood's Sites!

http://vimeo.com/calebwood

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1xDBM6PTibQ

story:
Who am I?

  • Hey everyone! My name is Colton Beha and i'm from Portland, Oregon. I currently am attending Portland State University and am studying Communications. I'm a huge fan of sports, and love to play music. 
  • This Campaign is something I didn't imagine I would be doing. I recently took a step back and looked at what i'm doing with my life. I prayed to God and asked for guidance for what I really want to do with my life. I love sports and would like to work in the field of a broadcaster. My full passion though, is music. It's something I'v been doing my whole life. Playing for God on Sundays is what I do, but I wanted to do more. Getting accepted to Hillsong, well that seemed to be the more I was looking for.  
  • Whatever you guys donate, EVERYTHING will go towards my tuition and cost of attending Hillsong. Anything will help! 

What do I need? Also, what's in it for you guys?

  • The whole cost to attend Hillsong for a year is $25,000. That is accounted for Tuition, Cost of living, flight cost, everything! I am putting all of my income towards Hillsong, but it won't be nearly enough! I need all of the help I can get!
  • To reward everyone for what they donate, I have perks to give! For example, if you donate $50, I will give 1 free 1-hour drum lesson! Or if you donate $80. 2 free, 1 hour drum lessons! Other perks available as well! (Mind as well use my talents to help other people! :-)
  • The first part of getting everything paid for is getting my Ceo (Certification of Enrollment). Once I pay and receive that, I must then apply for a Visa and then eventually buy my plane tickets! So again, anything you donate will help greatly! 

How will you impact me?

  • Music has always been a passion of mine. I have been playing drums for 9 years now. I'v been playing for churches for about 5 years now. I'v always wanted to do more for a church and for playing, but didn't know what to do, or how to get involved. Now, I think i'v found it. 
  • My goal for all of this, is to not only develop my skills in being a drummer, but to expand my relationship with Jesus and to learn more than I ever have before. I want to teach other people what I learn from Hillsong, and to share my stories and experiences. I want to go out and do more. A lot more!

How else can I help?

  • If you aren't able to contribute at this time, help me get the word out to people about my campaign! Share this to other people and let them know what I'm doing! 
  • Most of all, please continue to pray for me as this Journey continues and I look forward to the future! Thank you so much for your support, prayers, and everything!

story:
Beatplexity started off in 2008 and was setup to let people on a local forum store their dj mixes.  We quickly filled up the storage capacity of our server and had to upgrade.  We had over 3000 mixes archived in under a year, we have slowly but surely carried on in this manner and now store over 25,000 dj mixes all for free.

Unfortunately though, nothing in this life is for free.  I (Paul) have run Beatplexity for the last 5 years out of my own pocket, I wanted to give something back to all the amazing dj's and artists and I really didn't expect to have accumulated so much music in the last 5 years.

I'm now at the stage where the website is simply too expensive for me to run.  Not that the monthly bills are HUGE it's just that I'm saving for my future now and having this overhead each month is something I could really do without.  I want the website to be self-sufficient.  I don't want to pull the plug on this website because of the sheer amount of music that will be lost.

Another thing is the website is very poorly designed and honestly, just about works.  It desperately needs a complete redesign to bring it into 2013.  I haven't got the money myself to pay for this, hence why I'm here on IndieGoGo.

You could call this a last ditch effort on my part.  If I fail to reach our budget then the website will cease to run and the music and mixes will be lost forever.

What will be done with the funds?

Simple really, design and develop a new website, plus expand our server capacity to ensure we have enough growing room.

I will source a web development company to work with me to design a new website.  We will keep things simple and as features can quickly eat up a 5k budget.

Some key features I want to develop:

  • Embeddable waveform player (like soundcloud, beatport)
  • Profile Page
  • Community functions such as following, liking, commenting
  • User dashboard with feed and statistics

In order to sustain the future of the website I will also be introducing a paid membership system, it will be very reasonably priced.  As I said, I'm not in this for profit, I think the last 5 years will have proven that.  I just want to keep the website running.  Pro accounts will run between £1-5 per month

'Pro' accounts will give you large amounts of bandwidth and storage space (im looking around 10gb for the top pro account, more than enough space to store your mixes and music, but this could change depending on feedback from the community)

There will still be a free account (just with less disk space), the pro accounts will be cheap so I am hoping you will contribute to this community.

Risks and challenges 

The challenges are being able to maintain the website after the re-design. I have set aside approx £1k of my own money to keep it running after the re-launch. If people do not pay for the service then the website will not be self sufficient and could once again fall into the predicament I am in now. Thankfully server costs are not too expensive these days. Approx 30 members paying £5 per month will cover the server costs currently. And once the redesign is complete these are the bulk of the monthly overheads.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Ryan David Gallant. As a child I had this dream of seeing and hearing thousands upon thousands of people screaming my name at me from under a spotlight, I don't know how this dream happened, I never thought about it, it just.....happened. Well, little did I know that dream was the genesis of my life and career. My mother always made sure her children played an instrument growing up, I started on the violin and quickly moved to percussion where I stayed throughout Elementary School, Middle School, and High School, where I performed on the drum line. I have always played drums for bands in High School, and still do 3 yrs. out of graduation. Upon graduating High School I switched my middle and first names and started using the name 'David Ryan' for musical purposes. With that change came another. After 13 yrs. behind the kit, I felt now is a time to change it up, I have always wanted to record, press, and release a record I can call my own. I've played drums on tracks of course, but those were other people's songs, and their songs only. Not this time. I want to record an EP that I can share with everyone! I want these songs to be your songs as well, that's why I am calling upon you all for help. By helping me fund this EP goes above and beyond how happy and excited it makes me, knowing that I now have a shot at putting together a dream! Writing songs that I feel people will enjoy and connect with gives me a warm feeling that makes a cold winter chill bearable to handle, and also knowing that you and I are not alone in this world.....


What We Need:

I plan on putting 4-5 tracks on this EP. The intended goal of funding that we need to raise in 60 days for the production of this EP is $5,000. Here is the breakdown of what costs there will be and what your donation will be funding:

$450 per session (all day recordings)

$150 per track (mixing/mastering)

$300-$800 (pressing/distribution)

Instruments I plan on using for this project are: Acoustic Guitar, Elec. Guitar/Bass, Drums, Brass, Piano, and Vox.

What You Get:

In return for your generous donation will be specific prizes and perks that will reward you based on how much you donate towards the project! Prizes and perks will be presented on the sidebar of the campaign page for you to choose from.

If we don't reach the goal of $5,000 the amount that was raised will go towards the production.


The Impact

When explained in the summary, this EP is the starting point for what I will continue to do from this point onward. This campaign holds a great value to me but more importantly, to you! You are helping me make a dream come true that I have been working towards since that one day when that dream entered into my head and people started waving and screaming at me. I have worked on tracks but never worked on a production like this, and I am very excited to have you come with me on this journey!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people can't contribute but there are ways for you to help the progress and success of this campaign!

-Help get the word out to folks who aren't aware about this great donation campaign we are growing together! Make some noise about the campaign. 

-Also, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your donation, support, and belief in my dream!

story:
www.facebook.com/wearesavannah

3 years ago we decided to follow our dreams & pursue music in every way we could. We began a project called Savannah and have pushed with everything we have to build this band, growing everyday and falling more and more in love with our creation. With support from our fans, family, and friends we have made it to today, and have realized this is the time that we put it all on the line and put everything we have left into our next album. 

We are heading into the studio to record our next release. A brand new album with all new songs and we couldn't be more excited. Up until now, everything we have released has been produced, engineered, mixed, and mastered all by us, in our home studio. This time around we are excited to announce we will be heading into a major studio to work with an incredible producer and engineer. But there's only one problem, and that's money. Because we are an independent band, our funds are limited and recording isn't exactly cheap.

This is where you come in, friends and fans. We hate to ask you to just give away your hard earned money, but believe we have come up with the best way to engage you and make you a part of this band, our music, and our next album. 

Enter Indiegogo. Indiegogo allows us to give back to you as you support us and help us reach our goal, and fulfill our dream to head into a major studio to create our next album. We want to make you feel like a part of something, a part of the band, a community. We want you to be able to say that it was because of you that we were able to pull through and make this dream come true for Savannah. This album is for each of you.

So how will we give back to your funding? With incentives, or physical rewards for your donation. You will find a break down of things you will receive at different amounts of donations for this project on the right hand side of this page. 

In a nutshell, the first reward is basically a preorder of the new album, and we are throwing in our first two EPs for free! You will get the first 2 EP's immediately, and you will get the new album a week before its release!

EVEN MORE | giving back to our community:

No matter what, we decided that Indiegogo was our only option for recording this next album. We wanted to find a way to both offer incentives for fans of Savannah, and to dedicate our time and appreciation to give back to our community. 

A few years ago we had the incredible privilege to spend time playing music and teaching children at Orlando's own Arnold Palmer Hospital for children. The satisfaction we had from putting smiles on the faces of these children was beyond anything we had ever experienced. It is this reason that we are dedicating our time to these children again.


For every $1,000.00 we raise, we are donating 5 hours of our time to teaching, playing, and hanging out with these children with the hope of inspiring, motiving, and potentially changing their lives. If we reach our goal of $12,000.00 this means we are dedicated to 60 hours of time at the hospital. For every $1,000.00 after our goal, we will double the hours dedicate an additional 10 hours of our time.  

Finally:

We want to thank you for taking the time to look at our page here. Without you, we would be nowhere and for that we are forever grateful. We love you guys. Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt:
www.facebook.com/wearesavannah
3 years ago we decided to follow our dreams & pursue music in every way we could. We began a project called Savannah and have pushed with everything we have to build this band, growing everyday and falling more and more in love with our creation. With support from our fans, family, and friends we have made it to today, and have realized this is the time that we put it all on the line and put everything we have left into our next album. 
We are heading into the studio to record our next release. A brand new album with all new songs and we couldn't be more excited. Up until now, everything we have released has been produced, engineered, mixed, and mastered all by us, in our home studio. This time around we are excited to announce we will be heading into a major studio to work with an incredible producer and engineer. But there's only one problem, and that's money. Because we are an independent band, our funds are limited and recording isn't exactly cheap.
This is where you come in, friends and fans. We hate to ask you to just give away your hard earned money, but believe we have come up with the best way to engage you and make you a part of this band, our music, and our next album. 
Enter Indiegogo. Indiegogo allows us to give back to you as you support us and help us reach our goal, and fulfill our dream to head into a major studio to create our next album. We want to make you feel like a part of something, a part of the band, a community. We want you to be able to say that it was because of you that we were able to pull through and make this dream come true for Savannah. This album is for each of you.
So how will we give back to your funding? With incentives, or physical rewards for your donation. You will find a break down of things you will receive at different amounts of donations for this project on the right hand side of this page. 

In a nutshell, the first reward is basically a preorder of the new album, and we are throwing in our first two EPs for free! You will get the first 2 EP's immediately, and you will get the new album a week before its release!
EVEN MORE | giving back to our community:
No matter what, we decided that Indiegogo was our only option for recording this next album. We wanted to find a way to both offer incentives for fans of Savannah, and to dedicate our time and appreciation to give back to our community. 
A few years ago we had the incredible privilege to spend time playing music and teaching children at Orlando's own Arnold Palmer Hospital for children. The satisfaction we had from putting smiles on the faces of these children was beyond anything we had ever experienced. It is this reason that we are dedicating our time to these children again.





For every $1,000.00 we raise, we are donating 5 hours of our time to teaching, playing, and hanging out with these children with the hope of inspiring, motiving, and potentially changing their lives. If we reach our goal of $12,000.00 this means we are dedicated to 60 hours of time at the hospital. For every $1,000.00 after our goal, we will double the hours dedicate an additional 10 hours of our time.  
Finally:
We want to thank you for taking the time to look at our page here. Without you, we would be nowhere and for that we are forever grateful. We love you guys. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Kiss the Ashes:

1. This Side of the Wasteland            - 5:42
2. Kiss the Ashes                             - 4:19
3. The Call of Midnight                     - 4:01
4. In the Name Of                           - 4:42
5. There in the Snow                        - 2:55
6. I Died for Love                            - 5:06
7. The Shadows Linger On                - 4:26
8. Shades of Demise                       - 5:33
9. Lost but not Forgotten                  - 4:11
10. Shade's Piano                           - 4:18
11. Lost but not Forgotten (Reprise)  - 3:25
                                                     -48:23 Total Run time.   

Who are we?

From the Flint area of Michigan, Shadow Image is a rock duo formed by singer and multi-instrumentalist Harley Mace with partner in crime on keyboards, Mandy Monster. We combine influences ranging from goth, deathrock, post-punk, heavy metal, and classical piano, to create a sound which defies definition and fuses memorable, underground music of the past with dark tones of today.

We are currently working on our debut album titled "Kiss the Ashes", produced independantly by ourselves to be released this May through Danse Macabre Records. 

Our album is already well on it's way to being finished but we need your support. We're offering this campaign as a way to pre-order directly from the band and allow your contributions to make the most difference.

Visit our Youtube channel and to hear some of our previously released music and some previews for this upcoming album. We will be updating it periodicly with more videos as we make progress. 

http://www.youtube.com/user/ExcrucioAeternus

Preview track "The Call of Midnight" on soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/harleyworkinprogress/the...

 

Why do we need pre-orders? 

We are producing this album ourselves. This means we have unlimited creative freedom and get to release the best music we can. However, it also means that we bare the complete cost of production financially upon ourselves. Most of this has already been invested from our own pockets with the expectation and hope of recouping from future sales. So this is where our fans come into play.

By pre-ordering you help us pay for all things involved in our music production as well as the album media as a whole. This includes but isn't limited to:

  • Instruments
  • Audio Cables, stands etc
  • Microphones
  • Digital Audio Workstation (computer and audio interface or sound board) and Software
  • Camera, lights, tripod and stands
  • Speakers, monitors and headphones
  • Utilities (eletricity etc)
  • Living expenses while working on the music (food, water, COFFEE)

 

But, this fund raiser also allows us a way to throw in a few bonuses to our fans who pre-order depending on the level of support you choose. We want to do as much as we can to offer you all something cool. Of course, that depends on the level of support we get.

T-Shirts?

Shirt design by Robert Inhuman from Dreams In Hell. Please specify the size you need: Men's or Women's Small, Medium, Large, and XL. Sizing chart: http://oi44.tinypic.com/2v16ovb.jpg

 

What does all this mean?

The internet has offered for the first time in history, independant bands a way to get their music out there to the world. We have also chosen to partner with a great record label which let's us retain creative freedom, in an effort to reach places we normally couldn't. While this is a great time for music, it can't happen without the support of fans connecting directly with musicians. Alternative music beneath the mainstream literally lives or dies depending on the response from fans around the world. 

At your request, we are offering signatures on any physical merchandise you purchase from us. 

What if you can't afford to contribute? 

We understand, it isn't always possible to actually buy an album you want right away. Everyone's needs and economic level is different. In that case we simply ask that you share this page as well as our music with others and contribute some other way when you can. Whether that means just offering supportive comments, attending our concerts, buying a button or patch, either way, we thank you.

story:
Santa Fe Sacred Music Festival - Nov. 1, 2 & 3, 2013

                         Girish - HawaH - Indu

Sat Purkh - Sitara & Kalyani with Pavan Kumar

"Something about kirtan"

Hi, this is Gen of Blue Earth Healing in Santa Fe, New Mexico and producer of the Sacred Music Festival.

For a lot of years in my life I struggled with anxiety (who doesn't?) but I couldn't find relief until I found kirtan -- call and response chanting, singing with a devotional bend to it. Something about kirtan took me beyond 12 step support groups and yoga exercises and prayer. Something about kirtan brought me back to  my Self, to a grounding place with Source, to a place where I didn't have to jump back into Flight or Fight Syndrome and pack my backpack and run away everytime things got weird.

In 2007 I moved back to Minneapolis from afar and was very loney and Spirit had me put on the first Midtown Yoga Festival. It was so much work and I went into a lot of debt but it was worth every effort and dollar spent. We did it again in 2010 in the Twin Cities Yoga Festival and I came out only a few dollars short on my budget and I didn't pay myself, either.

NOW, here, in Santa Fe, I see that good people are craving more spiritually uplifting cultural events than ever before; we need a real Rx for the hard times around us; we need to gather as community and find a common note, a shared voice -- and kirtan is what draws us together and this is what we give back to the world.

Please help us make that a reality. Donate today to bring world-renowned  experts in Sacred Chant, Poetry & Music to our community.

If we can get the amount we are asking, we will be able to pay the talent and the workers, we will be able to keep ticket prices affordable and will be able to share potential proceeds with One Common Unity and their humanitarian efforts.

We're offering some fab perks, too, to really make you feel involved in a wonderful event, to be part of this community.

This incredible weekend will feature:

GIRISH, (www.GirishMusic.com) who will lead FOUR events of Sacred, Exotic Chant: two of which include LIVE yoga and feature HawaH & Dr. Indu; one Kirtan and one Chant Workshop

DR. INDU ARORA, (www.Yogsadhna.com) who will lead authentic yoga classes, a special yoga class to Girish's live music, anda japa/mala workshop as well as accept private Ayurvedic Consultations. 

HAWAH EVERLUTIONARY, (www.Everlutionary.net and www.thePoetryofYoga.com) who will weave our hearts into a global beat with Poetry of Yoga, Yoga with Girish Live Music and Presence of Community.

SAT PURKH KAUR KHALSA, (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YbpZ1mWyeQ8) whose Home style Texas rhythm brings real life to Kundalini Kirtan will draw you into the sacred, stir you up a little bit, and send you back out entirely new.

SITARA & KALYANI with PAVAN KUMAR (www.sitaraandkalyani.com) are Shiva devotees who can take every-day kirtan and turn it into a rocking, soul stirring, heart cracking-open experience of a lifetime.

These are important times for grass roots people to come together and renew our collective spirit, especially in the realm of Sacred Music, Poetry and Yoga. Please join us to make this event a reality. Make a contribution of $1008, $75or smaller and be part of this, be part of us. Part of me. Bless. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a budget of $10,000 to remunerate our talent, pay for the venue, enroll the community as vendors, sponsors & advertisers and get the quality support to pull this off.  With a $3,500 Indiegogo Campaign funded, we can keep the price of the tickets realistic and:

* Rent the Railyard Performance Center for Friday's Yoga with Live Music with Girish and HawaH. (I've put the deposit down already.)

* Rent the Center for Spiritual Living for Saturday's Kirtan concert and Sunday's Yoga with Indu and the Chant Workshop. (Deposit done!)

* Help the local economy and give good business to our community as we hire helpers, provide transportation & food for the Crew, provide advertising for vendors and sponsors.

Our presenters are particularly special and unique. Perks include a once-in-a-lifetime autographed photo of the Talent; or a copy of HawaH's extraordinary text, The Poetry of Yoga -- or, best ever, become a VIP and come to all of the events and join us for supper!

The event will go on whether or not we reach our funding goal. But if we reach it, and if we exceed it, there will be seed money for the 2014 event and room for more give-aways and charitable contributions in the form of tickets and promo specials.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Can you help get the word out and make some noise about our Sacred Music, Yoga-Poetry weekend in Santa Fe?

You can use the Indiegogo share tools and let all your FB and other social media friends know!

and... perhaps be eligible to win a pair of tickets -- if we meet or exceed our goal -- to the 2014 event! Help us build the future in a fantastic way.

Thank you.

* Rent the Railyard Performance Center for Friday's Yoga with Live Music with Girish and HawaH

* Rent the Center for Spiritual Living for Saturday's Kirtan concert and Sunday's Yoga with Indu and the Chant Workshop

* Help the local economy and give good business to our community as we hire helpers, provide transportation & food for the Crew, provide advertising for vendors and sponsors, and make a reasonabile profit for our efforts and expertise. Genevieve produced the Twin Cities Yoga Festival from an intuitive urge and the community really received the gifts of yoga and social unity. The budget almosdt broke even. Today, show her your support in producing acommunity events of this ilk!

You will get a fabulous perk of your choice, something to remember that you were a part of this Festival!

Perks include a once-in-a-lifetime autographed photo of the Talent; or a copy of HawaH's extraordinary text, The Poetry of Yoga, a copy of Girish's CD Yoga Vision," -- or, best ever, become a VIP and come to all of the events and join Girish, HawaH and Indu for supper!

The event will go on whether or not we reach our funding goal. But if we reach it, and if we exceed it, there will be seed money for the 2014 event and room for more give-aways and charitable contributions in the form of tickets and promo specials.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Can you help get the word out and make some noise about our Sacred Music, Yoga-Poetry weekend in Santa Fe?

You can use the Indiegogo share tools and let all your FB and other social media friends know!

and... perhaps be eligible to win a pair of tickets -- if we meet or exceed our goal -- to the 2014 event! Help us build the future in a fantastic way.

Thank you.
