story:
The Skinny

Who else is sick of it taking years to release independent movies? The movie is done so why can't everybody watch it!? 

I shot the FP when I was 21... It was released when I was 25. I shot All Superheroes Must Die when I was 23... It was released when I was 26. I don't want to wait that long anymore. How about we release #WetAndReckless this summer!? 

This movie may be too Wet and/or Reckless for the studios, but what isn't? 

If you're a fan of The FP and bullshit reality television it's a #crime that you're not watching this right now. 

This may not be the movie you need right now, but it's the one you deserve. 

What We Need & What You Get

Why do we need $30,000 to self distribute? I could go into boring legal mumbo jumbo about e/o insurance and QC'ing and this and that... but screw it. 

Putting your movie's up on Itunes and Netflix isn't free. Neither is the badass super raunchy DVD/Blu-Ray with filthy extras.

And while we're at it, let's throw this puppy in a couple genre theaters while we're at it! 

There will be new perks each week for the collectors in all of you! 

 The Impact

This is a huge experiment. It's no secret that film funding and distribution is a nightmare. No one wants to give you money to make a movie. When your movie is released distributors fudge the numbers and screw you over with percentages, mismarket, etc. Wouldn't it be great if we could cut all that bullshit out and just make movies and let all of you see them, no questions asked?

If this works, be prepared for the flood gates of crazy movies to come about... like All Superheroes Must Die 2... But, most importnantly, it could even bring F2P and FP360 back from the dead! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Plaster this everywhere. Become internet terrorists. Start tip jars at bars or at work. We need your help! 

We roll together, we die together!

story:
The John Kuegeler Memorial Summer Music Camp is a one week band camp experience during the month of June for Cleveland Ohio youth musicians that is being presented as a memorial tribute to John C. Kuegeler.

John C. Kuegeler, a Cleveland Ohio performing musician, composer and educator was passionate about working with all age groups, especially young musicians. John was awarded a 2012 Workforce Fellowship for music from the Cuyahoga Partnership for Arts and Culture. Unfortunately for our community, John passed away suddenly in June of 2012.

Our program will bring together youth from across the city for this very special one week experience to prepare and perform a variety of jazz music compositions for the general public under the guidance of a professional music conductor. Our goal is to have students from different schools and backgrounds across the city come together for challenging and enjoyable musical fellowship and performance. The students will rehearse the material Monday through Friday, and perform the selections on Saturday for the general public.They will also have the opportunity to rehearse and perform with professional local vocalists and poets as guest artists of the camp, an experience we believe is invaluable in their growth as ensemble performers. The students will also participate at the Waterloo Arts Festival.

There will be a live DVD recording of the performance that will be available after post production and editing.

Student auditions will be a two part process.

1. A essay submission including the following topics

         "How music has inspired me"

         "How I plan to continue integrating music into my life as   an adult to one day impact the world community"

2. Sightreading auditions of high school level music charts

Location:       Passport Project

12801 Buckeye Road, Cleveland, OH 44120

Phone: 216.721.1055

Day camp schedule:        6/17/13     -     6/22/13

Monday-Friday 9am - 3pm        Saturday performance 12pm - 1:30pm

The John Kuegeler Memorial Summer Music Camp will provide free boxed lunches and bus/rail passes for students with unique transportation needs.

Thank you very much for your contribution; we are very excited about this project, and continuing John Kuegeler's rich history and legacy in the Cleveland music community. We appreciate your support!
story_txt:
The John Kuegeler Memorial Summer Music Camp is a one week band camp experience during the month of June for Cleveland Ohio youth musicians that is being presented as a memorial tribute to John C. Kuegeler.
John C. Kuegeler, a Cleveland Ohio performing musician, composer and educator was passionate about working with all age groups, especially young musicians. John was awarded a 2012 Workforce Fellowship for music from the Cuyahoga Partnership for Arts and Culture. Unfortunately for our community, John passed away suddenly in June of 2012.
Our program will bring together youth from across the city for this very special one week experience to prepare and perform a variety of jazz music compositions for the general public under the guidance of a professional music conductor. Our goal is to have students from different schools and backgrounds across the city come together for challenging and enjoyable musical fellowship and performance. The students will rehearse the material Monday through Friday, and perform the selections on Saturday for the general public.They will also have the opportunity to rehearse and perform with professional local vocalists and poets as guest artists of the camp, an experience we believe is invaluable in their growth as ensemble performers. The students will also participate at the Waterloo Arts Festival.
There will be a live DVD recording of the performance that will be available after post production and editing.


Student auditions will be a two part process.
1. A essay submission including the following topics
         "How music has inspired me"
         "How I plan to continue integrating music into my life as   an adult to one day impact the world community"
2. Sightreading auditions of high school level music charts
Location:       Passport Project
12801 Buckeye Road, Cleveland, OH 44120
Phone: 216.721.1055
Day camp schedule:        6/17/13     -     6/22/13
Monday-Friday 9am - 3pm        Saturday performance 12pm - 1:30pm
The John Kuegeler Memorial Summer Music Camp will provide free boxed lunches and bus/rail passes for students with unique transportation needs.
Thank you very much for your contribution; we are very excited about this project, and continuing John Kuegeler's rich history and legacy in the Cleveland music community. We appreciate your support!

story:
Join us and 

 

 Who Are we?  We are the Arizona Banjo Blasters, a Tucson Arizona Banjo Band and hosts of the biennial Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast.

The Arizona Banjo Blasters came together as a group of Four String Banjo players to help Rob Wright sponsor the four previous  Arizona Banjo Blasts.  Over the years our band has established quite a following in the Tucson area. We perform throughout the year at Retirement Communities and Club events as well as entertaining in Assisted Living and Nursing Facilities.   We are all volunteers and are not compensated for any of our performances.  All of the fees we collect go to help three local charities when we aren't planning a Banjo Blast.  This and next year, all the monies we raise will be used to sponsor the 2014 Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast.  

                                          This campaign is to raise the front-end funding needed to put on the fifth Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast on May 22 -24, 2014.

Though it's a year away, there is much to be done to insure that this is the best Banjo Blast Ever! Funding is needed to secure a hotel with the needed facilities for concerts, workshops and jamming rooms, as well as room accommodations for our guests. We need to secure a Sound Man, a Videographer to archive the event on DVD and we need to be able to pay the headliners of the Friday and Saturday evening concerts.   All of which is way beyond our Banjo Blaster’s financial means.

The Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast is an important event in support of and to preserve and generate renewed interest in the Four String Banjo, one of America's great iconic instruments. Happy music played on Four String Banjos is appreciated by folks of all ages! In addition, this years event will include and feature the very popular Ukulele.

The Four String Banjo is a truly American instrument and has played an important role in music circles for generations.  The Ukulele, is another fun instrument that had it's hey-day in the 1920s, again after World War II and is once again experiencing renewed interest as is evidenced by the many local ukulele bands springing up all across the nation.    Our goal with the Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast is to insure that future generations know and enjoy the Four String Banjo as well as the Ukulele and other 4 string instruments.  By exposing young people to the happy music of the Four String Banjo, they develop a love  for the old songs we all enjoy so much!   No matter where you hear "Ain't She Sweet" or "Sweet Georgia Brown", the atmosphere is uplifting and people are happy.  You just can't listen to Four String Banjo music without smiling and tapping your toes.

                                        

The Blast provides a lively, inexpensive weekend of entertainment for music lovers and gives a top quality venue for professional and amateur Four String Banjo & Ukulele players to ply their trade by performing, holding workshops and jamming for an entire weekend.

We're on our own this time around.  Our founder is on the road, much of the year performing with The Original Wildcat Jass Band and is unavailable to coordinate this event.  Your support will allow us to continue the tradition we've created with four previous events and bring happiness to a community and people of all ages, by keeping Four String Banjo and Ukulele alive in Tucson Arizona and throughout the nation.  Our friends the Tucson Ukesters will be attending and helping us make this the best Blast ever!



By contributing to this campaign you become an Honorary Arizona Banjo Blaster! 

Whether you are able to attend the event or can only contribute financially, you will be helping us reach our goal.

As a contributor you will help us host the fifth Arizona Banjo & Ukulele Blast, keep the happy music of Four String Banjo alive and generate new interest in four string instruments for all ages! We encourage your participation in sponsoring this event and offer incentives for donations ranging from Banjo Blast pins & T-shirts to VIP Guest status for the weekend! 

We also ask you to join and help us with this great cause by spreading the word about this campaign to your email contacts, Facebook friends and all of your many friends and associates. 

Preserve an American Icon.  We look forward to your participation and would love to see you in Tucson, May 2014.  Join us and

story:
We are BETZEFER, a 4 piece rock/metal band from Israel. We have been internationally active since 2005 and released a couple of albums on international labels (Roadrunner, AFM).

For the past year we have been hard at work on our new full-length titled "Suicide Hotline". It contains 13 killer new soulful, bluesy and grooving metal tracks which we are sure every metal or hard rock fan is going to LOVE!

We actually already finished recording all the tracks and are going into mixing sessions in September together with the wonderful Tue Madsen who we already worked with on our 2005 release "Down Low".

That's where we need your help! Your money will go directly towards funding the mixing sessions, so that you could listen to the album as we envisioned it.

 

But we don't want to stop there - after mixing, we plan on releasing the album's entire sources so that other people can remix, tweak and build upon our work.

We sincerily believe these times of change in the industry are a good time for our society to reinspect its' take on ownership over ideas, and believe all ideas should be FREE (as in Free Speech, not necessarily as in Free Beer). We'd like to promote this idea further by contributing our work in its' entiety to the community which helped finance it.

 

We started this fundraiser in order to finish funding the mixing sessions - but we will also need the help of those of you with the technological means at a later stage with hosting and seeding this huge amount of data (all raw tracks are 24/96!) so it could be made available to all creative people out there, free of charge.

 

Any money raised through this indiegogo campaign over the initial $5500 US will be used to pay the graphic and video artists who will contribute their art to the record - and only then towards helping us partially recoup our deep investment in the recording and mixing sessions.

 

If you have any special requests or questions, just drop us a line at: info@betzefer.com

story:
A Lil About This Event
Square Fest is an outdoor music festival created to promote, preserve and perpetuate the live music scene in Savannah, Georgia.
The event will be held on 7.21.12 at historic Forsyth Park from 5:00pm to 10:00pm. There will be live performances, food, and fun for the entire family.
This event is free and open to the public and is the brainchild of JL Events, LLC and 9twelve Entertainment, LLC; the idea is to showcase the independent music scene to the public for free. Savannah is home to some great grass roots bands that can usually only be seen in Savannah Night Clubs. By being free and being held in the most visible park in Savannah - Forsyth Park; we are sure it will be a great success.

Give A Little Bit

Look - free events do not happen by themselves it takes, sweat, blood, tears and MONEY!

GOAL: $8,000.00 is the end all be all to make this an amazing event.

That includes the following:
Forsyth Park - which is super amahhzing! $2500.00
Audio/Visual - $2500.00 (We need lasers) Kidding, we really just want to make sure that the acts sound great.
Equipment - i.e. trash cans, port a lots, security, glow sticks, merchandise, CDs and DVDs. $1500.00
Food and Beverage for our talent. These guys are blessing us by playing for free, we want to feed them and treat like celebrities! We have over 20 acts ranging from 3 to 5 members we will need to feed a small army this day for 8 hours. $1500.00

Donation Tiers
$150 Donation
Preferred Seating
Square Fest Towel
4 Bottles of Water
T-Shirt
Event Acknowledgement
(If you can’t make it we replace seating with a Square Fest DVD)

$75 Donation
4 Bottles of Water
T-Shirt
(If you can’t make it we replace water with a Square Fest CD)

$50 Donation
T -Shirt
CD

$25 Donation
CD
Social Media Recognition

$20 Donation
Park Shout Out -  Thank you

IF WE DO NOT REACH OUR GOALS, WE WILL USE WHATEVER FUNDS RAISED TO MAKE THIS EVENT HAPPEN! WE ARE NOT BACKING DOWN!

How this changes the world

This is the first annual event for Square Fest and we are small collective, but we hope to raise BIG awareness about art and music in the surrounding area. Square Fest will feature local musicians, artisans, and assortment of vendors for the crowd to enjoy. This is a great opportunity for us to give back as much as we can to the community. The goal is to make this annual event in Savannah, GA. In three years we will be booking bands like Pearl Jam, Kid Cudi, and Al Green alongside our amazing talent from Savannah.

It Is Not Only About The Money...
We understand if you can not donate, but you can spread the word. Hit any of the social media buttons on this page and share with your people :)

Any effort is appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

“It is just music y’all!”

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steven Wright and I'm the owner of S4R Studios in New York City, a "For-Profit" business that offers services for Recording, Rehearsals, music lessons, and photography services.

 

I constructed the Project:Dig initiative because as the business started to build, many came, but most were not able to come up with the finances to pursue the goals they wanted to. So I decided that once a week I would give an hour of music lessons for free or a free rehearsal session. The word spread and more came out. We started to "dig" out those hidden talents in the community. In order to make room for this I started Project:Dig.

Expanding and growing takes a lot of funding and resources, but even for a small studio like ours, it's possible with the support of others. Understand that in backing this initiative, more kids will learn instruments. More vocalists will learn to enhance their craft. More talents will be uncovered. Your help will defy the concept of a dream.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding needed for the first phase of this project is $10,000. This will provide more space to be rented out in the facility where the Studio is located and allow us to have more resources (instruments, amps, mics, etc.) to give free services to more that are waiting. Right now we help a few, but your support will allow several people to get the opportunity to experience the reality.

Your giving is not in vain, neither is our rewards. When you contribute at least $10 and above, you will receive perks like free hours off or recording or rehearsals, free music lessons in piano guitar or drums, free photo shoots, and more. And we are happy to give as a result of your giving.

If we do not reach the goal set for this phase, we will still use remaining funds for the expansion effort and retrieve the space necessary, even if for a short time. And we will hope that the next phase will exceed our expectations and that will allow us to have a permanent mark on our goal.

The Impact

How many people do you know that have said " I used to sing" or "I used to play the piano for 10 years", and put their gift away, never to pursue that part of their life again. To them if it's not possible to achieve anything with it in their minds, it's not worth the time. We know that this isn't true. So this project is just as valuable to you, as it is to the entire world. Your gifts, talents, and capabilities are important not only to you, but will affect those around you positively. And your contribution will kickstart this realization. without you, it will not be possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help. We need you to get the word out to as many people as you can about this project. Maybe they have friends that can benefit from this program. let them know what's going on! but whatever you do, make some noise about this project .

 

Remember to use Facebook and Twitter to pass this along. Your efforts keep this thing going and pushes us closer to the goal.

story:
Hey hey!
 
I'm Jimmy, the lead singer / songwriter of Jimmy Willden and the Outtakes - a local band from Corpus Christi, Texas.
 
So, I've been playing music since I can remember, but finally hopped onto the stage, professionally, when I was fourteen. Since then, I haven't looked back. From touring the U.S, having my songs played on the radio and on soundtracks for films and television, I just keep trying to move forward.
 
And this next step is no different. The Outtakes (Reagan Johnson on bass, Garrett Cox on electric guitar, and Scott Myers on drums) formed during the summer of 2011. We've been writing songs, and performing all around town since then, and it is now time for us to record our debut album.
 
For more information about our background and who we are, feel free to visit:
 
http://www.facebook.com/JimmyWilldenOfficial
 
*********
 
The Songs & You
 
I've heard it before, and now I know it's true: From pain and anguish comes greatness.
 
Coming from a recent emotional journey, and finally climbing out of a nearly year-long songwriter's block, I can tell you, these are some of the best songs I have ever written.
 
Now all we want to do is share them with you. And so, with your help, that can happen.
 
Already, we have interest from several radio stations, a few independent labels and A & R reps, and the potential for an awesome summer tour is just on the horizon. But in order for all of that to happen, we need a product. We need our music, on tape.
 
When we reach our goal, because of you, these songs can be heard - and our 'next step' can finally begin.

What We Need & What You Get

Our GOAL is $2500, which will go directly to securing studio / recording time, mastering, and duplication.

And so, when you donate to our campaign, you will recieve some great stuff in return!! From free cds, thank-yous in our liner notes, tickets to the release party, a private show just for you, etc....You help us make our debut album, we'll make sure you get something GRAND in return.

The Impact

Of course, to most of you, I'm a stranger. Why help me? Why help our band?

This is why. The music speaks for itself.

http://www.reverbnation.com/JimmyWillden

And for a sample of the band performing live: visit:

http://soundcloud.com/search?q[fulltext]=Jimmy+...

Before this new endeavor, I have released four solo albums, all gaining their own unique success.

In 2003, I released 'Mirrors of Simplicity', which had several songs go on to be featured on soundtracks, and internet radio-play. The album's most popular song, 'Closer (the Baby song)' is still an audience favorite.

With 2006 came the release of my folk/alternative album, 'Broken & Healing.' That album spawned several radio-friendly tracks, including 'Falter', which has been featured on the soundtracks for movies and television shows, including MTV's popular dating show, 'Next.' Also, 'Broken & Healing' was the album that sent me out on my first U.S. tour (with the great talents of David Martinez and Hope Cassity).

We all have to start somewhere. The Outtakes starts here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate monetarily, you can still help us get this album made.
 
Please spread the word, and share this campaign with your friends and family.
 
Thank you for your time, and we look forward to seeing you at a show soon!

Even if you can't donate monetarily, you can still help us get this album made.
 
Please spread the word, and share this campaign with your friends and family.
 
Thank you for your time, and we look forward to seeing you at a show soon!

story:
**EMAIL OLDJAMESBAND@GMAIL.COM FOR SINGLE**

WASGWANIN' WID'IT?!?!?! 

Hey everyone! Thanks for checkin in! 

Old James is based on love and compassion. The ONE LOVE ideal runs deep within the veins of what this band is about. Not only a band, but a family with a dream to unite the world with our music.

We need your help to spread the good word and unite the world through music. Unfortunately we are not able to fund ourselves at this time.

We need your kind and very much appreciated donations in order to get our music out there, get on the road, and share ourselves with you outside of our own city. 

With your help, we will be able to come out and play for you and YOU will help US spread the love with our art! We encourage and hope you will be a part of that dream. In RETURN, we have loads of merch, music, credits and of course A BBQ to thank you for your contributions!

We hope y'all are having an amazing day, and we look forward to meeting you all at some point in the near future! 

One Love, Unite and Be Well friends! :) 

             - Old James

INCENTIVES!

New LIVE Video release EVERY WEEK During the Campaign

AFTER RAISING $500 - Will release EP Promo Photoshoot pictures

AFTER RAISING $1000 - Will release EP name

AFTER RAISING $2500 - Will release album artwork

AFTER RAISING $5000 - Will release EXCLUSIVE IndieGoGo Campaign LIVE Track

AFTER REACHING $10000 GOAL - Will release Don't Put It On Me Music Video

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Making an EP and getting it out there is hard for an unsigned band and that is where our badass backers come in. The $10,000 we're asking for will give us the chance to give our current and future fans the full Old James experience! 

Your donations will go towards:

$5000 - Production & Recording Process

$2000 - CD Pressing & Packaging 

$1200 - Touring\Merchandise\Perk Content

$1000 - EP Distribution

$800 - Music Video/Graphic Design/Media Production/Photography

In order to meet these goals we would have to raise more than our goal to cover the campaign fees but we will appriciate anything we can use to throw towards making our dream come true!

LOOK AT ALL THE SWEET STUFF WE'LL GIVE YOU!

Your donations will not leave you empty handed. Check out the EXCLUSIVE Perks you will get in return for being so awesome! Don't have a lot to give? For $2 you'll get the first single of the upcoming EP and for those with deeper pockets or business savvy, there are Exectutive Producer credits and Sales Percentage up for grabs.

Check out what you get below!

For any questions or inquiries, please contact Old James at oldjamesband@gmail.com

 

 

 BE WELL!!!! 

Like we said before, our dream is to unite the world with our music.

Peace, Love, Compassion, Unity, Trust and Selflessness is what this band is about. 

We are a family with a big goals and dreams, and we urge you to be a part of it! 

Many thanks and MUCH LOVE! 

See Y'all soon! 

CAN'T DONATE BUT STILL WANT TO HELP?!

We totally understand if you can't afford to donate but don't think that's all you can do to help us out! Word of Mouth is important so the more people that see our fundraiser the better. You can share the link below on your Facebook, Twitter, etc. Maybe you can find that super rich kid you went to school with that always had cool stuff on Facebook then post it on his wall or try to remember your Uncle's Credit Card number..

THE MORE PEOPLE WHO SEE IT, THE FASTER WE CAN GIVE YOU THE EP!

PLEASE SHARE THE LINK:  

IGG.ME/AT/OLDJAMESBAND 

Follow Old James on Twitter: @OldJamesBand

LIKE Old James on Facebook: /OldJamesBand

story:
Dear Inhabitants of Earth,

Kindly give ear to our urgent transmission concerning “Dan Zimmerman, Space Pilgrim”. It's not space travel as we know it...

We are thrilled to announce, "Dreams of Earth", the new album by Dan Zimmerman and the focus of this campaign, produced in collaboration with the Daniel Smith of Danielson and Sounds Familyre Records.

...the ship is both sturdy and well-loved. Even the sweet roar of its engine has inspired Space Pilgrim as he threads his way through asteroid belts, and on to uncharted worlds. Oh the wonders this pilgrim has to share!

What distinguishes this outing from previous albums? The space..music that reflects what is NOT heard as much as what is. Feel the compelling synergy between the voices and the instruments, as in early rock n' roll, country blues and rockabilly. The songs themselves, although they rock more than ever, are tales of reflection and search. For it is as true of Dan Zimmerman as it is of Space Pilgrim, whose story you have witnessed above, that he is at heart a seeker, a wanderer even.

As Thomas Mann said of Joseph the dreamer, "What does 'wandering' mean here?    To wander is not the same as to lose one's way. He was not lost, he was searching."

The ship's faithful trajectory to far-flung planets, however, has taken a toll. Perhaps you know of what I speak? Fuel and food resources need restocking, and the ship is in great need of repair due to the ravages of space. Most importantly, the ship's radio communication system needs significant updating for Space Pilgrim to make his next set of reports back to Earth.

Contributions made to this campaign will go toward the cost of studio sessions, studio musicians, mixing & mastering, and "Space Pilgrim" film production costs. Funds over goal will go toward promotional and touring expenses.

Join in this effort to reclaim what is in our midst. Space belongs to all of us. Take part in something momentous! Something stellar! Something stupendous!

Together we can repair “Wanderer”, Space Pilgrim’s beloved ship, so that his latest report of worlds beyond worlds can be broadcast to the good people of Earth. Join him in this extraordinary work!

story:
What is Still Point?

It is a sensation of deep peace that pervades the body and mind.  It is a sense of tranquility and relaxation so deep that the mind goes and stays quiet and the Being surrenders to a sense of liquid ease.  Healing is well received from this state of stillness.

Who am I?

My name is Tory Trujillo and Music is my first love.  I am a massage therapist and professional vocalist. Healing through touch and song is my calling. In doing this work, I am also healed.  I've been singing professionally, mostly as a side player and harmony vocalist, since 2005.  Along the way many have asked if I had an album for purchase. I agonized for some time about not having traditional singer/song writer material. Then I started working with quartz crystal singing bowls in my massage practice for healing sessions and group meditations. Eventually, I started using the bowls in individual and ensemble performance ceremony events. I knew that THIS music would be my frist cd; sacred sound music for personal healing, meditation and for use in holistic healing environments.

What is this Project?

Through the support of community, I recorded the raw tracks for my first album "Still Point" in the spring and summer of 2012 (Click the "Gallery" tab above to see and hear 3 samples of rough mix tracks). 

Now it is time to finish and launch the album.  I am reaching out to community one more time to ask for donations to accomplish this goal.  Your donations will help me to pay for

  • mixing and mastering of the album
  • traveling to North Carolina to join Karen Kane in the mixing and mastering process
  • cd cover layout fees
  • printing and distribution of the cd
  • promotion of the cd
  • delivery of your "thank you" gifts

I have chosen Indiegogo's flexible funding option.  This means that I receive all pledges as donations.  If we do not reach the goal, Indiegogo keeps 9% of those donations.  If we DO reach the goal, Indiegogo keeps only 4%.   Any donations above and beyond this goal will go towards promotion and distribution of the album.

I look forward to completing this album! My hope is that all who listen will experience Still Point.  

Thank you SO VERY MUCH for your support!! Every donation, big and small is incredibly helpful. I also hope that you will help spread the word.  Indiegogo makes it easy by offering social media share tools!

Your Perks!

Depending on your donation amount you could receive,

  • a *digital download of the whole album before the cd is released
  • a *signed copy of the cd
  • a magnet of the beautiful mandala cd cover art
  • a sneak peak of the music video "Raven Song" (this song is not on the album.  It was jnitially recorded as footage for the indiegogo campaign video but was so lovely that I couldn't let it sit unused :) )
  • a t-shirt of the beautiful mandala cover art
  • Your name in the album credits
  • a unique song created especially for you (or someone you love) and delivered to you in digital form
  • A house concert complete with me and quartz crystal singing bowl(s). 

*If you supported my Kickstarter campaign, you are already waiting for your digital download and/or cd.  If you donate again, you are welcome to gift this duplicate perk to a friend.

 From the depths of my heart, THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!!

story:
In a nutshell...

  • We are the Trey Stapleton Band and we have been playing music in Austin, TX for the last 6+ years. We have fed off of the music of artists from Texas and beyond, past and present, and we hope you might become a fan of the music that we are making!
  • This campaign is very important to us. We are workiing with folks that are tied into the music industry here in a best-effort to get a single to radio and release an EP of 6 tracks to spread our music.
  • Helping with our project allows us to work with the professionals that have the experience and understanding to take our music to the next level.

We aren't just wasting your money...

  • The money that you donate to us is going to only the finest professionals. Your money is helping us to pay for studio time, pre-production, mixing, mastering of mixes, production, duplication of CD's, demo recordings, studio musicians for various instruments (steel guitar, fiddle, bass, etc), radio promotion, and all of the unknown costs that arise when working on a major project.
  • In gratitude, we are honored to offer (for various donations): copies of the EP, signed CD's, signed photographs, merchandise, and even private shows!
  • Should we fail to reach our ultimate goal, we will still be able to wisely use the money that we do raise to release one single to radio (all recording costs involved and radio promotion) and then follow up that single with the full EP as soon as possible.

Your donation makes a difference!

  • Music is a gift to all. Any kind of music... anything that touches the soul! We take our music seriously, and hopefully the reward of knowing that you conributed to more music being available for willing ears to hear is pleasing to you, the contributor. Also, we hope that you feel good about being a part of helping an independent artist make its mark on the world!
  • We have released a full album in the past. In 2009, we released "Have a Drink on Me", an 11 track album that received some radio play in Texas. We have played hundreds of shows and, as with anything, experience makes you better. We have gained experience in all aspects of our music... songwriting, knowledge of promoting correctly, the recording process, and choosing the right people to work with. We hope that you will believe in us now!
  • This is truly a dream of ours, and a dream that we work hard for. We believe in our talent, and we believe that there are people out there who have the means to help a group like ours realize those dreams!

Don't have the means to donate??

  • If you believe in what we do, but you cannot contribute, please help by sharing our page over facebook or telling your friends and family about us. Spreading the word about our music is just as important as funding it!
  • Indiegogo also has tools that allow you to share our vision, so please utilize those if you would.

From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU

story:
Who is Petticoat Lane?

Well, right now it's really just one guy, Michael Aaron Keith. That's me! I've been playing guitar, singing and writing music since I was pretty young and I've recently (finally) released a 3 song EP titled "The Table Turned".

But now I need to move on to bigger and better things. My current goals are:

  • Record a full length album.
  • Turn Petticoat Lane into a band as opposed to a solo project.
  • Play shows, tour and promote the album.

So this is where YOU come in.  Right now I am one man and the costs of paying studio musicians, recording, mixing, mastering, distributing and promoting are... well they're pretty high.

What We Need & What You Get

By making a donation based on the packages to the right you will not only help with the costs of recording and distribution/promotion, you will also get perks:

  • Downloads
  • CD's
  • Merch
  • + More

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation, it's all good! However, perhaps you could do one (or all) of the following:

  • SHARE this campaign! Spread the word, link it, pass it along to music lovers who may want to help.
  • LIKE Petticoat Lane on Facebook
  • FOLLOW Petticoat Lane on Twitter
  • STREAM the EP on BandCamp

Whatever you do, you're helping, and it means a lot! So thank you!!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NOTES REGARDING PERKS

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD:

  • Your download will include both explicit and clean versions of the album (should both be produced)

PHYSICAL COPY (CD):

  • There will only be one version, most likely explicit.

T-SHIRT:

  • No shirts have been designed/printed yet.
  • Every effort will be made to send the size/style you request once options become available.

story:
My name is Alexandria. I am a proud union musician member of American Federation of Musicians Local 349 Manchester, New Hampshire.

ALEXANDRIA KNOX at WE WERE NOT BORN TO FOLLOW 2013        

 

I started this journey when I got chosen by the Philadelphia, PA Mayday Commitee to perform for Mayday celebrations this year.

MayDay 2013 Performance Philadelphia, PA Bagpiper

I volunteered and had a wonderful host family and loved it so much that I wanted to continue this tour around the country performing as a volunteer union bagpiper for my brothers and sisters in the labor movement. I wanted a way to give back to the labor movement, because they have done so much for me and changed my life. I am totally visually impaired, but the labor movement treats me like a normal person. From the day I joined the AFM when I lived in Savannah, Local 447-704, the union has accepted me with open arms and love and so much solidarity. I have never found an organization as accepting, kind, and loving as the labor movement. My goal in volunteering to perform for labor events is to help show how inclusive the labor movement is so that hopefully others will join the union family. I want to especially help more fellow workers with disabilities get involved and show how the American Federation of Musicians can benefit other working performers. My goal is to tour performing in all fifty states. Union brothers and sisters like the president of my union Ray Hair and so many others have inspired me to attend the National Labor College starting Fall 2013 so I can become a leader in the labor movement like those I look up to so much. Traditional highland music is a great way to give back because I get to help make events even more fun and sometimes even help honor my lost union brothers and sisters at memorial services like I was honored to do when I performed for my local AFL-CIO here in NH for our Workers' Memorial Day. There are not many of us union bagpipers in the United States, so I am unique.

There was no greater moment in my professional musician life than performing for the crowd in Philly representing my union.

May Day 2013 Performance Ending Bagpipes

My amazing journey continued when I was selected to perform at the Teamster Womens' Facebook Group  Retreat in Knoxville, TN in June of this year. It was a great time and I learned so much.

Performing for Union Women We Weren't Born to Follow 2013 retreat. Solo bagpiper AFM Local 349        

 

I was very lucky to have just returned from the Great Labor Arts Exchange 2013 winning one of the Julius Margolin youth in labor scholarships. I got to perform there in Baltimore, MD for the big concert and it was a great weekend. We had lots of workshops on creative organizing and I learned so much from my more experienced union brothers and sisters about union leadership.

Amazing Grace Performed for the Great Labor Arts Exch…

 

My goal is to keep this tour going and keep giving back to the labor movement as a proud union member. The next event I am in the process of planning to perform for Labor Day for the Western Wisconscin AFL-CIO. If all goes well with lagistics and fundraising, I get to go to another city I have not been to before and perform for some more awesome union brothers and sisters.

I am seeking funding to help cut costs for those I perform for since I am volunteering for expenses like air travel, and also to help with instrument maintenance expenses.

If you donate $5 and above your name or organization can be put on my website on my tour page if you request.

If your labor organization would like to have me perform at your event, please contact me. I volunteer as a union musician and just need expenses for travel and a host family or other housing during my stay. Let's keep this tour going.

In solidarity,

Alexandria, AFM Local 349

I volunteered and had a wonderful host family and loved it so much that I wanted to continue this tour around the country performing as a volunteer union bagpiper for my brothers and sisters in the labor movement. I wanted a way to give back to the labor movement, because they have done so much for me and changed my life. I am totally visually impaired, but the labor movement treats me like a normal person. From the day I joined the AFM when I lived in Savannah, Local 447-704, the union has accepted me with open arms and love and so much solidarity. I have never found an organization as accepting, kind, and loving as the labor movement. My goal in volunteering to perform for labor events is to help show how inclusive the labor movement is so that hopefully others will join the union family. I want to especially help more fellow workers with disabilities get involved and show how the American Federation of Musicians can benefit other working performers. My goal is to tour performing in all fifty states. Union brothers and sisters like the president of my union Ray Hair and so many others have inspired me to attend the National Labor College starting Fall 2013 so I can become a leader in the labor movement like those I look up to so much. Traditional highland music is a great way to give back because I get to help make events even more fun and sometimes even help honor my lost union brothers and sisters at memorial services like I was honored to do when I performed for my local AFL-CIO here in NH for our Workers' Memorial Day. There are not many of us union bagpipers in the United States, so I am unique.
There was no greater moment in my professional musician life than performing for the crowd in Philly representing my union.
May Day 2013 Performance Ending Bagpipes
My amazing journey continued when I was selected to perform at the Teamster Womens' Facebook Group  Retreat in Knoxville, TN in June of this year. It was a great time and I learned so much.
Performing for Union Women We Weren't Born to Follow 2013 retreat. Solo bagpiper AFM Local 349         
 
I was very lucky to have just returned from the Great Labor Arts Exchange 2013 winning one of the Julius Margolin youth in labor scholarships. I got to perform there in Baltimore, MD for the big concert and it was a great weekend. We had lots of workshops on creative organizing and I learned so much from my more experienced union brothers and sisters about union leadership.
Amazing Grace Performed for the Great Labor Arts Exch…
 
My goal is to keep this tour going and keep giving back to the labor movement as a proud union member. The next event I am in the process of planning to perform for Labor Day for the Western Wisconscin AFL-CIO. If all goes well with lagistics and fundraising, I get to go to another city I have not been to before and perform for some more awesome union brothers and sisters.
I am seeking funding to help cut costs for those I perform for since I am volunteering for expenses like air travel, and also to help with instrument maintenance expenses.
If you donate $5 and above your name or organization can be put on my website on my tour page if you request.
If your labor organization would like to have me perform at your event, please contact me. I volunteer as a union musician and just need expenses for travel and a host family or other housing during my stay. Let's keep this tour going.
In solidarity,
Alexandria, AFM Local 349

story:
What's it about?

The Musical Offering is a community music school located in Evanston, Illinois. Founded in 2000, The Musical Offering acts as a hub for a diverse community through music study, outreach and performance. It serves as a place of learning and a place of creativity that sparks a love and understanding of music in every student and performer.

In 2012 the Musical Offering met a major milestone by doubling available studio space and creating a beautiful performance venue with seating for 65 people, the Madison Room. Through fundraising support, we are nearly halfway to our goal of raising $30,000 to cover construction costs. Each dollar raised in this campaign allows us to retire our debt and redirect our fundraising efforts back into the people--the creators and collaborators--that make this school community music school such a special place. 

Our History

The Musical Offering was founded in 2000 by Rick Ferguson and Kirsten Hedegaard. With two other like-minded professional musicians, they began with a small space and 25 students. Each shared a common philosophy on the role of the arts – specifically that music is a positive force in society, in education and in the family. Their goal was to create a place where people could learn to play music, learn to understand music, and come together to create music.

Today, the school has more than 150 students ranging from toddlers to adults with thriving studios in piano, voice, strings and growing program in winds as well as an expanding chamber and composition program. The Musical Offering has always integrated composition study as an integral part of the curriculum, which prompted a group of students to combine their efforts and propose an original operetta. Now, student-composed, written, produced, performed, and acted musical dramas are a fall tradition.

The Musical Offering is inclusive; anybody with an interest in music is welcomed and nurtured. Students come primarily from Evanston, many near our location in south Evanston. We’re able to offer need-based scholarships thanks to the support of generous donors. The Musical Offering also conducts annual outreach programs in the Evanston public schools.

Programmatically, the Musical Offering vision is evolving and growing. This growth is manifested in the commissioning of new works which are brought to local schools, and in being a venue for the new student works featured in our fall productions. The Musical Offering is becoming a destination for concerts and a burgeoning hub for New Music, in the form of the nascent composers’ forum as well as the formation of a student New Music ensemble.

All of this growth brings excitement and challenges. We invite you to join us as we grow, to share the gift of music, and to help us spread the word about what we do.


What We Need & What You Get

In 2011, The Musical Offering assumed a $30,000 loan to expand our facilities and create The Madison Room.  The Madison Room is a performance hall that can accommodate 65 people.  It is the home of the Music on Madison concert series (themusicaloffering.org/mo/performances), in addition to a place for group classes, our Sunday Series masterclasses and workshops, and community gatherings such as meetings for art organizations.

Since April, 2013 we have been able to pay down almost half the loan!  We urgently need to pay down the rest of the loan in order to be able to focus all of our resources on our students, our concert series, and outreach programs.  We are looking to raise at least $7500 to go toward this loan payback.  This would relieve us of a lot of pressure and put us in a position to comfortably work toward a complete payback of the loan.

In thanks for contributing to our campaign and supporting our students and the programs from which they benefit, we offer many incentives that are keeping within the spirit of The Madison Room and our schools artistic aims.  The incentives range from heartfelt thanks to tickets to our Music on Madison concert series to an in-home concert by Musical Offering faculty to a brand new composition written in your honor.  Please see the list of incentives to the right to see exactly what you would receive. 

The Impact

Although we believe our incentives are pretty persuasive, especially, a concert in your home or the commission of new musical work in your honor, every dollar we raise in this campaign allows us to retire our debt and redirect our fundraising efforts back into support for music study, outreach and performance. We know that ultimately, it’s the people that make this school community music school such a special place.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, you can still help by sharing this with your friends, family, followers, subscribers and connections! Post it, tweet it, email the link, and leverage your circle’s social power. Any or all will help us! And check back regularly, to monitor our progress.

The Musical Offering always welcomes committed volunteers. If you have an interest in contributing your time to our community music school, please contact Kevin at operations@themusicaloffering.org.  Let us know what your interests, skills, or talents might be, and we'll find a way for you to help.

Thanks for exploring The Musical Offering Indiegogo campaign. Let’s share music together!

story:
Why do we have Christmas Carols but not Easter Carols?

  • I want to make the first Easter Carols album in the world. It will be titled: Easter Is Here (Jayee Easter). In addition to Easter Carols, it will include songs about Lent, Palm Sunday, Good Friday, the Resurrection and Easter Kids Carols.
  • There will also be two reflective songs and a tribute song to all the people suffering in the Middle East and the world.

Hi, my name is Wafic. I'm a singer/songwriter with two produced Christmas CDs in the past plus a newly released Christmas single that came out Dec. 6 2012.

I have been trying to produce this ambitious Easter album for three years and now I think is the perfect time to make it a reality all because of your awesome help and support.

Easter Is Here (Jayee Easter) album Cost:

  • The total project cost will be $12,000 that will cover studio recording of 13 songs, press & printing of CDs plus miscellaneous expenses that come with such a big project.
  • I am hoping to raise close to $8,000 or more through this indiegogo campaign. But, whatever is raised on here will still help defray the cost of putting such an ambitious album, so please remember that every pledge helps,  EVEN if we don’t reach the entire goal it will still help. Thank you in advance :)

Christmas is great but Easter is a bigger Holiday!

Easter Deserves Its Spotlight Too:

  • Kids will be exposed to new Easter Carols that will help them speak Arabic and learn about Easter in a fun and enjoyable way.
  • Adults all over the world will be exposed to new Easter Carols that will become traditional timely carols plus some traditional Good Friday hymns that have been sung for hundred of years in the Byzantine and Maronite churches.

Can you pull it off?

  • My first Christmas CD "Talj el Milad' sold out the first year it came out.
  • My second Christmas CD "Jayee Papa Noel" was turned into a successful Christmas Show that tours the country around Christmas time helping kids and adults alike prepare for Christmas with fun and joyful way.
  • It is normal to hear Christmas songs playing on radio during the season. I am proud to share that my Epiphany song has played on commercial radio, including a top ten secular radio in the Middle East, on the day of Epihany.
  • I have several music videos that you can check on my YouTube channel, just type in the search my name: Wafic Khalil.
  • My latest Christmas song (and first one I sing in English) debuted December

Thank You!

I appreciate you reading this. I am grateful to have you part of my life.

  • Can you please share with your family and friends my Easter album campaign on your FaceBook, Twitter or via email? Here's the link: indiegogo.com/WaficEaster

Thank you,
Wafic

story:
My name is Thad, and I am a singer/songwriter from Toronto, Canada!

I guess here is my story, of how I got where I am now...


I grew up in a small town, and at the age of 9 I started writing my own songs.

Growing up in a small town as a gay person can be difficult - especially when you're really not at all like the other boys. I got bullied a lot as a kid, and I would turn to my writing to make me feel better - for years I never told anybody that I was writing songs, but eventually, I did. I have a passion for music, and since a young age I wanted to be a performer - I would put all of my stuffed animals on my bed, pretend like I was on a stage, and sing into one of those dollar store echo-microphones. I owned countless dollar store echo-microphones.


My fascination with writing songs eventually lead to me taking up playing the guitar, at which I am self-taught, as well as the bass guitar and sometimes the piano. I started recording the songs that I wrote using a cheap computer microphone and my computer at home at the age of 15. 


Since then, I have come a long way. I have grown much more comfortable with the strong gay man that I have become. I have grown much more comfortable with the artist that I have become. And I've recorded an EP in a real recording studio, and released it for free for the people who have been supporting me all along.


Here's the thing.


Loving music is one thing - but eating, sleeping, breathing music is quite another. Without music in my life, I honestly don't know where I would be today. But when you create music - it gets expensive. I remember a full summer of spending almost all of my hard-earned dollars on rent, recording sessions, and the occasional food item. It's been a struggle. I've done my best. I feel successful.


There's a next step in my career - and it's finally happening for me. I'm excited to say that I am recording a song with an exciting new music producer, who basically will also help me "get the song heard" by more people - including industry execs, tv and movie licensing people, and others. He's fantastic, has a great track record, and can even help me to get other funding for another song, a record, or a music video if the song is good enough. (IT IS.) I start working with him on September 5, 2014.


I work full-time. and am attending college part-time. I'm also seeking a part-time job to help cover the cost of recording with him. (He does great work, but not for free!)


The cost of recording and all things associated with my new song, will be $3000.


That's A LOT of money. And I am willing to pay it! However, crowdfunding exists for projects such as this one, and I see this as a way of possibly offsetting the cost a bit, and allowing my friends and fans an opportunity to get their hands on something cool for helping out! I've put a couple of perks on the menu, if you're interested. If you at all feel like helping out an artist who's just trying to make it in the music industry, in hopes to spread a message of acceptance, and love... then please contribute here! I will shamelessly self-promote here - My new song is ALL about accepting yourself and fighting back the haters in a positive way, and is a seriously great and catchy song! I really want the world to hear it - and would appreciate any help I can get in making that happen.

story:
Short Summary

Star Cross'd Destiny is a Cajun-spiced elemental superpowered drama that takes place in mob-society New Orleans. One of the most unique things about this comic is its creator composed soundtrack!

  • OST Beta is an full-length, multi-genre album featuring everything from the full symphony, to the high energy rock, and industrial electronic grooves.
  • SCD recently had a very successful Kickstarter to fund its second volume's printing, but its counterpart, the OST, was an afterthought. I had no idea how incredible this record was going to turn out. I had planned to do all the mixing in house and not master it, planning only a digital release. But then it grew and expanded. Many studio days were booked, scores of musicians donated their time, and even now, the record is still amassing more epic sounds with additional studio time booked!
  • So many people came together to make this record possible. While OST Alpha was a single effort, OST Beta has become the work of a truly talented ensemble of folks. To not let it be properly mastered and pressed would be an injustice to all their hard work. Your contribution will help give this project the finish it deserves!


All contributors to this campaign will get an exclusive download of a bonus track only to be released on this pressing of the soundtrack and an exclusive signed mini print!


    What We Need & What You Get

    Let's break it down:

    • At a minimum, at least $400-$500 will be needed to get the record mastered at a professional mastering house. I will be using the same mastering house that my band Absinthe Junk has used on its latest release. There is still at least one day's worth of recording to finish up the strings and brass which will be done at Reel Love Recording Company in Nashville. Lastly, CDs will need to be pressed. This record will be a short-run (around $350) but any additional funds will be used to get the record digital distribution and will also go to tipping out the many musicians who have contributed their time to this project. And of course fulfillment.
    • Helping this campaign will get you a copy of the original first pressing - originally only available through the Volume 2 Kickstarter. You'll get an exclusive early download of the completed record too. Additional options include getting the record signed, a special Star Cross'd Destiny vinyl sticker to commemorate the occasion, and on the off chance you missed reserving your copy of Volume 2, you can add that in as well!
    • If we don't reach the ultimate goal, all funding will still go as far as it can to helping get the OST finished.

    The Impact

    Dig it?

    • This project has been a part of my life for over a decade, and this portion of it, the second OST, has been one of the most incredible experiences. This is some of the best music I have composed in my lifetime to date.
    • This will be my second OST to be released for the Star Cross'd Destiny, and my fifth record released overall.
    • This is as grassroots as it gets. I'm the composer here. I played a majority of the instrumentation myself - instruments which I taught myself how to play some two decades ago. The musicians I've enlisted to add their majesty are my closest friends and people who inspire me to no end. But there isn't a band here. It's just one girl with a lot noise in her head and the incredible support of some amazing friends!

    Risks & Challenges

    These guys...

    • Luckily the record itself is nearly completed. It's just a matter of wrapping up the last instrumentation and composition and getting it past the mixing stage. Obviously, fulfillment will be the greatest challenge as this campaigns conclusion will run right along with the fulfilling of SCD's Volume 2.
    • Hopefully I can overcome this main challenge by enlisting friends to help package and ship these little CD buddies out to you all in a hasty and timely matter.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute monetarily, that's ok!

    • Please consider helping get the word out about Star Cross'd Destiny, its comic, and its soundtrack. The story is online for free and my greatest happiness is simply sharing it with the world.
    • Use the Share tools here! Post to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr - help me get the word out! Not very many people even know that Star Cross'd Destiny has a soundtrack. It's about time we fixed that!

    Let's make an awesome and epic record friends!

 Use the Share tools here! Post to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr - help me get the word out! Not very many people even know that Star Cross'd Destiny has a soundtrack. It's about time we fixed that!
  Let's make an awesome and epic record friends!

story:
The Story

Bound

Bound was first conceived by Jerod Show in Tulsa, OK, during the fall of 2007. He set out to form a band which would spark the soul back into metal, much in the same vein of 70's heavy metal innovators such as Deep Purple, Black Sabbath and Motorhead.

By laying a solid foundation under the bridge that combines agression and groove, the rock phenomenon known as BOUND was formed. This band writes and performs original music with gritty vocals, heavy rock riffs, and a rhythm section that provides a tightly structured groove that is essential to their unique sound which brings a fresh, new perspective on metal music.

 

Producer Elan Morrison

Elan Morrison is an accomplished American music producer and songwriter. He has created a successful career producing, engineering and writing for artists such as Dr. Dre, Slash, Sean “P Diddy” Combs, Bones, Brandy, Booker T, E3, Boot Camp Clique, Prophet & DJ Skittles, Ray J., Seal, Slayer, Toni Braxton, and Tres as along with corporate clientele including Hummer, Mercedes-Benz and Motorola.

Elan is originally from Baltimore and has since split his time between New York, South Florida and Los Angeles, connecting with some of the greatest musicians and artists of our time along with way. He is a classically trained pianist who brings his unique sound to all of his music - a distinct style that has helped take multiple artists Platinum.

The House That Rock Built

Based in the Denver area, the House that Rock Built serves as a community that helps the youth express themselves through music. We provide programs free of cost where they can learn music through quality training. Music is an avenue for self expression and a gateway for releasing internalized emotions. We believe it has the power to help children and youth remain emotionally healthier and support their overall ability to learn.  We're building a revolution by providing the youth a chance to learn music and supporting our future generations.

The Impact

The dedicated and hard working musicians that are Bound, have strived and successfully made their mark in the Tulsa music scene. Through their own efforts they have raised a great deal of the funding required to get on the road and promote their sound on a national level.With full time jobs and local gigs practically every weekend, it is rare to find a group with as much talent that is more driven.  

The main focus the last several months has been writing and perfecting new music that will help elevate this band into a well known national and international act. They just need a little assistance to accomplish this final goal and get them on the road to support the new release.

Several music industry professionals have taken notice of Bound, including the international rock webzine Alternative Revolt Magazine, and are eagerly awaiting the new release. Further interest from PR, management, labels and booking agencies are also right in line...along with Producer Elan Morrison's desire and willingness to work at a highly reduced rate to get Bound in the studio!

The members of Bound and Elan all coming from hard working class backgrounds, and fully realize the profound impact music can have on a child. They are all grateful for the opportunities that have been given to them, and know that through hard work those dreams can become reality. Collectively, they want to share some of their good fortune, and help children that may not ever have the chance to hold an instrument in their hands otherwise. 

The House That Rock Built's students are emotionally healthier and are less likely to drink and do drugs. As schools around the country are cutting funding to arts programs, especially music, The House that Rock Built will subsidize these budget cuts with the after school facility, and with support and additional funding, and hope to launch their programs on a national level. 

They are in urgent need of donations as they re-develop their website and marketing collateral to help spread the word for their organization, the facility, and the resources required to make their programs a success!

What We Need & What You Get

Bound seeks the investment of $2500.00 which will help cover studio costs. $0.20 for every dollar donated will go directly to the House That Rock Built.

On top of the the fact that 20% of your donation goes right to a great cause, Bound is offering some fun perks including merchandise, downloads of the new recording, and liner note credits!

$5.00 donation: A great big thanks and mention on our social and viral video networks of your donation!

$10.00 donation: A great big thanks, mention on our social/video networks, and we will mail you a Bound band button!

$25.00 donation: Thanks/mention, button, plus a QR code for a free single download at release of the new recordings!

$50.00 donation: Thanks/mention, button, QR code for single download plus a Bound T-shirt!

$100.00 donation: Thanks/mention, button, QR code for single download, T-shirt, and a liner note credit!

$200.00 donation: Thanks/mention, button, QR code for the full EP download at release, T-shirt and a "Special Thanks" liner note credit!

If we exceed our goal of $2500.00, 75% of all additional funds will go directly to The House that Rock Built!

Other Ways You Can Help

In these trying economic times, we know not everyone can donate money. However, you can still support this project by sharing with your friends and family, and know that your efforts make a difference!

Please help us by using the quick and easy Indiegogo sharing tools!

 

From Bound, Elan and The House That Rock Built, we thank you in advance for your support!


For more information on all parties involved, please visit:

www.boundrocks.com

http://www.facebook.com/Boundbandpage
 
http://www.elanmorrison.com/
 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Producer-Elan-Morrison/245037855518608

 http://www.facebook.com/HTRBmusic


Special thanks to Angela Adams and Brian Gerbetz at Alternative Revolt Magazine

www.altrevolt.com

story:
Hotel Elefant is a contemporary music ensemble dedicated to the works of innovative, living composers. We’re passionate about new music, and we’re raising funds to help bring our mission to audiences like you!

ABOUT: With a flexible roster of over 20 musicians, this adventurous ensemble redefines the concert experience through encouraged dialogue with composers, performers, and audiences. Currently in its first season of operation, Hotel Elefant presents new music through commissions, performances, and moderated discussions.

WHY WE’RE EXCITED ABOUT THIS GROUP & OUR 1st SEASON: We love the sounds of our time, and we believe this music can be better appreciated when its purpose is understood. Exploring the theme of “Remembrance” in our 2012 season, we’re digging into music that tackles this subject head-on. Not only will we be performing this music for you, but our moderator James Holt will also go behind-the-scenes to speak with our resident musicians and featured composers to open up a conversation between artists and audiences.

HOW YOU CAN HELP: Your generosity will contribute greatly to our Nov 1st, 2012 concert at The DiMenna Center for Classical Music featuring composer Michael Gordon with works by Michelle Lou and Angélica Negrón (we're very excited about it)! Your donations will help provide stipends to our artists who devote so much of their time and talents to performing contemporary music.  It will also help cover the costs of renting rehearsal/performance spaces, insurance/licensing fees, instrument/equipment/technology rentals, travel/commuting costs, and recording in the very expensive city of New York!

Any funds gathered beyond our goal will be used to launch our composer commissioning fund. 

We’d like to return your kindness with some great gifts! Thanks for letting us share our project with you, and thank you for supporting living music!

 
Warm wishes,
Leaha Maria Villarreal & Mary Kouyoumdjian
(Co-Founders, Artistic & Executive Directors)

story:
Our Story

Hey there, I'm Jon Beals. I have a one man band from San Diego, Ca. I just recently recorded some material and am making it my goal to put out a 45 this year. This project means a lot to me and I would love to have something released with it.

Thanks for helping me with my goal.

 If the goal is not reached I will cover the difference with money made from shows.

Here's a preview

http://bearslim.bandcamp.com/

story:
Help Gordon Roque Record his Brand New Album

My name is Gordon Roque, and I am a Nashville-based singer/songwriter/pianist.  I've spent the last three years writing songs for my brand new full-length album of music.  Back in 2008, I released my first album, "Seahorses", and I've drawn on that experience to build what I believe to be a passionate and effusive musical landscape with these new songs.

Why?

I am asking for your help because as an independent artist without the funding of a record label, resources needed to record music well are financially out of reach.  

I am a hard-working musician with a desire to make lyrical, whimsical, and dramatic music for all ages to enjoy and be inspired by.  All the music and  albums you buy, films you see, and the books you read are largely made possible through some kind of financial backing.  My new album is no different.  

What for?

Funds are needed for equipment and space rental, mixing, mastering, production for a music video, and payment for each of the valuable and talented musicians and sound engineers involved in bringing this music to life.  I have a goal of $3,500 to help meet all of these needs.  

Gifts For You

Ultimately, I am asking only for what you can give.  Every single cent will go a long way.

There are numerous donation levels built into this campaign, and each level offers worthwhile gifts for your generosity.

From the seedling level to the rain forest, various packages include advance copies of the new album, physical copies of my first album "Seahorses", signed original artwork, a cd copy of b-sides from the recording sessions, original songs written from your ideas, hand-knitted scarves made by me, youtube interpretive or booty-poppin' dancing by yours truly, and house concerts.

By the way, you read that correctly.  For certain packages, I will make a youtube video of myself dancing for two minutes and making a complete spectacle (or fool) of myself for all the world to see.  My family and close friends can attest that I am a crazy dancer.  Donors have the option of choosing either a pitiful and hysterical interpretive dance or a booty-poppin', hip-hop inspired number. (I've been told that I can dance like a fly girl.  Go figure.)  I am doing this for the love of my craft.  May the Lord help us all!!!

Help Spread the Word

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, please help me spread the word about this campaign to more people who possibly can give funds.  You can post links and my videos on facebook, twitter, and anywhere else you like as well as tell your friends.

Furthermore, I'll be broadcasting more videos such as those shown so far throughout this campaign showcasing all kinds of things.  

What This Means

At the end of the day, I will have an album to present to all of the world.  It will be a collection of music that is a tribute to my Mom and a reflection of my  life over the past few years.  It will be a tender and gentle road map of how I have come to understand what love is and, ultimately, what it means to love myself.

I hope you will join me in this journey.

story:
Short Summary

The songs on this album celebrate life, love, hope, perseverance, and above all, an enduring trust in God. Over the past few months we have been pursuing our dream of releasing a gospel and inspirational album. We have a fun and engaging album on the way, featuring a mélange of sounds from Gospel, Reggae, Zouk, Highlife (Ghana), Hymns and Contemporary Christian. Yes, there’s something for everyone. In the past few years we experienced a mixture of truimph and pain–we each lost a beloved sister. Through these seasons our music sustained us, and we want to share it with others.

What We Need & What You Get

This album is as an independent project, so we welcome any support we can get to make it a success.  The funds raised are going towards finishing up the production and promoting the album. Top priorities for disbursing the funds are:

- CD cover design and CD duplication

- Album promotion, especially for launch concert

- Musicians and supporting vocalists for album launch

- Making music video for title song RISE

We are truly grateful for your support. It means a lot, and in appreciation we are offering free downloads and copies of the CD. 

The Impact

Your support will bring to reality an uplifting collection of songs that have inspired and invigorated us, and we believe this album will do the same for others.

Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome your best wishes and enduring support. That's been a big part of what we have accomplished so far.

story:
Our Story

What started as humble beginnings for guitarist Chase Robbins and vocalist Jaimeson Robbins, who alongside a single Macbook played venues and house shows in the North Texas area, is steadily developing into one of the best indie rock ‘n roll-blues bands in the region. With the addition of bass player Kristin Leigh, previously of the Dallas-based band Pale Horse, and Steve Phillips on drums, their live show was catapulted to a new level of energy and rhythm. In late 2010, fellow guitarist Carson Coldiron was the fifth and final member added
to the band's rock 'n roll repertoire, filling out the band's overall sound.


Drawing inspiration from artists like Led Zeppelin and legendary bluesman Howlin' Wolf, The Virgin Wolves' sound is predominantly upbeat rock 'n roll with a twist of fierce, bluesy, matter-of-fact vocals. Their live shows are unparalleled in terms of energy and sex appeal.

The Virgin Wolves have been featured on “The Local Show”, a weekly presentation of DFW artists on Dallas's Clear Channel station 102.1 The Edge, as well as radio stations ranging from Houston to Maine. In just a short time on the scene, the band has garnered the attention of numerous music blogs, college newspapers and various media outlets. Their first self-titled EP, released in June of 2010, set the stage for the band to play larger shows, as they began drawing in an eager and diverse audience. In March, 2011 they were invited to play at 35
Conferette, Denton's annual music festival which boasts larger national acts such as Outkast's Big Boi, Reggie Watts, legendary artist Mavis Staples and Dr. Dog. One month later they released Bad Blood, their second and most highly praised album, for which audiences have responded to with excitement.

As blogger and musician Robbie D. Love from rockandrollblues.com puts it, "We definitely believe The Virgin Wolves will leave their stain on rock 'n roll as innovators of the genre. They know how to get down and dirty, tell a shipwrecked story, break some shit and get out before anybody realizes the walls just burnt down to the ground."

Bio By: Rachel Watts
Contributing Writer with NTDaily.com and DayBowBow.net


What We Need & What You Get

We are attempting to raise $3500.  The money will be used as tour support for our upcoming Bad Blood tour in August. As a band that is totally DIY, tour is a tough idea.  However, it's a tough idea that we are committed to. 

Here's the breakdown:

       - $2000 - Gas.  (Isn't that turrible?!?)

       - $500 - Food.  ($5/day per person....starving artists, but not dead artists.)

       - $500 - Merch / Gear.  (Two weeks worth.)

       - $500 - Emergency Money.  (In the case of catastrophic transportation or gear failure.)

For a total of:  $3500. 

Every bit makes a difference and is appreciated from the bottom of our little rock'n'roll hearts.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!   We love you all.  Now, love us back!  Unleash our info on all of your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Wordpress, and all other social media friends!  

COME TO A SHOW!  Come hang out with us!  Donate just a little money and come for free=)

SEND A CARE PACKAGE!  If you'd like to send a case of bottled water, a box of Emergen-C, clean socks, a 12-pack or any other necessary items please shoot us an email!  We'd love the help!

story:
Who is OwlCappella

Formed in Fall 2010, OwlCappella is Temple University's first co-ed a cappella group. In only three years of existence we've accomplished great things, including singing at the Philadelphia Car Show, opening for the 85th Annual Radio City Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall in New York City, and singing in and around Temple and Philadelphia. Our name has already begun spreading all over the world, through collaboration with a cappella groups and fans as far as China. Last year we released Owl or Nothing, our very first studio EP. 

Why We Need Help

Since the release of last year's EP, Owl or Nothing, the group has changed dramatically - only 9 of the 17 current members recorded on that CD! So, we're ready to capture this group's unique and electric sound. And, with some of our members having experience in the studio last year, we now know how to be even more creative and efficient with our time, so we're excited to turn everybody's generosity into a unique and ground-breaking CD that everybody will enjoy. To do this though, as a not for profit group, we must rely on fan support to raise the necessary funds.

Your Impact

Every second in the studio counts, so every dollar is going to directly impact our final product. You'll not only have a direct hand in helping us share our music with thousands of people, but you'll also be helping us grow as musicians as well as create an experience that we will cherish for the rest of our lives. AND, you'll get OWLSOME perks to show for it such as Snapchats, CDs, and T-Shirts! 

T-Shirt

WE FINALLY HAVE FAN T-SHIRTS! Check out this awesome shirt, which is available via all $25+ donations. If you'd like to purchase one separately, please contact us!

THIS COULD BE YOURS

Other Ways You Can Support Us

Can't donate? We still love you! Just help spread the word!

Feel free to like us on Facebook, mention us on Twitter, show off our YouTube videos to your friends and family, or even check out our performance dates on owlcappella.com to support us in person!

Thank you so much for your support!
